362	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ABANDONED PROPERTY (CONTROL, MANAGEMENT AND DISPOSAL) ORDER 1972</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ABANDONED PROPERTY (CONTROL, MANAGEMENT AND DISPOSAL) ORDER, 1972, </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">BANGLADESH (PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 16 OF 1972).[28th February, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for the control, management and disposal of certain property abandoned by certain persons who are not present in Bangladesh or whose whereabouts are not known or who have ceased to occupy or supervise or manage in person their property, or who are enemy aliens;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, 1971, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) “abandoned property” means any property owned by any person who is not present in Bangladesh or whose whereabouts are not known or who has ceased to occupy, supervise or manage in person his property, including-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) any property owned by any person who is a citizen of a State which at any time after the 25th day of March, 1971, was at war with or engaged in military operations against the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) any property taken over under the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) Order, 1972 (Acting President's Order No. 1 of 1972), but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any property the owner of which is residing outside Bangladesh for any purpose which, in the opinion of the Government, is not prejudicial to the interest of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any property which is in the possession or under the control of the Government under any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation: “Person who is not present in Bangladesh” includes any body of persons or company constituted or incorporated in the territory or under the laws of a State which at any time after the 25th day of March, 1971, was at war with or engaged in military operations against the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (1A) “authorised officer” means an officer authorised by the Government for the purpose of this Order;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) “Company” includes a banking company and insurance company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) “prescribed” means prescribed by any rule, order or direction made or given in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) “property” means property of any kind, movable or immovable and includes any right or interest in such property and any debt or actionable claim, any security or negotiable instrument, any right under a contract and any industrial or commercial undertaking.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation: “Security” includes share, scrip, stock, bond, debenture, debenture stock or other marketable security of a like nature in or of any body corporate and Government security.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Order and any rule made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. On the commencement of this Order, all abandoned properties in Bangladesh shall vest in the Government and shall be administered, controlled, managed and disposed of, by transfer or otherwise, in accordance with the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) For the purpose of carrying the provisions of this Order into effect, and in particular for the purpose of securing, administration, control, management and disposal, by transfer or otherwise, of abandoned property, the Government may take such measures as it considers necessary or expedient and do all acts and incur all expenses necessary or incidental thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, the Government may, for the said purposes,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        constitute one or more Boards for such area or areas or for such abandoned property or such class or classes of abandoned properties and in such manner as may be prescribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        appoint an administrator for any abandoned property on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        carry on the business in respect of any abandoned property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        take action for recovering any money in respect of any abandoned property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        make any contract and execute any document in respect of any abandoned property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         institute, defend or continue any suit or other legal proceeding, refer any dispute to arbitration and compromise any debts, claims or liabilities arising out of or in connection with any abandoned property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        raise on the security of any abandoned property such loans as may be necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) pay taxes, duties, cesses and rates to the Government or to any local authority in respect of abandoned property; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         transfer by way of sale, mortgage or lease, or otherwise dispose of, any abandoned property or any easement, interest, profit or right, present or future, arising therefrom or incidental thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. No person shall, except in accordance with the provisions of this Order or any rules made thereunder, transfer any abandoned property in any manner or create any charge or encumbrance on such property, and any transfer made or charge or encumbrance created in contravention of this Order shall be null and void.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Where any abandoned property is not in possession of any person, the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate, 2[ or the authorised officer] shall take possession of the property in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any abandoned property is in possession of any person, such person shall, within seven days of the commencement of this Order, surrender such property to the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate, 3[ or the authorised officer].</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where the person in possession of any abandoned property fails to surrender such property as he is required to do under clause (2), the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate, 4[ or the authorised officer] shall serve a notice on him in the prescribed manner requiring him to surrender possession of the property, within seven days of the service of the notice, to the person mentioned in the notice or to show-cause against such surrender within the said period and, if he fails to do so, the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate, 5[ or the authorised officer] shall take possession of the property in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where the person on whom a notice is served under clause (3) shows cause, within the period specified in that clause, against the surrender of the abandoned property, the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate, 6[ or the authorised officer] as the case may be, shall, after making such local enquiry as he may consider necessary and after giving the person an opportunity of being heard, pass such order as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Where any abandoned property consists of shares in any company,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Government shall be deemed to be the registered holder of such shares and, notwithstanding anything in the memorandum or articles of association of the company or in any agreement or instrument, shall have the same rights in the matter of making a requisition for the convening of a meeting or of presenting a petition to the Court under the provisions of the Companies Act, 1913 (Act VII of 1913) or under any other law or under the articles of association or in any other matter as the person whose shares have vested in the Government had immediately before such vesting; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Government shall have the power to acquire, at its option, all or a portion of the remaining shares in such company in the prescribed manner on such terms as deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where under clause (1) the Government becomes the holder of more than fifty per cent of the total number of shares in the company, the Government may, by order in writing,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dissolve the Board of Directors of the company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        remove its Managing Director or any other Director;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        dissolve its Managing Committee, Executive Committee, Advisory Committee or any other Committee or Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        remove its General Manager or other Manager;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        terminate any Managing Agency Agreement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         remove any of its officers or employees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        constitute any Board or Committee or appoint any person for its administration and management; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        give such directions in respect of its administration and management as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in the memorandum or articles of association of a company, the Government may, in respect of a company mentioned in clause (2), by notification in the official Gazette, do all such things which, but for the power conferred by this clause, would have required the passing of a special or extraordinary resolution by the share-holders.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. When any property is vested in the Government under this Order, only such liabilities in respect of such property shall be deemed to be the liabilities in respect of the property as may be determined by such authority and in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Government may cancel any allotment or terminate any lease or amend the terms of any lease or agreement under which any abandoned property is held, occupied or managed by a person, where such allotment, lease or agreement has been granted or entered into after the 25th day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where by reason of any action taken under clause (1) any person has ceased to be entitled to possession of any abandoned property he shall, on demand by the Government, surrender possession of such property to the Government or to any person authorised by it in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If any person fails to surrender possession of any property on demand under clause (2), the Government may eject such person and take possession of such property in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) Any amount payable in respect of any abandoned property shall be paid to the Government by the person liable to pay the same.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person who makes a payment under clause (1) shall be discharged from further liability to pay to the extent of the payment made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any payment made otherwise than in accordance with clause (1) shall not discharge the person paying it from his obligation to pay the amount due, and shall not affect the right of the Government to enforce such obligation against any such person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Where any abandoned property is property in trust for a public purpose of a religious or charitable nature or is a waqf, the property shall remain vested in the Government only until such time as fresh trustees or mutwallis are appointed by the Government, and pending the appointment of fresh trustees or mutwallis the property and the income thereof shall be applied by the Government for fulfilling, as far as possible, a charitable purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) Where any abandoned property consists of shares in a joint property, business or firm, and if the shares vested in the Government constitute the greater part of such joint property, business or firm, reckoned according to the value of the whole, the Government may take possession and assume control and management of the whole of such property, business or firm.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding the provision of clause (1), the Government shall, on an application being made in this behalf by all or any of the persons whose shares have not vested in the Government, partition such property, if capable of being partitioned, and determine the share or shares of such person or persons.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Any property vested in the Government under this Order shall be exempt from all legal process, including seizure, distress, ejectment, attachment or sale by any officer of a Court or any other authority, and no injunction or other order of whatever kind in respect of such property shall be granted or made by any Court or any other authority, and the Government shall not be divested or dispossessed of such property by operation of any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any such legal process as aforesaid subsisting immediately before the commencement of this Order shall cease to have effect on such commencement and all abandoned properties in custody of any Court, receiver, guardian or other person or persons appointed by it, shall upon delivery of the same being called for by the Government, be delivered to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (3) No Court shall pass an order in any suit or proceeding granting a temporary or ad-interim injunction restraining the Government or the Deputy Commissioner or the Sub-divisional Magistrate or the authorised officer, or any other officer or person acting under the authority, orders or directions of any of them, from taking possession of any property if any notice under, or purported to be under, any provision of this Order has been served upon any person requiring or directing him to surrender possession of such property, and any such order passed by any Court before the commencement of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (LV of 1976), shall stand vacated and cease to have effect.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Any person claiming any right or interest in any property treated by Government as abandoned property may make an application to the prescribed authority on the ground that—</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the property is not abandoned property; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) his interest in the property has not been affected by the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application under clause (1) shall be made within three months of the date of the commencement of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On receiving an application under clause (2), the authority to which the application is made shall hold a summary inquiry in the prescribed manner and, after taking such evidence as may be produced, shall pass an order, stating the reasons therefore, rejecting the application or allowing it, wholly or in part, on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order passed under Article 7 or Article 15 of this Order may, within one month of such order, file an appeal before such authority as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, either of its own motion or on application, at any time, revise any order passed under Article 7 or Article 15 or clause (1) of this Article.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) Any person who has been in unauthorised possession of any abandoned property shall be liable to pay such compensation for such unauthorised possession as may be assessed by such authority and in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person who has caused damage to or disposed of the whole or a part of any abandoned property shall be liable to pay such compensation as may be assessed by such authority and in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Government shall maintain a separate account of each abandoned property in such manner as may be prescribed and shall cause to be made entries therein of all receipts and expenditures in respect thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall cause the accounts of the abandoned properties to be inspected and audited in the prescribed manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Without prejudice to the provisions of Article 17, any person who wilfully causes damage to, or disposes of the whole or a part of, any abandoned property or allows damage to be caused to, or disposal of the whole or a part of, any abandoned property shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. Any person who fails to surrender any abandoned property as required under clause (2) or clause (3) of Article 7 or Article 10 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies or banks or business or dissolution of firms shall apply to any company, bank, business or firm vested in the Government as abandoned property under this Order, and such company, bank, business or firm shall not be wound up or dissolved save by order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may, by order published in the official Gazette, direct that any power or duty which is conferred or imposed by this Order upon the Government shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the direction, be exercised or discharged by any officer or authority subordinate to it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government or any person for anything which is in good faith done or indented to be done under this Order or the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Anything done, any action taken or any order passed under this Order shall not be called in question in any court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (1A) was inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “or the authorised officer” were inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “or the authorised officer” were inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “or the authorised officer” were inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “or the authorised officer” were inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “or the authorised officer” were inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 125 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Clause (3) was inserted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
363	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE ALIENATION OF LAND (DISTRESSED CIRCUMSTANCES) (RESTORATION) ORDINANCE, 1976 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ALIENATION OF LAND (DISTRESSED CIRCUMSTANCES) (RESTORATION) ORDINANCE, 1976 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVIII OF 1976).[29th April, 1976]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the restoration of agricultural lands transferred for reasons of economic distress.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient for the restoration of agricultural lands transferred during the period of economic distress for reasons of such distress;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Alienation of Land (Distressed Circumstances) (Restoration) Ordinance, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “agricultural land” means land which is used for purposes connected with agriculture or horticulture and includes a homestead as defined in the State Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950 (E.B. Act XXVIII of 1951);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “authorised Officer” means any officer authorised by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “period of economic distress” means the period commencing the 1st April, 1974, and ending the 31st day of December, 1974; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “transferee”, in relation to a land in respect of which the application for restoration has been made under section 4, includes, if the land is in possession of any person other than the transferee, such person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Liability to restoration of alienated land</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, all agricultural lands transferred by sale for consideration during the period of economic distress for reasons of such distress shall, on application made in this behalf, be liable to be restored to the transferor with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of this Ordinance, transfer of agricultural land within the period of economic distress shall be deemed to have been made for reasons of such economic distress if the transferor and the members of his family do not in the aggregate own, after the transfer, more than three acres of such land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of this section, “family”, in relation to a transferor, includes his wife, son, unmarried daughter, but does not include an adult and married son who has been living in a separate mess independently of his parents continuously for five years, and the wife, son and unmarried daughter of such son.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure for restoration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) A person who seeks restoration of agricultural land transferred by him during the period of economic distress for reasons of such distress may, within a period of six months from the commencement of this Ordinance, make an application to the authorised officer for the restoration of the land so transferred stating therein-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the name of the transferee and, if such land is in possession of any person other than the transferee, the name of that person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the date of transfer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the amount of consideration of such land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon receipt of an application under sub-section (1), the authorised officer shall, if he is satisfied after giving the transferee an opportunity of being heard that the land to which the application relates is liable to be restored under section 3, by order in writing,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        direct the transferee to restore the land to the applicant and do such other acts that may be necessary for effective restoration as may be specified in order; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for the purpose of payment to the transferee direct the applicant to pay in such manner as may be specified in the order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one-sixth of the amount of consideration for which the land was transferred by the applicant in cash, by date specified in the order; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the remaining five-sixths of the said amount of consideration together with interest on such amount at the rate of six and one-fourth per cent per annum from the date of the receipt of the amount by the applicant on account of the transfer of the land less the sum determined by the authorised officer of the net income, if any, derived from the land by the transferee, by five annual equal instalments:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the first of the aforesaid instalments shall be payable on a date not later than the first day of Baishakh next following the date of the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of order for the restoration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) When the authorised officer makes an order under sub-section (2) of section 4 restoring any agricultural land, such order shall take effect on the 1st day of Baishakh next following the date of the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If, on or before the date on which an order under sub-section (2) of section 4 takes effect, the land to which the order relates has not been restored as required by the order, the authorised officer may, on his motion, and shall, on the application of such person, restore the land to the applicant by evicting the person in possession of the land, and for such eviction the authorised officer may use such force as may be necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of sums as a public demand</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Any sum payable under an order made under sub-section (2) of section 4 shall be recoverable as a public demand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of alienation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. No person to whom any agricultural land has been restored by an order under sub-section (2) of section 4 shall, as long as there remains unpaid any sum payable by such person under the order made under that sub-section, transfer or create</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">any charge upon such land or any portion thereof and, notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, any transfer made or charge created shall be void.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. An appeal against an order passed by the authorised officer under this Ordinance, if preferred within thirty days of the date of such order, shall lie to the 1[ Assistant Judge] having territorial jurisdiction and the order of the 2[ Assistant Judge] on such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction of court barred</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Except as provided in section 8, any order passed, any action taken or anything done under the provisions of this Ordinance shall not be called in question in any court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “Assistant Judge” were substituted for the word “Munsif” by section 3 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XIV of 1987)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “Assistant Judge” were substituted for the word “Munsif” by section 3 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XIV of 1987)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>

XLIII OF 1974).[29th June, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the withdrawal of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund for the services of a part of the financial year 1974-75.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the withdrawal of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh for services of a part of the financial year 1974-75.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Appropriation (Vote on Account) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Withdrawal of Taka 266,87,32,000 from and out of the Consolidated Fund for a part of the financial year 1974-75</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. From and out of the Consolidated Fund there may be withdrawal sums not exceeding those specified in column 3 of the Schedule to this Act, amounting in the aggregate to the sum of Taka two hundred and sixty-six crores, eighty-seven lakhs and thirty-two thousand towards defraying the several charges which will come in course of payment during a part of the financial year 1974-75.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appropriation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The sums authorised to be withdrawn from and out of the Consolidated Fund by this Act shall be appropriated for the services and purposes expressed in the Schedule in relation to the part of the said financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
372	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE APPROPRIATION (VOTE ON ACCOUNT) ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE APPROPRIATION (VOTE ON ACCOUNT) ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. V OF 1975).[30th  June, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the withdrawal of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund for the services of a part of the financial year 1975-76.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the withdrawal of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh for services of a part of the financial year 1975-76;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Appropriation (Vote on Account) Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Withdrawal of Taka 605,64,36,000 from and out of the Consolidated Fund for a part of the financial year 1975-76</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. From and out of the Consolidated Fund there may be withdrawn sums not exceeding those specified in column 3 of the Schedule to this Act, amounting in the aggregate to the sum of Taka six hundred and five crores, sixty-four lakhs and thirty-six thousand towards defraying the several charges which will come in course of payment during a part of the financial year 1975-76.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appropriation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The sums authorised to be withdrawn from and out of the Consolidated Fund by this Act shall be appropriated for the services and purposes expressed in the Schedule in relation to the part of the said financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
373	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ASIAN DEVELOPMENT BANK ORDER, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ASIAN DEVELOPMENT BANK ORDER, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT’S ORDER NO. 3 OF 1973).[24th January,1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the People’s Republic of Bangladesh is admitted to membership in the Asian Development Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the implementation of the Agreement establishing the Asian Development Bank and for carrying out the obligations of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh as a member of the Bank and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Asian Development Bank Order, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Agreement” means the Agreement Establishing the Asian Development Bank dated 4th December, 1965;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Bank” means the Asian Development Bank established under the Agreement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be paid out of the Consolidated Fund all such sums as may, from time to time, be required for the purpose of paying-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the subscriptions payable by the People's Republic of Bangladesh to the Bank under paragraphs 1, 2 and 3 of Article 5 of the Agreement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any commissions, fees or other charges payable by the People's Republic of Bangladesh to the Bank under Article 16 of the Agreement; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any sum payable by the People's Republic of Bangladesh under paragraph 1 of Article 25 of the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, if it thinks fit so to do, create and issue to the Bank, in such form as it thinks fit, any such non-interest bearing and non-negotiable notes or other obligations as are provided for by paragraph 3 of Article 6 of the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any sums received by or on behalf of the People's Republic of Bangladesh from the Bank shall be paid into the Consolidated Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Bangladesh Bank shall be the depository of Bangladesh currency holdings and other assets of the Bank located in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law, the provisions of the Agreement set out in the Schedule shall have the force of law in Bangladesh:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in Article 56 of the Agreement shall be construed as-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        entitling the Bank to import into Bangladesh goods free of any duty of customs without any restriction on their subsequent sale therein; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) conferring on the Bank any exemption from duties or taxes which form part of the price of goods sold; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        conferring on the Bank any exemption from duties or taxes which are in fact no more than charges for services rendered.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, amend the Schedule in conformity with any amendments, which may hereafter be duly made and adopted, of the provisions of the Agreement set out therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Nothing in this Order shall prejudice or derogate from the right of the People's Republic of Bangladesh to claim, receive or recover any assets from Pakistan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Government shall designate, by a notification in the official Gazette, the officer who shall be authorised on behalf of the People's Republic of Bangladesh to sign the Instrument of Acceptance of the Articles of Agreement and Resolution No. 54 of the Board of Governors of the Bank adopted on 11th November, 1972, and deposit it with the Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
374	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ATOMIC ENERGY COMMISSION ORDER, 1973, </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ATOMIC ENERGY COMMISSION ORDER, 1973, </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">BANGLADESH (PRESIDENT’S ORDER NO. 15 OF 1973).[27th  February, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of an Atomic Energy Commission for the promotion of the peaceful uses of atomic energy in Bangladesh, the discharge of International obligations connected therewith, the undertaking of research, the execution of development projects involving nuclear power stations and matters incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission Order, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Atomic energy” means the energy or ionizing radiations released in any process which involves transformation of, or reaction between atomic nuclei and includes energy liberated as a result of the fission of special nuclear material or fusion of atomic nuclei;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Commission” means the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission established by this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “special nuclear material” means plutonium 239, uranium 235 or uranium 233 or any other material which the Commission determines to be capable of releasing energy through fission and fusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Order, there shall be established a Commission to be called the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Commission shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Order, to acquire and hold property, both movable and immovable, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Head Office of the Commission shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Commission shall consist of one Chairman and not more than four full-time Members to be appointed by the Government from amongst notable persons in the field of science and technology, on such terms and conditions as the Government may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) There shall be an Advisory Committee to advise the Commission and assist it in its work in any manner the Commission may decide, which Committee shall consist of the Chairman and the full-time members of the Commission as well as not more than five part-time members, to be appointed by the Government. The part-time members will be selected from amongst the engineers, scientists, doctors, teachers and other professionals in the employ of the Commission, the universities and the research institutions in science and technology.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other members shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or as may be assigned to them by the Commission or the Government from time to time. The Chairman will be the Chief Executive Officer of the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Commission shall have a full-time Financial Adviser and a full-time Secretary to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) A member of the Commission shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of his appointment and shall be eligible for re-appointment for such further period or periods, not exceeding three years at any time, as the Government may decide:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no member shall hold office for more than two consecutive terms, unless under special circumstances, to be decided by the Government, where the services of a member is expressly desired in the interest of Nuclear Science.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person appointed to be a member of the Commission may at any time resign his office by letter addressed to the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A vacancy caused by resignation or any other reason shall be filled by appointment of a person qualified to fill such vacancy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government at any time terminate the appointment of the Chairman or any other member of the Commission without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Commission shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of a vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The functions of the Commission shall be to do all acts and things, including research work, necessary for the promotion of the peaceful uses of atomic energy in the fields of agriculture, medicine, industry, development of related technology and electronic equipment and appliances, and for the execution of development projects involving nuclear power stations and the generation of electric power thereat, and to carry out space and upper atmosphere research.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Commission may, on behalf and with the approval of the Government, perform such other functions relating to the peaceful uses of atomic energy and space and upper atmosphere research, and on such terms and conditions, as may be agreed upon between the Commission and the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In the performance of its functions, the Commission shall be guided on questions of policy by the instructions, if any, given to it by the Government which shall be the sole judge as to whether a question is a question of policy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Commission shall, in order to carry out any functions under clause (1) or clause (2),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        prepare and submit, for the approval of the Government, proposals, schemes or projects in such form as may be indicated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) proceed to give effect to a proposal, scheme or project as approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Commission shall meet at such time and place and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be convened by the Chairman when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) At a meeting of the Commission each member shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a casting or second vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If for any reason the Chairman is unable to be present at a meeting, a member authorised by the Chairman shall preside over the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Until the rules are framed in this behalf, fifty per cent. of the members appointed for the Commission shall form a quorum at a meeting of the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The funds of the Commission shall comprise of:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        funds of the former Atomic Energy Commission existing in Bangladesh which stand transferred to the Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) income from investments and royalties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) receipts of the commission from such other sources as may be approved by the Commission; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) funds and assets of the former Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Committee existing in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Commission may open a deposit account with any bank or banks.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The accounts of the Commission shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, and shall be maintained, and presented for audit, in such form and manner, as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Commission shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval, a budget in the prescribed form for each financial year, showing the estimated receipts and expenditures and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Commission may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or by such member or officer of the Commission as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Commission may, subject to such general or special orders as the Government may give it from time to time, appoint officers, consultants, advisers and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may direct the Commission to dispense with the services of any officer or employees, and when so directed, the Commission shall dispense with his services.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Commission, subject to approval of the Government, and in accordance with the general or specific standing orders of the Government, shall prescribe the procedure for appointments, terms and conditions of services of its officers and other employees and shall be competent to take disciplinary action against them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Commission may, by general or specific orders, delegate to the Chairman, members and officers of the Commission, any of its powers, duties and functions under this Order, subject to such conditions and limitations as it may think fit to impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Chairman, members, officers and other employees of the Commission shall, when acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any of the provisions of this Order shall be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code, 1860.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Commission, the Chairman, members or officers and other employees of the Commission in respect of anything done or intended to be done, in good faith, under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Commission may, subject to the prior approval of the Government, co-operate with any foreign national authority or international organisation, in respect of the peaceful uses of atomic energy and space and upper atmosphere research, pursuant to the express terms and conditions of any programme or agreement for co-operation, to which such authority or organisation is a party, or pursuant to any other international arrangement made after the commencement of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Commission shall submit to the Government at such time and at such intervals as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        such periodical reports and summaries as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) annual reports on the Head Office and the different research centres, power stations and projects;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) such periodical returns, accounts statements, and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific point;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) copies of the documents required by the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) original documents required by the Government for examination or for any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Government may, from time to time, issue to the Commission such directives and orders as it may consider necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Order and the Commission shall follow and carry out such directives and orders.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. All rights relating to discoveries and inventions and any improvements in materials, methods, processes, apparatus or equipment made by any officer or employee of the Commission, in the course of his employment, shall vest in the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. Every member, adviser, consultant, officer or other employee of the Commission shall make such declaration of fidelity and secrecy as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Government may, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All rules and regulations made under this Article shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Commission may, with the previous approval of the Government, make such regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order or the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. All rules, regulations, and bye-laws of the former Atomic Energy Commission established under the Atomic Energy Commission Ordinance, 1965 (Ord. No. XVII of 1965) and the former Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Committee, and in force immediately before the commencement of this Order, shall, mutatis mutandis, and so far as they are not inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Order, continue in force until repealed or altered by rules or regulations made under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. No provision of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Commission, and the Commission shall not be wound up except by order of the Government, and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any memorandum or articles of association, deed or other instrument, on the commencement of this Order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets of the former Atomic Energy Commission established under the Atomic Energy Commission Ordinance, 1965 (Ord. No. XVII of 1965); hereinafter referred to the said Commission, and of the former Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Committee, hereinafter referred to as the said Committee, in Bangladesh shall stand transferred to, and vested in the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation- The expression “assets” includes all rights, powers, authorities and privileges, all property, movable and immovable, including lands, buildings, cash balances, bank deposits, reserve funds, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all agreements made in Bangladesh by or with the said Commission or the said Committee shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, stand transferred to, and be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by or with, the Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all officers and other employees now serving in the Atomic Energy Commission in Bangladesh shall continue to serve in the Commission on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government or, until so determined, on the same terms and conditions, as were applicable to them immediately before the promulgation of this Order, subject to the provisions relating to pay and allowances in the Bangladesh Government and Semi-Autonomous Organisations (Regulation of Salary of Employees) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 79 of 1972), so long as the said Order remains in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits or other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Committee in Bangladesh before the commencement of this Order shall, unless the Government otherwise directs be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Commission and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Atomic Energy Commission Ordinance, 1965 (Ord. No. XVII of 1965), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
375	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (ADAPTATION OF EAST PAKISTAN INTERMEDIATE AND SECONDARY EDUCATION ORDINANCE) ORDER 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (ADAPTATION OF </strong><strong>EAST PAKISTAN</strong><strong> INTERMEDIATE AND SECONDARY EDUCATION ORDINANCE) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 36 OF 1972).[20th April, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to adapt the East Pakistan Intermediate and Secondary Education Ordinance, 1961 (E. P. Ord. XXXIII of 1961), in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh (Adaptation of East Pakistan Intermediate and Secondary Education Ordinance) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) As from the 16th day of December, 1971, the East Pakistan Intermediate and Secondary Education Ordinance, 1961 (E. P. Ord. No. XXXIII of 1961) (hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance) shall, until repealed or altered or amended by the Legislature of Bangladesh or any other competent authority, be subject to the adaptations specified in clause (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In the said Ordinance, references to “Governor”, “East Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” shall, except where the reference occurs in the title or preamble or any citation or description of the Ordinance and except where the context otherwise requires, be construed as references to “President”, “Bangladesh” and “Government of Bangladesh” respectively.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
376	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (ADAPTATION OF EXISTING LAWS) ORDER 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (ADAPTATION OF EXISTING LAWS) ORDER 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 48 OF 1972).[22nd May 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the Laws Continuance and Enforcement Order provides that all laws which were in force on the 25th day of March, 1971, in the territories now comprised in the People’s Republic of Bangladesh shall continue to be in force in Bangladesh subject to such consequential changes as may be necessary; NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.
