Every member of the Institute in practice shall, and any other member may, use the designation of a Chartered Accountant and no member using such designation shall use any other designation, whether in addition thereto or in substitution therefore:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing contained in this Article shall be deemed to prohibit any such person from adding any other description or designatory letters to his name, if entitled thereto, to indicate membership of such other institute of accountancy, whether in Bangladesh or elsewhere as may be recognised in this behalf by the Council, or any other qualification that he may possess, or to prohibit a firm, all the partners of which are members of the Institute and in practice, from being known by its firm name as Chartered Accountants:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that nothing contained in this Article shall be deemed to prohibit a member from using such other description for the management consultancy company or firm, as may be prescribed, where the member renders Management Consultancy services through the medium of a separate unlimited company or firm.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Notwithstanding anything contained in Article 4, a person shall not be entitled to have his name entered in or borne on the Register if he –</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         has not attained the age of twenty-one years at the time of his application for the entry of his name in the Register ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        is of unsound mind and stands so adjudged by a competent Court; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       having been discharged of insolvency, has not obtained from the Court a certificate stating that his insolvency was caused by misfortune without any misconduct on his part; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) has been convicted by a competent Court, whether within or without Bangladesh, of an offence involving moral turpitude and punishable with transportation or imprisonment or of an offence, not of a technical nature, committed by him in his professional capacity unless in respect of the offence committed, he has either been granted a pardon or, on an application made by him in this behalf, the Government has, by an order in writing, removed the disability; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       has been removed from the membership of the Institute on being found on inquiry to have been guilty of such professional or other misconduct, as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a person who has been removed from the membership of the Institute for a specified period, shall be entitled to have his name entered in the Register after the expiry of such period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) There shall be a Council of the Institute for the management of the affairs of the Institute and for discharging the functions assigned to it under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be composed of the following persons, namely,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        not more than seventeen persons elected from such regional constituencies to be specified by the Government by notification in the Gazette, by the members of the Institute belonging to such constituencies from among the members of at least five years standing, the number of members to be elected from a constituency being such as may be prescribed; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) three Government officials, not below the rank of Joint Secretary, nominated by the Government, one each from the Ministries of Commerce, Finance and Education:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this sub-clause conferring upon the Government the right of nomination shall cease to exist on the expiry of the life of the three consecutive Councils:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the date on which sub-clause (b) shall cease to have effect, sub-clause (a) shall automatically stand amended to the effect that for the word ‘seventeen' in that sub-clause, the word ‘twenty' shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In computing the period of a person's standing with the Institute for the purpose of sub-clause (a), the period for which he has been an existing chartered accountant before the commencement of this Order shall be reckoned as period of membership of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (2), the Council existing immediately before the commencement of this Order shall be deemed to be the first Council consisting of members nominated by the Government and shall discharge all the functions of the Council under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) Elections under sub-clause (a) of clause (2) of Article 10 shall be conducted in the prescribed manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any dispute arises regarding any such election, the matter shall be referred by the Council to a Tribunal appointed by the Government in this behalf and the decision of such Tribunal shall be final:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such reference shall be made except on an application made to the Council by an aggrieved party, within thirty days from the date of declaration of the result of the election.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The expenses of the Tribunal shall be borne by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. If any body of persons referred to in Article 10 fails to elect any of the members of the Council which it is empowered under that Article to elect, the retiring members of the Council from such constituency shall continue until such time as members can be elected. If, however, the retiring members decline to continue, in such event the Council shall have power to co-opt members from other constituencies and any person so co-opted shall be deemed to be a member of the Council as if he had been duly elected.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Council shall elect from among its members a President and one or, if the Council so decides, more than one Vice-Presidents of the Institute, who shall also be the President and Vice-President or Vice-Presidents of the Council respectively and so often as the office or offices of the President or the Vice-President or Vice-Presidents becomes vacant, the Council shall choose from among its members a President, or a Vice-President or Vice-Presidents, as the case may be:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that on the first constitution of the Council, members of the Council nominated in this behalf by the Government shall discharge the functions of the President and the Vice-President or Vice-Presidents for the term of the first Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The President shall be the chief executive of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The President and the Vice-President or Vice-Presidents shall hold office for a period of one year from the date on which they are chosen but so as not to extend beyond their term of office as members of the Council, and subject to their being members of the Council at the relevant time, they shall be eligible for re-election for a total period not exceeding three consecutive years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) On the dissolution of the Council, the President of the Council at the time of such dissolution shall continue to hold office and discharge such administrative and other duties as may be prescribed until such time as a new President shall have been elected and shall have taken over charge of his duties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Any member of the Council may at any time resign his membership by writing under his hand addressed to the President and the seat of such member shall become vacant when such resignation is notified in the Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member of the Council shall be deemed to have vacated his seat if he is declared by the Council to have been absent without sufficient excuse from three consecutive meetings of the Council, or if his name is, for any cause, removed from the Register under the provisions of Article 20.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A casual vacancy in the Council shall be filled by fresh election from the constituency concerned or by nomination by the Government, as the case may be, and the person elected or nominated to fill the vacancy shall hold office until the dissolution of the Council:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no election shall be held to fill a casual vacancy occurring within six months prior to the date of the expiry of the duration of the Council, but such a vacancy may be filled by co-option by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No act done by the Council shall be called in question on the ground merely of the existence of any vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The duration of the Council constituted under this Order shall be three years from the date of the first meeting of the Council on the expiry of which it shall stand dissolved and a new Council shall be constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the first Council nominated by the Government shall cease to exist on the expiry of three months from the date of the commencement of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding the expiry of the duration of the Council it shall continue to function until a new Council is constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Order, and upon such constitution, the Council so functioning shall stand dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The duty of carrying out the provisions of this Order shall be vested in the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the duties of the Council shall include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the examination of candidates for enrolment and the prescribing of fees therefore;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the regulation of the engagement and training of articled students;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the prescribing of qualifications for entry in the Register;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the recognition of foreign qualifications and training for purposes of enrolment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the granting or refusal of certificates of practice under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the maintenance and publication of a register of persons qualified to practice as chartered accountants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the levy and collection of fees from members, examinees and other persons;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the removal of names from the Register and the restoration to the Register of names which have been removed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the regulation and maintenance of the status and standard of professional qualifications of the members of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the carrying out, by financial assistance to persons other than members of the Council or in any other manner, of research in accountancy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the maintenance of a library or libraries and publication of books and periodicals relating to accountancy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) the exercise of such disciplinary powers over the members and servants of the Institute as may be prescribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       the formation of such Standing Committees as may be prescribed; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) such other powers as may be necessary for the efficient running of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. For the efficient performance of its duties, the Council may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        appoint a full-time Secretary who may also, if so decided by the Council, act as Treasurer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) appoint such other officers and servants as it deems necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) require and take from the Secretary or from any other officer or servant of the Council such security for the due performance of his duties, as the Council considers necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) fix salaries, fees, allowances and other conditions of service of the officers and servants of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) fix the allowances of the President, Vice-President or Vice-Presidents and other members of the Council and members of its committees.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. There shall be established a fund under the management and control of the Council into which shall be paid all monies received by the Council and out of which shall be met all expenses and liabilities properly incurred by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Council shall maintain in the prescribed manner a Register of the Members of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Register shall include the following particulars about every member of the Institute, namely,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        his full name, date of birth, domicile, residential and professional addresses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the date on which his name is entered in the Register;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) his qualifications;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) whether he holds a certificate of practice; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) any other particulars which may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council shall cause to be published, in such manner as may be prescribed, a list of members of the Institute as on the first day of July of each year, and shall, if requested to do so by any such members, send to him a copy of such list.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every member of the Institute shall, on his name being entered in the Register, pay such annual membership fee, as may be prescribed and different fees may be prescribed for associates and for fellows.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Council may remove from the Register the name of any member of the Institute-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        who is dead; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) from whom a request has been received to that effect; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) who has not paid any prescribed fee required to be paid by him; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) who is found to have been subject at the time when his name was entered in the Register, or who at any time thereafter has become subject, to any of the disabilities mentioned in Article 9, or who for any other reason has ceased to be entitled to have his name borne on the Register.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) For the purpose of advising and assisting it on matters concerning its functions, the Council may constitute such Regional Committees as and when it deems fit for one or more of the regional constituencies that may be specified by the Government under sub-clause (a) of clause (2) of Article 10.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Regional Committees shall be constituted in such manner and exercise such functions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Any person who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) not being a member of the Institute,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        represents that he is a member of the Institute; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) uses the designation Chartered Accountant or any abbreviation thereof in a manner as to impress that he is a chartered accountant; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) holds himself out to be a chartered accountant; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        being a member of the Institute, but not having a certificate of practice, represents that he is in practice or practises as a chartered accountant, shall be punishable on first conviction with fine which may extend to Taka one thousand and on any subsequent conviction with imprisonment which may extend to six months or with fine which may extend to Taka five thousand or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) No person shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         use a name or a common seal which is identical with the name or the common seal of the Institute or so nearly resembles it as to deceive or as is likely to deceive the public;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) award any degree, diploma or certificate or bestow any designation which indicates or purports to indicate the possession or attainment of any qualification or competence possessed by a person by virtue of his being a member of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       seek to regulate in any manner whatsoever the profession of chartered accountants; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       seek to represent the cause of chartered accountancy profession or chartered accountants by forming group, society, association or in any manner whatsoever.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person contravening the provisions of clause (1) shall, without prejudice to any other proceedings which may be taken against him, be punishable with fine which may extend on first conviction to Taka one thousand and on any subsequent conviction with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to Taka five thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) No company, whether incorporated in Bangladesh or elsewhere, shall practice as chartered accountants:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing contained in this Article shall be deemed to prohibit an unlimited company termed as such in the Companies Act, 1913 (Act VII of 1913) from rendering Management Consultancy services.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any company contravenes the provisions of clause (1) then, without prejudice to any other proceedings which may be taken against the company, every director, manager, secretary and any other officer thereof, who is knowingly a party to such contravention, shall be punishable with fine which may extend on first conviction to Taka one thousand and on any subsequent conviction to Taka five thousand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) No person other than a member of the Institute shall sign any document on behalf of a chartered accountant in practice or a firm of such chartered accountants in his or its professional capacity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person contravening the provision of clause (1) shall, without prejudice to any other proceedings which may be taken against him, be punishable with fine which may extend on first conviction to Taka one thousand and on any subsequent conviction with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to Taka five thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. No person shall be prosecuted under this Order except on a complaint made by or under the order of the council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) Where a chartered accountant in practice or firm of such chartered accountants has more than one office in Bangladesh, each one of such offices shall be in the separate charge of a member of the Institute:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Council may, in suitable cases, exempt any chartered accountant in practice or a firm of such chartered accountants from the operation of this clause.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every chartered accountant in practice or a firm of such chartered accountants maintaining more than one office shall send to the Council a list of offices and the persons in charge thereof and shall keep the Council informed of any change in relation thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) The Council may, by notification in the Gazette, make bye-laws for the purpose of carrying out the objects of this Order, and a copy of such bye-laws shall be sent 5[ to the Government and to each member] of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such bye-laws may provide for all or any of the following matters:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the standard and conduct of examinations under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the qualifications for the entry of the name of any person in the Register as a member of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the conditions under which any examination or training may be treated as equivalent to the examination and training prescribed for the membership of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the conditions under which any foreign qualifications may be recognised;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the manner in which and the conditions subject to which applications for entry in the Register may be made;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the fees payable for membership of the Institute and the annual fees payable by associates and fellows of the Institute in respect of their certificates;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the manner in which elections to the Council and the Regional Committees may be held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the particulars to be entered in the Register;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the functions of Regional Committees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the training of articled students and the cancellation of articles for misconduct or for any other sufficient cause;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the regulation and maintenance of the status and standard of professional qualifications of members of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) the carrying out of research in accountancy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) the maintenance of a library and publication of books and periodicals on accountancy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) the management of the property of the Council and the maintenance and audit of its accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) the summoning and holding of meetings of the Council, the times and places of such meetings, the conduct of business there at and the number of members necessary to form a quorum;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) the powers, duties and functions of the President and the Vice-President or Vice-Presidents of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) the functions of the Standing and other Committees and the conditions subject to which such functions shall be discharged;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r) the terms of office and the powers, duties and functions of the Secretary and other officers and servants of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s) the rules of professional and other misconduct, and the exercise of disciplinary powers; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(t)         any other matter which is required to be or may be prescribed under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All bye-laws made by the Council under this Order shall be subject to the condition of previous publication 6[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Notwithstanding anything contained in clauses (1) and (2), the Government may frame the first bye-laws for the purposes mentioned in this Article, and such bye-laws shall be deemed to have been made by the Council, and shall remain in force from the date of the coming into force of this Order until they are amended, altered or revoked by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) Where any country prevents persons of Bangladesh domicile from becoming members of any institution similar to the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Bangladesh or from practising the profession of accountancy or subject them to unfair discrimination in that country, no subject of any such country shall be entitled to become a member of the Institute or practise the profession of accountancy in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the provisions of clause (1), the Council may prescribe the conditions, if any, subject to which foreign qualifications relating to accountancy shall be recognised for the purposes of entry in the Register of Members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Nothing contained in clauses (1) and (2) shall apply to the case of a person whose services in any capacity have been obtained by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. Any reference to a chartered accountant or a registered accountant or any existing chartered accountant or a certified or qualified auditor in any other law or in any document whatsoever shall be construed as a reference to a chartered accountant in practice within the meaning of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">31</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Order, the Government may make such order, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order, as may appear to it to be necessary for the purposes of removing the difficulty.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. In section 144 of the Companies Act, 1913 (Act VII of 1913), for sub-section (1), the following sub-section shall be substituted, namely-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(1) No person shall be appointed as a auditor of any company unless he is a chartered accountant within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a firm whereof all the partners practising in Bangladesh are chartered accountants may be appointed by its firm name to be auditors of a company and may act in its firm name.”</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. Notwithstanding the amendment of section 144 of the Companies Act, 1913 (Act VII of 1913), made by the preceding Article, the Auditors' Certificate Rules, 1950, shall so far as applicable, continue in force as if they are bye-laws made under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. Anything done or action taken or purported to have been done or taken by any Ad hoc Committee or the Council constituted by the Government under notification No. SEC-XII/IM-132/72/318(50), dated the 27th March, 1972, issued by the Ministry of Trade and Commerce, after the 16th day of December, 1971, and before the commencement of this Order, shall be deemed to have been validly done or taken, and shall have and shall be deemed always to have had effect accordingly, and shall not be called in question in any court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. The provisions of the Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961 (Ord. No. X of 1961), shall, in so far they are not inconsistent with any of the provisions of this Order, continue in force until repealed or altered or amended by law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “two thousand” were substituted for the words “five hundred” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XL of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (3) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Ordinance, 1977 (Ordinance No. LIV of 1977)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “A person who has completed five years as an associate” were substituted for the words and commas “A person who has completed ten years as an associate, whether or not he has been in practice during that period, or a person who, being an associate, has completed five years of practice,” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. IX of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Explanation II was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. IX of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “to the Government and to each member” were substituted for the words “to each member” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XL of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “and to the approval of the Government” were omitted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XL of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
387	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH CITIZENSHIP (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> CITIZENSHIP (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 149 OF 1972).[15th December, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make temporary provisions regarding citizenship of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Citizenship (Temporary Provisions) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 26th day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 1A. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Order.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, on the commencement of this Order, every person shall be deemed to be a citizen of Bangladesh-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) who or whose father or grandfather was born in the territories now comprised in Bangladesh and who was a permanent resident of such territories on the 25th day of March, 1971, and continues to be so resident; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        who was a permanent resident of the territories now comprised in Bangladesh on the 25th day of March, 1971, and continues to be so resident and is not otherwise disqualified for being a citizen by or under any law for the time being in force:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if any person is a permanent resident of the territories now comprised in Bangladesh or his dependent is, in the course of his employment or for the pursuit of his studies, residing in a country which was at war with, or engaged in military operations against Bangladesh and is being prevented from returning to Bangladesh, such person or his dependents, shall be deemed to continue to be resident in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 2A. A person to whom Article 2 would have ordinarily applied but for his residence in the United   Kingdom shall be deemed to continue to be permanent resident in Bangladesh within the meaning of that Article:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may notify, in the official Gazette, any person or categories of persons to whom this Article shall not apply.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2B</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 2B. (1)Notwithstanding anything contained in Article 2 or in any other law for the time being in force, a person shall not, except as provided in clause (2), qualify himself to be a citizen of Bangladesh if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         owes, affirms or acknowledges, expressly or by conduct, allegiance to a foreign state, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        is notified under the proviso to Article 2A:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a citizen of Bangladesh shall not, merely by reason of being a citizen or acquiring citizenship of a state specified in or under clause (2), cease to be a citizen of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The Government may grant citizenship of Bangladesh to any person who is a citizen of any state of Europe or North America or of any other state which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf.]]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In case of doubt as to whether a person is qualified to be deemed to be a citizen of Bangladesh under Article 2 of this Order, the question shall be decided by the Government, which decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Government may, upon an application made to it in this behalf in the manner prescribed, grant citizenship to any person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 4A. The Government may, upon an application made to it in this behalf in the manner prescribed, grant right of permanent residence to any person on such conditions as may be prescribed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Article (1A) was inserted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Citizenship (Temporary Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LVIII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Articles 2A and 2B were inserted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Citizenship (Temporary Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1973 (Act No. V of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Article 2B was substituted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Citizenship (Temporary Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. VII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Article 4A was inserted by section 3 of The Bangladesh Citizenship (Temporary Provisions) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. LVIII of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
388	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH COINAGE ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> COINAGE ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 83 OF 1972).[24th July, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Mint and for the issue and putting into circulation of Taka coins of the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Coinage Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 26th day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “deface” with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, includes clipping, filling, stamping or such other alteration of the surface or shape of a coin as is readily distinguishable from the effects of reasonable wear;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “the Mint” means any Mint which may hereafter be established in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “remedy” means variation from the standard weight and fineness; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Standard weight” means the weight prescribed for any coin.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The Government may by notification in the official Gazette,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) establish a Mint at any place within Bangladesh,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) abolish any Mint which may hereafter be established.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Coins may be coined at the Mint which may hereafter be established in Bangladesh or at any Mint of any other country for issue under the authority of the Government of such denominations not higher than 1[ two Taka], of such dimension and designs, and of such metals or of mixed metals of such composition as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 5. The two Taka coins, one Taka coins, fifty poisha coins, twenty five poisha coins, ten poisha coins, five poisha coins, two poisha coins and one poisha coins issued under the authority of the Government shall be current in Bangladesh until such time as they are called in by the Government by notification in the official Gazette.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The standard weight of the coins of any denomination coined under the provisions of Article 4, and the remedy allowed in the making of such coins shall be such as may be prescribed in this behalf by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The coins issued under the authority of Article 4 shall be a legal tender in payment or on account,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in the case of a Taka coin, for any sum;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a fifty paisa coin, for any sum not exceeding ten Taka; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in the case of any other coin, for any sum not exceeding one Taka:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the coin has not been defaced and has not lost weight so as to be less than such weight as may be prescribed in its case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Notwithstanding anything contained in Article 5, the Government may by notification in the official Gazette, call in, with effect from such date as may be specified in the notification any coin, of whatever date or denomination, referred to in that Article, and on and from the date so specified such coin shall cease to be a legal tender save to such extent as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. 4[ (1) The Taka, which is the standard monetary unit in Bangladesh, shall be divided into one hundred units and the coin representing such unit shall be called poisha and shall, subject to the provision of clause (1) of Article 7, and to the extent specified therein, be legal tender in payment or on account accordingly.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All references in any enactment or any notification, rule or order under any enactment or in any contract, deed or other instrument, to any value expressed in 5[ Taka, and poisha shall be construed as reference to that value expressed in Taka] and poisha coins referred to in clause (1) and the Government may by notification in the official Gazette specify any symbol or abbreviation as it may deem fit for making any written reference to their value in words or in figures.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Where any silver coin issued under the authority of the Government is tendered to any person authorised by the Government to act under this Article and such person has reason to believe that the coin,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        has been diminished in weight so as to be more than such percentage below standard weight as may be prescribed as the unit of reasonable wear, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) has been defaced,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">he shall, by himself or another, cut or break the coin.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. A person cutting or breaking the coin under the provision of clause (a) of Article 10 shall observe the following procedure, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if the coin has been diminished in weight so to be more than such percentage below standard weight as may be prescribed as the limit of reasonable wear, but not more than such further percentage as may be prescribed in this behalf, he shall either return the pieces to the person tendering the coin, or, if the person so requests, shall receive and pay for the coin at such rates as may be prescribed in this behalf; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if the coin has been diminished in weight so as to be more than such further percentage below standard weight so prescribed as aforesaid, he shall return the pieces to the person tendering the coin, who shall bear the loss caused by such cutting or breaking.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. A person cutting or breaking coin under clause (b) of Article 10 shall observe the following procedure, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         if such person has reason to believe that coin has been fraudulently defaced, he shall return the pieces to the person tendering the coin, who shall bear the loss caused by such cutting or breaking;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) if such person has not reason to believe that the coin has been fraudulently defaced, he shall receive and pay for the coin at its nominal value.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation - For the purpose of this Article, a coin which, there is to believe has been defaced by sweating shall be deemed to have been fraudulently defaced.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. If a coin is liable to be cut or broken under the provisions of both clauses (a) and (b) of Article 10, the person cutting or breaking the coin shall deal with it,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if he has reason to believe that the coin has been fraudulently defaced, under clause (a) of Article 11, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in other cases, under Article 12.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Where any coin purporting to be coined or issued under the authority of the Government is tendered to any person authorised by the Government to act under this Article, and such person has reason to believe that the coin is counterfeit or has been fraudulently defaced, he shall by himself or another cut or break the coin and may at his discretion either return the pieces to the tenderer, who shall bear the loss caused by such cutting or breaking, or in the case of silver coin receive and pay for the coin accordingly to the value of the silver bullion contained in it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        provide for the guidance of persons authorised to cut or break coin under Articles 10 and 14;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        determine the percentage of diminution in weight below standard weight not being less than two percent. in the case of silver coins or five percent. in the case of pure nickel coins, which shall be the limit of reasonable wear; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        prescribe the further percentage referred to in clause (a) of Article 11 and the rates at which payments shall be made in the case of coins falling under the same clause.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. No suit or other proceedings shall lie against any persons in respect of anything in good faith done or intended to be done, under or in pursuance of the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. Nothing in this Order shall be deemed to prohibit or restrict the making at the Mint of coins intended for issue as money by the Government of any country beyond the limits of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Pakistan Coinage Act (Act III of 1906) is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “two Taka” were substituted for the words “one Taka” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Coinage (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. III of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Article 5 was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Coinage (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. III of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (2) was omitted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Coinage (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. III of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (1) was substituted by section 5 of the Bangladesh Coinage (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. III of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words and comma “Taka, and poisha shall be construed as reference to that value expressed in Taka” were substituted for the words and comma “rupee, and poisha shall be construed as reference to that value expressed in new Taka ” by section 5 of the Bangladesh Coinage (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. III of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
389	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH COLLABORATORS (SPECIAL TRIBUNALS) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> COLLABORATORS (SPECIAL TRIBUNALS) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXIII OF 1975).[31st December, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Bangladesh Collaborators (Special Tribunals) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Bangladesh Collaborators (Special Tribunals) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 8 of 1972), and to provide for certain matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Collaborators (Special Tribunals) (Repeal) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of PO No 8 of 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) The Bangladesh Collaborators (Special Tribunals) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 8 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Order, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Order under sub-section (1), all trials or other proceedings thereunder pending immediately before such repeal before any Tribunal, Magistrate or Court, and all investigations or other proceedings by or before any Police Officer or other authority under that Order, shall abate and shall not be proceeded with.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Nothing in sub-section (2) shall be deemed to affect -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the continuance of any appeal against any conviction or sentence by any Tribunal, Magistrate or Court under the said Order; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) except to the extent provided in that sub-section, the operation of section 6 of the General Clauses Act, 1897 (X of 1897).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
390	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (COLLECTION OF TAXES) ORDER 1971</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (COLLECTION OF TAXES) ORDER, 1971 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACTING PRESIDENT’S ORDER NO. 1 OF 1971).[26th December, 1971]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for the collection of taxes in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Declaration of Independence of Bangladesh and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Acting President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh (Collection of Taxes) Order, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. All taxes except land revenue, payable or leviable under any law made before the commencement of this Order either by the Government of Pakistan or by the Government of East Pakistan shall be continued to be levied and collected at the rates specified therein by the person or authority empowered to levy and collect the same or by such other person or authority as the Government of Bangladesh may appoint in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. To avoid any doubt, it is declared that land revenue shall be reviewed by the Government of Bangladesh and shall not be collected until such time as the Government of Bangladesh may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct otherwise.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. In this Order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        ‘law' includes rule, regulation, bye-law, order, instrument and notification;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        ‘tax' includes duty, cess, rate, penalty, fee and levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. For the purposes of this Order, references in any law to “Central Government”, “Provincial Government”, “Pakistan” and “East Pakistan”, shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as references to “Government of Bangladesh” and “Bangladesh” respectively.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
391	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH COLLEGE OF PHYSICIANS AND SURGEONS ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> </strong><strong>COLLEGE</strong><strong> OF </strong><strong>PHYSICIANS</strong><strong> AND SURGEONS ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 63 OF 1972).[8th June, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a College of Physicians and Surgeons in the People’s Republic of Bangladesh for maintaining high principles of medical profession, promoting specialists medical practice, arranging post-graduate medical training, and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “College” means the Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons established under Article 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Council” means the Council of the College constituted under Article 6;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Fellow” means a Fellow of the College; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under Article 19.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Order, there shall be established a College, to be called the Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The College shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall, by the said name, sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 4.
