393	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE BANGLADESH CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY MEMBERS (CESSATION OF MEMBERSHIP) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY MEMBERS (CESSATION OF MEMBERSHIP) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 23 OF 1972).[23rd March, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the system of parliamentary democracy is based on the effective functioning of political parties and it is in the interest of such functioning that a person who has become a member of the Constituent Assembly on the basis of elections in which he was a candidate on the basis of his having been nominated and granted a ticket by a political party should cease to be such member upon his resignation or expulsion from such political party;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS it is expedient to make certain provisions in that behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Constituent Assembly Members (Cessation of Membership) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Constituent Assembly” means the Constituent Assembly of Bangladesh; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Political Party” includes a group or combination of persons who operate within or outside the Constituent Assembly under a distinctive name or hold themselves out as a group distinct from other groups for the purpose of propagating any political opinion or engaging in any other political activity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) If any person who is a Member of the Constituent Assembly on the basis of an election in which he was a candidate on the basis of his having been nominated and granted a ticket by a political party,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) resigns from it; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) is expelled by such political party; he shall cease to be a member of the Constituent Assembly for the unexpired period of his term as such member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Speaker of the Constituent Assembly, and till such time as there is a Speaker, the Secretary of the Constituent Assembly, shall, upon receipt by him of a notice in writing from the Secretary of the political party concerned of the resignation or of the order of expulsion made by the political party in respect of the member concerned, notify in the official Gazette the cessation of membership of the member concerned, who shall cease to be a member of the Constituent Assembly from the date of such notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The notice served by the Secretary of the political party concerned under clause (2) of the resignation or the order of expulsion shall be conclusive evidence of such resignation or such expulsion and no Court, Tribunal or body shall have power to enquire into the validity of such resignation, or the order of expulsion or any proceedings upon which it is based.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. For removal of doubt it is declared that a person who ceases to be a member of the Constituent Assembly under the provisions of this Order shall not be disqualified from being a candidate in any election to fill a seat in such Assembly provided that he is not disqualified from doing so under any other law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No Court shall call into question any order passed or any action taken on this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
394	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH CURRENCY ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> CURRENCY ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 84 OF 1972).[24th July, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the issue and putting into circulation of one Taka note 1[ and two Taka note] by the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Currency Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 26th day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (a) “Bangladesh one Taka note” and “Bangladesh two Taka note” shall respectively mean a one Taka note and a two Taka note issued by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 3. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, the Government may issue Bangladesh one Taka notes and Bangladesh two Taka notes and any such notes shall be current in Bangladesh in the same manner and to the same extent and as fully as Taka coin called Government Taka issued under the provisions of the Bangladesh Coinage Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 83 of 1972), and shall be legal tender in Bangladesh for the payment of any amount until such time as they are called in by the Government under the provisions of Article 8 of that Order.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The provisions of Sections 489A, 489B, 489C and 489D of the 4[ Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860)] shall apply in respect of notes issued under this Order as they apply in respect of currency notes and bank notes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5.         The Pakistan Currency Act, 1950 (Act No. XXIX of 1950) is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “and two Taka note” were inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Currency (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. II of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (a) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Currency (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. II of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Article 3 was substituted by section 4 of The Bangladesh Currency (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. II of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words, brackets and figure “Penal Code (XLV of 1860)” were substituted for the words “Pakistan Penal Code as adapted in Bangladesh” by section 5 of The Bangladesh Currency (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. II of 1989)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
395	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (DEMONETISATION OF BANK NOTES) ORDER 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (DEMONETISATION OF BANK NOTES) ORDER 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 61 OF 1972) 12th February 1974. An Act to repeal the Refugees Rehabilitation Finance Corporation Ordinance, 1959, and to amend certain other law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Refugees Rehabilitation Finance Corporation Ordinance, 1959 (II of 1960), and to amend certain other law for the purpose hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Refugees Rehabilitation Finance Corporation (Repeal) Act 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Repeal and Savings </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) The Refugees Rehabilitation Finance Corporation Ordinance, 1959 (II of 1960), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) subject to the provisions of clause (b), all movable properties including furniture, fixtures, cash balances, bank deposits, reserve funds and rights in or arising out of such properties of the Bangladesh Refugees Rehabilitation Finance Corporation, hereinafter referred to as the said Corporation, shall be transferred to, vested in, and distributed between the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank established under the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 129 of 1972), and the Bangladesh Krishi Bank established under the Bangladesh Krishi Bank Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 27 of 1973), in such manner as the Government may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all projects including both immovable and movable properties, bank deposits, reserve funds in relation to the projects of the said Corporation subsisting immediately before the repeal of the said Ordinance shall be transferred to, and vest in, the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all outstanding loans granted either in cash or in kind by the said Corporation immediately before the repeal of the said Ordinance shall be collected and recovered by the Bangladesh Krishi Bank and, for the recovery of such loans, the provisions of the Bangladesh Krishi Bank Order 1973 (P.O. No. 27 of 1973), shall apply as if such loans were granted by the said Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all officers and employees of the said Corporation shall be transferred to, and appointed by, the Bangladesh Krishi Bank and the Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation established under the Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation Order 1973 (P.O. No. 7 of 1973), in such manner and on such terms and conditions as the said Bank or, as the case may be, the House Building Finance Corporation may decide:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or other employee may, within such time as may be specified by the said Bank or, as the case may be, the House Building Finance Corporation to which he is transferred exercise his option not to continue in the service of that Bank or the House Building Finance Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) (i)    all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Corporation in connection with any of the projects situated in Bangladesh and pending immediately before the repeal of the said Ordinance shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Corporation in connection with loans granted by the said Corporation in Bangladesh and pending immediately before the repeal of the said Ordinance shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Bangladesh Krishi Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all debts and obligations incurred, contracts entered into or rights acquired by the said Corporation in connection with any of the projects situated in Bangladesh and subsisting or having effect immediately before the repeal of the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into or acquired for the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Article 2 APO No 3 of 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Bangladesh (Administration of Financial Institutions) Order 1972 (A.P.O. No. 3 of 1972), in Article 2, clause (b) shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
396	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH FISHERIES DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION ACT, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH FISHERIES DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION ACT, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXII OF 1973).[21st September, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation for the purpose of development of fishing industry in Bangladesh and for certain other matters connected therewith or ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 28th day of August, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Corporation” means the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “fish” means any species of fish or aquatic plants and animals including whales, seals, porpoises, dolphins, turtles, shellfish, oysters, crustaceans, frogs, ascidians and spawns and eggs of such animals or plants grown either in salt water or fresh water;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “fishing boat” means a vessel of whatever size, and in whatever way propelled, which is for the time being employed in fishing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “fishing industry” means capturing, preservation, distribution and marketing of fish, and includes processing, manufacturing and disposal of fish and fish by-products; construction of fishing crafts, fishing nets and factories for fishing nets and gears and establishment and operation of refrigeration units, fish markets, fish ports and fish landing terminals and any matter incidental or ancillary thereto; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Act, there shall be established a Corporation to be called the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold and dispose of properties, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Corporation shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation may establish offices, branches or agencies at such other places as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Capital</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The authorised capital of the Corporation shall be taka one crore to be subscribed by the Government from time to time in such manner and form as may be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may increase the authorised capital from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the Corporation may, for carrying on all or any of its functions, have separate capital raised by loan or grant from, or in such manner as may be approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Corporation shall take such measures as it thinks fit for development of fisheries and fishing industries in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the Corporation shall, in order to carry out the purposes of this Act, have power to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        take measures for the development of fisheries and fishing industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) establish fishing industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) establish units for capture of fish and promote a better organisation for exploitation of fish wealth;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        acquire, hold or dispose of fishing boats, fish carriers, road and river transports and all equipment and accessories necessary in connection with the development of fishing industry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        establish units for preservation, processing, distribution and marketing of fish and fish-products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) advance loans to fishing industries and to the fishermen's co-operative societies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        encourage establishment of fishermen's co-operative societies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        undertake survey and investigations of the fish resources;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) establish institutes or make arrangements for the training and research in the methods of catching, processing, transport, preservation and marketing of fish;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) set up organisations for export of fish and fish-products; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) acquire, hold and dispose of such other properties as are required for carrying out all or any of the above-mentioned purposes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Corporation may formulate scheme or schemes for carrying out all or any of the functions specified in this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 7. (1) The general direction and administration of the Corporation and its affairs shall vest in a Board which shall have full authority to exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, in discharging its functions, shall act on commercial considerations and shall be subject to the superintendence and control of the Government and shall also be guided by such general or special instructions as may, from time to time, be given to it by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board of Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Board shall consist of not more than five Directors to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Of the Directors appointed under sub-section (1), at least two shall be whole time Directors.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Director shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        hold office during the pleasure of the Government but not for a period exceeding five years and may be reappointed for such further period or periods as the Government may, from time to time, specify;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        receive such salary and allowances as the Government may determine; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        perform such duties as are assigned to him by this Act or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A casual vacancy in the office of a Director shall be filled in by the appointment of another Director who, subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), shall hold office for the unexpired period of the term of his predecessor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Every person appointed as Director shall divest himself of any directorship or other interest held by him in any firm, company or concern which has dealings with the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Government shall appoint one of the whole time Directors to be the Chairman, who shall be the chief executive officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Duties of the Chairman and Director</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Chairman and other Directors shall exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Director shall be indemnified by the Corporation against all losses and expenses incurred by him in the discharge of his duties except such as are caused by his own wrongful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disqualifications of Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is or has at any time been convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is or has at any time been adjudged insolvent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is found to be a lunatic or becomes of unsound mind;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is subject to a disqualification imposed by or under any law for the time being in force to hold any public office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence of the Government in the case of Chairman or of the Chairman in the case of a Director; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) is a minor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times, and at such places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least one meeting shall be held in three months:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he thinks fit or when the Government requires for any specific purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than three members including the Chairman shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If, for any reason, the Chairman is unable to preside over a meeting of the Board, it shall be presided over by a Director authorised, in writing, by the Chairman, and in default of such authorisation, by such Director as the Directors present may choose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each Director including the Chairman, shall have one vote, but in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No Director shall vote in any matter relating to a concern in which he is directly or indirectly interested.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The minutes of the meetings of the Board shall be sent to the Government within fifteen days from the date of the meeting 2[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Vacancies, etc, not to invalidate acts and proceedings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid by reason only of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board, or any defect in the appointment of a Director.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, employees, consultants and committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Corporation may, subject to such general or specific orders as may be given by the Government from time to time, appoint such officers, advisers, consultants and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may appoint such Committee or Committees as it thinks fit to assist in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public servants etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Directors, officers, advisers and employees of the Corporation shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any provisions of this Act, or the rules and regulations made thereunder, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Board may delegate to the Chairman, or any Director or officer, any of its powers under this Act or the rules or regulations made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman may likewise delegate to any Director or officer any of his powers under this Act or the rules or regulations made thereunder not being a power delegated to him by the Board under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowing power</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Corporation may, with the prior approval of the Government, borrow money in Bangladesh or in foreign currency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Opening of Account</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Corporation may open account with any bank or banks as may be decided by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Investment of Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Corporation may invest its funds in such securities as may be authorised by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Profits</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. After making provisions for bad and doubtful debts, depreciation of assets and any other matter as may be prescribed, the Corporation may, out of its net annual profits, establish a reserve fund and any surplus remaining thereafter shall be paid to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual Budget statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Corporation shall, by such date in each financial year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval, a statement to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) The Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and shall prepare annual statement of accounts, including the profit and loss account and balance-sheet, in accordance with such general directions as may be issued, and in such form as may be prescribed, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet and other accounts of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation, and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance-sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether, in their opinion, the balance-sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of the Corporation's affairs, and if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the Auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measure taken by the Corporation for the protection of the interest of the Government and of the creditors of the Corporation or upon the sufficiency of their procedure in auditing the affairs of the Corporation and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the scope of the audit or direct that different procedure in audit shall be adopted or that any other examination shall be made by the auditors or any other person or persons if, in its opinion, the interest of the Government so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports and returns</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) The Corporation shall furnish to the Government such returns, reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of accounts audited by the auditors under section 22 together with an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year and on its proposal for the next ensuing financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under sub-section (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing powers, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the carrying out of continuous evaluation by the Government of the work of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the maintenance of liaison between the Corporation and other bodies and authorities concerned with administration and development;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the powers of the Directors;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the powers relating to creation of posts in the Corporation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) any other matters required by the provisions of this Act to be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act or the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of the Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that the Corporation shall be dissolved from such date as may be specified in the notification, and thereupon the Corporation shall stand dissolved on that date.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On and from the aforesaid date,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets acquired, and all liabilities and obligations incurred, by the Corporation for purposes of the Corporation or for any of the purposes referred to in this Act shall devolve on the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Chairman and Directors shall vacate their offices.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeals and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The Fisheries Development Corporation Ordinance, 1964 (E.P. Ordinance IV of 1964), and the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation Ordinance, 1973 (Ordinance XVII of 1973), are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the Fisheries Development Corporation Ordinance, 1964 (Ordinance IV of 1964),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Board of Directors of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation established by that Ordinance, hereinafter referred to as the Fisheries Development Corporation, functioning immediately before such repeal shall, until such time as a Board is appointed under section 8, be deemed to be the Board appointed under that section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, funds and all other interests and rights in, or arising out of, such property, of the Fisheries Development Corporation shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the Fisheries Development Corporation subsisting immediately before such repeal shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the liabilities and obligations of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all officers, advisers and other employees of the Fisheries Development Corporation shall be deemed to be officers, advisers and employees of the Corporation and shall hold office on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before such repeal and shall continue to do so unless and until their remuneration or terms and conditions are duly altered by the Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may alter their remuneration or terms and conditions of service whenever it deems fit so to do;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Fisheries Development Corporation before such repeal shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding the repeal of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation Ordinance, 1973 (Ordinance XVII of 1973), anything done or any action taken, including any order made, notification issued or direction given under that Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made, issued or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 7 was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LXXIV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “for approval” were omitted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LXXIV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source ; Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
397	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (FREEDOM FIGHTERS) WELFARE TRUST ORDER 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (FREEDOM FIGHTERS) WELFARE TRUST ORDER 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 94 OF 1972). 7th August, 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for establishment of a Trust for the Welfare of the disabled freedom fighters and dependants of Shaheeds of the war of liberation and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (a) “beneficiaries” means disabled Freedom Fighters, their dependents or the dependents of the Shahids or members of Muktifauz in distress and requiring assistance;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means Board of 3[ Trustees];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “dependant” includes wife, husband, minor sons, unmarried daughters, parents, minor brothers, divorced or widowed sisters of a freedom fighter or of a Shaheed, who are dependant on him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “disabled” means incapable of pursuing any normal vocation because of injuries suffered during the war of liberation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Trust” means the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust established by this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (h) “freedom fighter” means any person who had served as a member of any force engaged in the war of liberation but shall not include the serving members of the defence services, police or the civil armed forces, or any Government pensioner, or any other person having any regular source of income;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “Fund” means the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Fund referred to in Article 12;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (jj) “Managing Director” means the Managing Director of the Trust;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         “Shaheed” means a person who suffered death while engaged in the war of liberation 7[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “Trustee” means a member of the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the coming into force of this Order, there shall be established a corporation to be called the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Trust shall be located at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust may establish such regional or other offices, branches and agencies as the Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The functions of the Trust shall be to provide for the welfare of the beneficiaries and to provide assistance for their relief and rehabilitation, and to acquire property, to promote, establish, maintain and manage commercial and industrial undertakings and to do all things considered necessary for the discharge of the said functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the Trust shall, in particular, have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to give assistance, in cash or kind, for the welfare, relief and rehabilitation of one or more beneficiaries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to promote, establish, undertake and manage projects and schemes the object of which is the welfare of one or more beneficiaries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to establish and maintain clinics, dispensaries or hospitals for specialised treatment of disabled freedom fighters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to establish and maintain rehabilitation and training centres and homes for disabled freedom fighters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to provide vocational training facilities to beneficiaries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to sanction pension to such beneficiaries as are unable to pursue normal vocations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to award scholarships and stipends to deserving beneficiaries for prosecution of studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable or immovable;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to promote, establish, own, possess, manage, maintain and dispose of any industrial or commercial undertakings, with the prior approval of the Government, for the benefit of beneficiaries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to accept the management of any trust fund or endowment in which the Trust is interested;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to receive moneys, securities, instruments or any other movable property for and on behalf of the Trust;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         to invest the moneys and funds of the Trust and to vary the investments as and when it may deem necessary or proper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       to purchase, sell, endorse, transfer, negotiate or otherwise deal in securities of the Government and any other securities as approved by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        to raise loans for its enterprises and undertakings and for this purpose, to pledge, hypothecate, mortgage or otherwise charge the properties of the Trust;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        to enter into contracts, engagements, arrangements and execute necessary documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        to do such other things as may be considered necessary or expedient for carrying out the purposes of this Order including complying with orders and directions issued by the Government from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q)        to do all other things as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to rules and regulations made under this Order, the general direction and superintendence of the affairs and business of the Trust shall vest in a Board of 8[ Trustees] which may exercise all such powers and do all such acts and things as may be exercised by the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, in discharging its functions, shall be guided by such directives as the Government may give from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. 9[ (1) The Board shall consist of the following Trustees, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Prime Minister, Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (b) the Minister–in-charge of the Ministry of Liberation War Affairs, Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, who shall also be its Vice-chairman;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        four members of Parliament (Freedom Fighter) to be nominated by the Prime Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Secretary-in-charge of the Ministry or Division dealing with finance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        Secretary-in-charge of the Ministry or Division dealing with industries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (f) Secretary-in-charge of the Ministry or Division dealing with Liberation War Affairs;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        one representative of the Bangladesh Army (Freedom Fighter), not below the rank of a Brigadier, to be nominated by the Chief of Army Staff;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        Managing Director, Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust, ex-officio.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation - Notwithstanding the definition of “freedom fighter” contained in clause (h) of Article 2 of this Order, for the purpose of this clause “Freedom Fighter” means a freedom fighter who actively participated in the war of liberation.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ 7A. (1) A Management Committee to perform the functions mentioned in clause (2) shall be constituted with the following members, namely:-     13[</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. 14[ (1) The 15[ Chairman] and other Trustees shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ (2) The Government may, at any time, remove any Trustee, other than an ex-officio Trustee, without assigning any reason.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The 17[ Chairman] and other 18[ Trustees] shall exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be prescribed by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19[ (2) In the absence of the Chairman, the powers and functions of the Chairman shall be performed by such officials of the Trust and the meetings of the Board shall be presided over by such Trustee as the Chairman may direct in writing.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ 9A. (1) The Trust shall have a full-time Managing Director to be appointed by the Government, who shall be the chief executive of the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Managing Director shall be appointed on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and at such places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Board shall be conducted in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed by the Board and until such regulations are made in such manner as the Chairman thereof may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Board each 21[ Trustee] shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman thereof shall have a casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. 22[ (1)] The 23[ Board] may, appoint or employ, in such manner and on such terms and conditions 24[ * * *] such officers, advisers and employees as 25[ it] considers necessary for efficient performance of the functions of the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26[ (2) The Board, on the recommendation of the Management Committee, shall have power to take decisions on matters relating to employment, dismissal and any other disciplinary action against any officer or employee of the Trust.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27[ 11A. The Board may, by resolution, delegate such of its powers and functions to the Managing Director or any other officer of the Trust as it may deem fit.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Trust shall have its own Fund to be called the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Fund which shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants and loans from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        donations from the public or any agency, institutions, organisations- foreign, national or international;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        aid and assistance received from foreign Governments; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        income from the undertakings and properties held or managed by the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust, with prior approval of the Government, borrow money from a Commercial Bank or any other financial institution for the purpose of carrying out its functions under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All receipts of the Trust from any source whatsoever shall be credited to the Fund and shall be administered in such manner as may be prescribed by the Board, and until such regulations are made, by the Chairman thereof, and shall be applied to meet all expenditure connected with the execution of the measures for which the Trust is responsible and all charges necessary for the discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Fund shall be kept in any bank or banks approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Trust shall maintain proper and complete accounts in accordance with such general directions as may be issued, and in such form, as may be prescribed, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28[ (2) The accounts of the Trust shall be audited, as soon as possible after the end of the financial year but not later than the 30th day of October of the following financial year, by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountant within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under clause (2) shall be given the account books and connected documents of the Trust for examination and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Trust and, may in connection with such accounts examine the Chairman or any 29[ Trustee] or officer of the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall submit an audit report to the Government in which they shall state whether, in their opinion, accounts of the Trust are properly drawn up and, if they have called for any explanations or information from the Trust, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Trust shall comply with any directive issued by the Government for the rectification of the matters objected to in the audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Trust shall furnish to the Government such returns, reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of accounts audited under Article 13 together with an annual report of the workings of the Trust during that year and its proposal for the next ensuing financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under clause (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before the Legislature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Trust, by such date as may be prescribed by rules, submit to the Government, for approval, a statement, to be called the Annual Budget Statement, in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipt and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Board, may, with previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order or the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purposes of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this Article shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this order the word “Trust” wherever occurring was substituted for the word “Foundation” by the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (a) was substituted by Article 4 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “Trustees” was substituted for the words “Directors of the Foundation” by Article 4 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (f) was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act 1974 (Act No. XXXVII of 1974)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clause (h) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XLI of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Clause (jj) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The semi-colon (;) was substituted for the full stop (.) and thereafter clause (m) was added by section 2 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XXXVII of 1974)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The word “Trustees” was substituted for the word “Directors” by Article 5 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clause (1) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 1993 (Act No. XIV of 1993)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Sub-clause (b) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. LXI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Sub-clause (f) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. LXI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 Article 7A was inserted by section 4 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Sub-clause (a) was substituted by section 4 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. LXI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 Clause (1) was substituted by Article 7 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 The word “Chairman” was substituted for the words “Managing Director” by section 3 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXVIII of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 Clause (2) was substituted by Section 5 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The word “Chairman” was substituted for the words “Managing Director” by section 4 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXVIII of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18 The word “Trustees” was substituted for the word “Directors” by Article 8 of the Bangladesh (Freedom Fighters) Welfare Foundation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 159 of 1972)</p><p
