Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any memorandum or articles of association, deed or other instrument, on the commencement of this Order,—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all assets of the East Pakistan Shipping Corporation and the Pakistan River Steamers Limited shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into, and all agreements made, by or with the East Pakistan Shipping Corporation and the Pakistan River Steamers Limited shall stand transferred to, and be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by or with, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all assets belonging to any public or private limited company or any firm or any individual engaged in coastal or inland shipping or water transport business, vested in the Government under the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) Order, 1972 (P. O. No. 16 of 1972), including in particular those enumerated in the Schedule to this Order, shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Corporation 6[ and the liabilities of such company, firm or individual in respect of such assets determined under Article 9 of that Order shall be the liabilities of the Corporation].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the East Pakistan Shipping Corporation and the Pakistan River Steamers Limited before the commencement of this Order shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Corporation and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. If, after assessment of the assets and liabilities of any company, firm or individual transferred to the Corporation under Article 23, the value of the assets exceed the value of the liabilities, the Government shall, in respect of the excess pay, such compensation as it may determine to such person as it may find to be entitled thereto:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no compensation shall be payable in respect of any assets which have already vested in the Government by or under any law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Corporation may appoint such officers, consultants, advisers, auditors, and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation may employ such officers or other employees of the East Pakistan Shipping Corporation or of the Pakistan River Steamers Limited or of the Company, firm or individual whose assets have vested in the Corporation under Article 23 as it may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any rules, regulations or contract relating to the terms and conditions of service, a person employed under clause (2) shall serve on such terms and conditions as the Corporation may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If the terms and conditions of service determined by the Corporation under clause (3) are not acceptable to any officer or employee, such officer or employee shall have the option not to accept the employment under the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this Article shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The East Pakistan Shipping Corporation Ordinance, 1964 (E. P. Ord. No. III of 1964), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (1) was substituted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (XXVII of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words and figure “Taka 45 crores” were substituted for the words and figure “Taka 5 crores” by section 2 of The Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1979 (VII of 1979)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The figure “4500,000” were substituted for the figure “500,000” by section 2 of The Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1979 (VII of 1979)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “three of the other Directors to be whole-time officers” were substituted for the words “one of the other Directors to be a whole-time officer” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1973 (Act No. XIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “Directors” was substituted for the word “Director” by section 2 of the Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1973 (Act No. XIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “and the liabilities of such company, firm or individual in respect of such assets determined under Article 9 of that Order shall be the liabilities of the Corporation” were inserted by section 2 of The Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIX of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
405	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH INSURANCE CORPORATION (DISSOLUTION) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH INSURANCE CORPORATION (DISSOLUTION) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 161 OF 1972).[30th December, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the dissolution of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation, and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation (Dissolution) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Bangladesh Insurance Corporation” means the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation established by the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 18 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Corporation” means the Teesta Bima Corporation established by the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Insurer” means an insurer as defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), who carries on Insurance business in Bangladesh and includes a provident Society as defined in section 65 of that Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Pakistan Insurance Corporation” means the Pakistan Insurance Corporation established by the Pakistan Insurance Corporation Act, 1952 (Act XXXVIII of 1952); and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “subsidiary Corporation” means the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation, the Teesta Bima Corporation, the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation or the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation established by Article 4 of the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, on the commencement of this Order-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) The Bangladesh Insurance Corporation shall stand dissolved with effect from 1st January,  1973;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all assets of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation, except such cash assets which the Government may, by order, specify, shall stand transferred to, and vested in the Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation 1 – The expression “assets” includes rights, privileges, authorities, powers, properties, both movable and immovable, including cash balance, bank deposits, reserve funds, general reserves, investments, deposits and all other interests and rights in or arising out of such properties and all books of accounts and documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation 2 – The expression “Cash assets” includes cash balances, bank deposits, reserve funds, general reserves, investments deposits and all other interests and rights therein or arising thereout;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all cash assets of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation which are not vested in the Corporation under sub-clause (b) shall be administered and disposed of in such manner as the Government may direct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all offices and establishments of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation shall be deemed to be offices and establishments of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) such officers and employees of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation who are citizens of, and employed in, Bangladesh shall be deemed to be officers and employees of the Corporation as may be specified by the Corporation on such terms and conditions as the Corporation may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the provisions of Article 19 of the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972), shall apply to all officers and employees who are employed by the Corporation by virtue of this sub-clause:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the Government may, by order, direct the Corporation to appoint such officers and employees of the Pakistan Insurance Corporation employed outside Bangladesh on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all suits and other legal proceedings by or against the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) all such liabilities or classes of liabilities (including book debts) of the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation as may be determined by the Government shall be liabilities or classes of liabilities of the Corporation, and shall be administered by the Corporation in the manner to be specified by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) all amounts due to the insurers vested in the Teesta Bima Corporation and the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation established under the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972) in respect of the reinsurance and the national co-insurance scheme shall be determined and the amount so determined to be due to the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation shall be paid to the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) The Corporation shall pay to such shareholders of the Pakistan Insurance Corporation as are citizens of Bangladesh in respect of such shares as have not already vested in the Government by or under any law, and such compensation shall be determined and distributed among the shareholders in the manner prescribed by rules made under the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972) for the purpose of making payment of compensation to the shareholders of an insurer:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the total compensation payable under this clause shall not exceed the total paid up value of the shares held by the shareholders, among whom such compensation is to be distributed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the Bangladesh Insurance Corporation Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 18 of 1972) shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
406	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE BANGLADESH INSURANCE (EMERGENCY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> INSURANCE (EMERGENCY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 30 OF 1972).[26th March, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is necessary to provide for taking over in the public interest the management of certain life and general insurance business pending nationalisation thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Insurance (Emergency Provisions) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall extend to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall apply to all Insurers as defined hereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless the context requires otherwise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        “Insurance business” means all business as defined in clauses (6B), (6C), (11), (13A) and (13B) of section 2 of the Insurance Act of an insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        “Custodian” means the person appointed under section 3 to take over the management of any Insurance business of an insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) “Insurance Act” means the Insurance Act, 1938.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        “Insurer” means the insurer as defined under clause (9) of section 2 of the Insurance Act, 1938 as adapted in Bangladesh under the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Insurance Act) Order, 1972, and includes a provident society as defined in section 65 of the said Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5)        “notified order” means an order as notified in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6)        All other words and expressions used in this Order but not defined, and defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 shall have the same meanings respectively assigned to them in that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Order, the management of the business of an insurer shall vest in the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may appoint a Custodian for the purpose of taking over the management of the insurance business of an insurer pending which the persons in charge of the management of such business immediately before the commencement of this Order shall, on and from the date of the commencement of the Order, be in charge of the management of the insurance business for and on behalf of the Government, and the insurance business shall be carried on by them subject to such directions as the Government may give.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On the appointment of a Custodian under sub-section (1) all persons in charge of the management of the insurance business of the insurer shall cease to be in charge of such management and shall be bound to deliver to the Custodian all books of account, registers, or other documents relating to the insurer in their custody.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may issue such directions to the Custodian as to his powers and duties or prohibit him from performing such acts or deeds as it deems necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Custodian may seek instructions from Government as to manner in which he shall conduct the business of the insurer or on any other matter arising in course of its management.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Custodian shall receive such remuneration as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Government may at any time cancel the appointment of any person as Custodian.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Order or under any law for the time being in force, any act or deed performed by the management of an insurer after the 25th day of March, 1971 in the form of making new appointments, giving promotions or increments in salary, bringing in changes in the salary structure involving additional expenditure, giving loan (other than loan granted against the security of life policies) or advances, incurring any expenditure other than for routine payments of salaries, commissions, etc. shall be treated as void unless expressly exempted by a notified order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Every insurer shall forthwith deposit all securities and documents of title to any assets appertaining to the insurance business in any Bank in which the insurer had an account immediately before the appointed day in the place where the head office or any of the principal offices of the insurer is situated; and no such security or documents shall be withdrawn from the Bank, as the case may be, except with the permission of the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing contained in this sub-section shall apply to any security or document of title kept pursuant to the provisions contained in sub-section (4) of section 27 of the Insurance Act, or kept in trust with an Official Trustee in pursuance of the Articles of Association of an insurer unless the Government, by notified order, otherwise directs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every insurer shall deliver forthwith at the place and to the person specified in this behalf by the Government in respect of the insurer the following documents, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the minutes book or any other book in Bangladesh containing all resolutions of the persons in charge of the management of the insurance business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the current cheque books relating to the insurance business which are at the head office and/or the principal offices of the insurer in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       all registers or other books containing particulars relating to the investment of any moneys appertaining to the insurance business including investments or mortgaged properties and all loans granted and advances made otherwise than on policies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       all brokers' notes or certificates in possession of the insurer in respect of any orders for the investment of any moneys to the insurance business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may require the persons in charge of the management of the insurance business of an insurer under this Order to furnish to the Government or to any person authorised by Government such returns, statements and other information relating to the insurance business as may be mentioned in the direction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The persons in charge of the management of the business of an insurer under this Order shall be entitled to such remuneration, whether by way of allowance or salary as the Government may determine; and any such person may, by giving a month's notice in writing to the Government of his intention so to do, relinquish charge of the management of the insurance business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The amount of compensation payable in respect of the vesting in the Government of the management of the insurance business, which had not already vested in or been taken over by the Government by or under any law, of an insurer shall, be such sum as may be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The compensation payable under section 7 shall be distributed among the persons entitled thereto by the Government in such manner as may be prescribed by rules made in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. If any person-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        fails to deliver to the Custodian any books of account, registers or any other documents in his custody relating to the business of an insurer in respect of its management; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) retains any property of such insurer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) fails to comply with any directions issued or provisions contained in this Order, he shall be punishable upon conviction in a court of law with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand taka, or with both</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. No proceeding for the winding up of an insurer, the management of whose insurance business has vested in the Government under this Order or for the appointment of a receiver in respect of such business, shall lie in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. In computing the period of limitation prescribed by any law for the time being in force for any suit or application against any person by an insurer in respect of any matter arising out of his insurance business, the time during which this has been in force shall be excluded.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The provisions of this Order shall have effect notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in other law or any instrument having effect by virtue of any law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government may, by notified order, direct that all or any of the powers exercised by it under this Order may also be exercised by any such person as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any Custodian in respect of anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government or any Custodian for any damage caused or likely to be caused by anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Nothing contained in this Order shall apply to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any insurer to whom the Insurance Act does not apply by reason of the provisions contained in section 2B thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any insurance business carried on by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any insurer carrying on life insurance business incorporated under the law of any country or State (excluding Pakistan) outside Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13.       (1) The Government may, by notified order, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, rules made under clause (1) may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the form and manner in which books of accounts of an insurance business shall be maintained by insurers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the manner in which any compensation payable under this Order may be paid to the persons entitled thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the circumstances in which the remuneration payable to persons in charge of the management of business of an insurer under this Order or to Custodian whether wholly or in part shall be met by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. On a dispute arising on the meaning or interpretation of any sentence or part of a sentence or word contained in this Order, the decision of the Government shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
407	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH INSURANCE (NATIONALISATION) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> INSURANCE (NATIONALISATION) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 95 OF 1972).[8th August, 197]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the nationalisation of insurance business in Bangladesh by transferring all such business to certain corporations established for the purpose and to provide for the regulation and control of the business of the corporations and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Directors of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “controlling Corporation” means the Bangladesh Jatiya Bima Corporation established by Article 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Corporation” means the controlling Corporation or a subsidiary Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Director” means a Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “general subsidiary Corporation” means the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation or the Teesta Bima Corporation ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “insurer” means an insurer as defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), who carries on insurance business in Bangladesh and includes a provident society as defined in section 65 of that Act ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “life subsidiary Corporation” means the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation or the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “Schedule” means the Schedule to this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         “subsidiary Corporation” means the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation, the Teesta Bima Corporation, the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation or the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation established by Article 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All other words and expressions used in this Order but not defined and defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Order and any rules made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) On the commencement of this Order, there shall be established five Corporations to be called the Bangladesh Jatiya Bima Corporation, the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation, the Teesta Bima Corporation, the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation and the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Corporation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Order, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The authorised capital of the controlling Corporation shall be ten crore taka to be subscribed by the Government from time to time according to the requirements of the Corporation and in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The authorised capital of each subsidiary Corporation shall be two crore taka to be subscribed by the controlling Corporation from time to time according to the requirements of such Corporation and in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to rules made under this Order, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of every Corporation shall vest in a Board of Directors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Board in discharging its functions shall act on commercial consideration having due regard to public interest generally.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Board of the controlling Corporation shall be guided on questions of policy by such general or special instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time and, if any question arises as to whether any question is a question of policy or not, the decision of the Government shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Board of a subsidiary Corporation shall be guided by such general or special instructions as may be given to it by the controlling Corporation from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Board of the controlling Corporation shall consist of four whole-time directors to be appointed by the Government and not more than five other Directors to be appointed by the Government in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall appoint one of the whole time Directors of the controlling Corporation to be the Chairman of its Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other Directors of the controlling Corporation shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may at any time terminate the appointment of the Chairman or any other Director of the controlling Corporation without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman or any other Director of the controlling Corporation may at any time resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Board of a subsidiary Corporation shall consist of five whole-time Directors to be appointed by the controlling Corporation with the prior approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The controlling Corporation shall appoint one of the Directors of a subsidiary Corporation to be the Chairman of the Board of that Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other Directors of a subsidiary Corporation shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the controlling Corporation may, with the approval of the Government, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The controlling Corporation may, at any time, with the prior approval of the Government, terminate the appointment of the Chairman or any other Director of a subsidiary Corporation without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman or any other Director of a subsidiary Corporation may, at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the controlling Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No act or proceeding of a Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Chairman of a Corporation shall be the chief executive officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other Directors of a Corporation shall exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be prescribed or assigned to them by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other Directors of a Corporation shall divest themselves of any directorship held by them in any other Corporation or in any company otherwise than on behalf of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director of a Corporation who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is or at any time has been adjudicated insolvent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is found to be a lunatic or of unsound mind;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is or at any time has been convicted of an offence which, in the opinion of the Government, is an offence involving moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or, in the case of the Chairman, by the Government or the controlling Corporation as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The meetings of a Board shall be held at such times and place as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board of the controlling Corporation not less than five, including at least two whole-time Directors, and at a meeting of the Board of a subsidiary Corporation not less than three Directors, including the Chairman, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of a Board each Director shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No Director shall vote on any matter in which he is directly or indirectly interested.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If for any reason the Chairman of a Board is unable to be present at a meeting, a Director elected by the Directors present shall preside over the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Every Board may appoint such committee or committees as it thinks fit to assist it in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Subject to rules made under this Order, it shall be the function of the controlling Corporation to supervise, control, regulate, co ordinate and guide the activities, business and affairs of the subsidiary Corporations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, the controlling Corporation shall, in particular, have power—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to prepare periodical reports on the activities of subsidiary Corporations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to make comparative evaluation of performance of the subsidiary Corporations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to conduct expense analysis for the purpose of ascertaining cost ratios of subsidiary Corporations and causes of difference, if any, of costs between different subsidiary Corporations and of variations thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to conduct mortality analysis for the purpose of ascertaining deviation of experienced mortality rates from the assumed mortality rates and causes thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to guide and assist the subsidiary Corporations in adopting modern techniques and practices in different fields relating to their functions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to conduct research on insurance subjects and on different types of insurance schemes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to undertake publicity for popularising insurance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to formulate policy on underwriting;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to arrange training facilities for administrative staff and sales personnel;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to assist the subsidiary Corporations in the matter of rendering efficient service to policy holders;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to do all other things connected with or ancillary to any of the matters referred to in sub clauses (a) to (j).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Subject to the provisions of Article 15 and rules made under this Order, it shall be the function of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (a) a general subsidiary Corporation to carry on all kinds of general insurance and re-insurance business, whether in or outside Bangladesh; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a life subsidiary Corporation to carry on all kinds of life insurance and re-insurance business, whether in or outside Bangladesh.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, every subsidiary Corporation shall, in particular, have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to acquire, hold and dispose of any property for the purpose of its business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to transfer the whole or any part of its insurance business carried on outside Bangladesh to any other person or persons, if in the interest of the Corporation it is expedient so to do;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to carry on any other business which may seem to the Corporation to be capable of being conveniently carried on in connection with its business and calculated directly or indirectly to render profitable the business of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to do all such things as may be incidental or conducive to the proper exercise of any of the powers of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The head office of the controlling Corporation shall be at Dacca and the head office of every subsidiary Corporation shall be at such place as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every Corporation may establish as many other offices in Bangladesh and abroad as its Board thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) On the commencement of this Order, there shall be transferred to and vested in-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation the entire undertaking appertaining to the general insurance business of every insurer specified in Part A of the Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Teesta Bima Corporation the entire undertaking appertaining to the general insurance business of every insurer specified in Part B of the Schedule ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation the entire undertaking appertaining to the life insurance business of every insurer specified in Part C of the Schedule ; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation the entire undertaking appertaining to the life insurance business of every insurer specified in Part D of the Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (1A) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make any addition to or omission from the list of insurer in any Part in the Schedule.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Order, a general subsidiary Corporation or a life subsidiary Corporation may, until the 31st day of December, 1972, use the name and seal of the insurer whose undertaking has been transferred to and vested in it under clause (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The undertaking appertaining to the general insurance business or the life insurance business of an insurer which is transferred to and vests in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 shall, subject to the provisions of this Order, be deemed to include all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable or immovable, cash balances, reserve funds, investments, deposits and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property as were immediately before the commencement of this Order in the ownership, possession, power or control of the insurer in relation to the undertaking within the territory of Bangladesh or in relation to the business of such undertaking outside Bangladesh, and all books of account, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, and shall, subject to the provisions of this Order and unless the Government otherwise directs be deemed to include all borrowings, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind then subsisting of the insurer in relation to such undertaking :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the liabilities and obligations of the insurer in relation to such undertaking shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, not include any liability or obligation under any policy issued by him to a person who is not a citizen of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any assets or other properties vesting in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 are subject to any trust, the assets or other properties shall be deemed to have vested in the subsidiary Corporation free from any such trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If, according to the laws of any country outside Bangladesh, the provisions of the ¬Order by themselves are not effective to transfer or vest any asset situated in that country which forms part of the undertaking of an insurer to, or in, the subsidiary Corporation concerned, the affairs of the insurer in relation to such asset shall, on and from the commencement of this Order, stand entrusted to the chief executive officer for the time being of the subsidiary Corporation concerned, and the chief executive officer may exercise all such powers and do all such acts and things as may be exercised or done by the insurer for the purpose of effectively transferring such asset.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The chief executive officer of the subsidiary Corporation concerned shall, in exercise of the power conferred on him by clause (3), take all such steps as may be required by the laws of any such country outside Bangladesh for the purpose of effecting such transfer or vesting, and may either himself or through any person authorised by him in this behalf realise any asset of the insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Unless otherwise expressly provided by or under this Order and unless the Government otherwise directs, all contracts, deeds, bonds, agreements, powers of attorney, grants of legal representation and other instruments of whatever nature subsisting or having effect immediately before the commencement of this Order and to which an insurer whose undertaking has been transferred to and vested in a subsisting Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 is a party or which are in favour of such insurer shall, in so far as they relate to such undertaking of the insurer, be of as full force and effect against or in favour of the subsidiary Corporation, and may be enforced or acted upon as fully and effectually as if in the place of the insurer the subsidiary Corporation had been a party thereto or as if they had been entered into or issued in favour of the subsidiary Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Subject to the other provisions of this Order and unless the Government otherwise directs, any suit, appeal or other proceeding of whatever nature pending on the date of the commencement of this Order by or against an insurer in relation to any of his undertakings shall be deemed to be suit, appeal or other proceeding pending by or against the subsidiary Corporation in which the undertaking has vested under clause (1) of Article 17, and may be continued or prosecuted and enforced by or against that Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) If any question arises as to whether any undertaking appertains to the general insurance business or the life insurance business of an insurer, or whether any asset, right, power, authority or privilege or any property, cash balance, reserve fund, investment or deposit is in the ownership, possession, power or control of an insurer in relation to any of his undertakings transferred to a subsidiary Corporation, or whether any borrowing, liability or obligation of insurer relates to any of his undertakings transferred to a subsidiary Corporation, or whether any contract deed, bond, agreement, power of attorney, grant of legal representation or other instrument related to any of the undertakings of an insurer transferred to a subsidiary Corporation or whether any suit, appeal or other proceeding is pending by or against an insurer in relation to any of his undertakings transferred to a subsidiary Corporation, the question shall be referred to the Government whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) Where any undertaking of an insurer does not relate exclusively to his general insurance business or life insurance business of where such undertaking relates to both general insurance business and life insurance business of the insurer, such undertaking shall be transferred to such subsidiary Corporation, in such manner and to such extent as the Government may, by order, direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty arising out of, or in connection with, the transfer of any undertaking of an insurer to a subsidiary Corporation or any matter supplemental or incidental to, or consequential upon, such transfer or any other matter specified in this Article, make such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to, as part of the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) Every Corporation may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Corporation may employ such officers and other employees of an insurer whose undertaking has been transferred to a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 as the controlling Corporation may specify, and the officers and other employees so employed shall hold their office or service in the Corporation which employs them on such terms and conditions as that Corporation may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or other employee may, within such time, as may be specified by the Corporation which employs him, exercise his option not to continue in the service of that Corporation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the controlling Corporation may, within one year from the Commencement of this Order, transfer an Officer or other employee from one Corporation to another.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If any question arises out the transfer of an officer or other employee of an insurer under clause (2), the question shall be referred to the Government whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The transfer of service of any officer or other employee from an insurer to the controlling Corporation or to a subsidiary Corporation shall not entitle any such officer or other employee to any compensation and no such claim shall be entertained by any court, tribunal or other authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in any rules, regulations, contract or agreement relating to the terms and conditions of service made or entered into by an insurer or in the Articles of Association of any such insurer, no person shall be entitled to any compensation against the insurer or against any Corporation for the loss of his office or service or for the premature termination of any contract or agreement of management entered into by him with the insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Order, the controlling Corporation shall determine the pay scales of the different classes of officers and other employees of a subsidiary Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Where all the officers and other employees of an insurer have been employed by one or more Corporations under clause (2), the money and other assets belonging to any provident, superannuation, or any other fund established by the insurer for the benefit of such officers and other employees and in respect of which a trust has been constituted by him shall be transferred to, and vest in, such Corporation or Corporations, free from any such trust, in such manner as the Government may, by order, specify, and the trustees of such trust shall, as from the date of such transfer, stand discharged from the trust, except as respects things done or omitted to be done before such date.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) Where all the officers and other employees of an insurer have not been employed by the Corporations under clause (2), the moneys and other assets belonging to any such fund as is referred to in clause (7) shall be apportioned between the trustees of the fund and the Corporations which have employed some of the officers and other employees of the ¬insurer in such manner as the Government may, by order, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) Where any undertaking has vested in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        every person, in whose possession or custody or under whose control any property appertaining to the undertaking may be, shall deliver the property to the subsidiary Corporation forthwith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any person who on the commencement of this Order has in his possession or custody or under his control any books, documents or other papers relating to the undertaking shall deliver them to the subsidiary Corporation or to such person as the subsidiary Corporation may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the provisions of clause (1), it shall be lawful for a subsidiary Corporation to take all necessary steps for securing possession of all properties which have vested in the subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) Where an insurer whose undertaking has been transferred to a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 has, at any time after the 25th day of March, 1971, or where a Custodian appointed under the Bangladesh Insurance (Emergency Provisions) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 30 of 1972), in respect of such undertaking has-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        wilfully caused loss or damage to any property appertaining to the undertaking ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        misused any such property ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        sold or disposed of any such property without consideration or for an inadequate consideration or made any payment to any person without consideration and the sale, disposal or payment was not reasonably necessary for the purpose of the insurance business of the insurer,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the subsidiary Corporation may lodge a complaint with the Government in respect of such loss, damage, misuse, sale, disposal or payment, against those who were responsible for such loss, damage, misuse, sale, disposal or payment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may make such order against the parties complained against as it thinks just having regard to the extent to which those parties were respectively responsible for the loss, damage, misuse, sale, disposal or payment or benefited therefrom.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where an application made to the Government under this Article is determined in favour of the subsidiary Corporation, the Government shall take such measures as may be necessary to enforce its order and any amount payable to the Corporation under the order may be recovered as arrear of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government shall give compensation to an insurer for such of his undertaking transferred to a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 as has not already vested in the Government by or under any law, and such compensation shall be determined and distributed among the shareholders of the insurer in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the total compensation payable to an insurer under this Article shall not exceed the total paid up value of the shares held by the shareholders among whom such compensation is to be distributed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) The controlling Corporation shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement, to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for every financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every subsidiary Corporation shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the controlling Corporation for approval a statement, to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for every financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Subject to the provisions of the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), every subsidiary Corporation may invest its funds in such manner as may be approved by the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. Every Corporation may, with the prior approval of the Government borrow such sums, with or without security, as may be required by it to discharge its functions under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) Every Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and prepare annual statements of accounts, including the profit and loss account and balance sheet, and shall comply in respect of such accounts with such general directions as may be issued by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of every Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961 (Ord. X of 1961), who shall be appointed by the Government in the case of the controlling Corporation and by the controlling Corporation in the case of a subsidiary Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under clause (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet and other accounts of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation, and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books of accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Government and, in the case of audit of accounts of a subsidiary Corporation, also to the controlling Corporation upon the annual balance sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether in their opinion the balance sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of affairs of the Corporation and, if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government, in the case of the controlling Corporation, or the controlling Corporation, in the case of a subsidiary Corporation, may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Corporation concerned for the protection of the interest of the Government, or, as the case may be, of the controlling Corporation and of the creditors of the Corporation concerned or upon the sufficiency of the procedure in auditing the affairs of the Corporation concerned, and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the scope of the audit or direct that different procedure in audit shall be adopted or that any other examination shall be made by the auditors or any other person or persons if, in its opinion, the interest of the Government or, as the case may be, of the controlling Corporation so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. Each life subsidiary Corporation shall, once at least in every two years, cause an investigation to be made by actuaries into the financial condition of' its business, including a valuation of its liabilities in respect thereto, and submit the report of the actuaries to the controlling Corporation and also to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28.
