(1) Every Corporation shall furnish to the Government and every subsidiary Corporation shall also furnish to the controlling Corporation such returns, reports and statements as the Government or, as the case may be, the controlling Corporation may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) As soon as possible after the end of every financial year, every Corporation shall furnish to the Government and every subsidiary Corporation shall also furnish to the controlling Corporation a statement of accounts audited by the auditors under Article 26 together with an annual report in the prescribed form on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under clause (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before the Legislature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. Every subsidiary Corporation shall pay, each year to the controlling Corporation such sum as may be required by the controlling Corporation for the performance of its functions under this Order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such sum shall not exceed one per cent of the gross premium received by a general subsidiary Corporation and three per cent of the gross premium received by a life subsidiary Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) After making provision for bad and doubtful debts, depreciation of assets and any other matter determined by the Board, the controlling Corporation of a general subsidiary Corporation may, out of its net annual profits, establish a reserve fund and any surplus remaining thereafter shall be paid-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in the case of the controlling Corporation, to the Government or, if the Government so directs, be utilised for such purposes and in such manner as the Government may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in the case of a general subsidiary Corporation, to the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If as a rsult of any investigation undertaken by a life subsidiary Corporation under Article 27 any surplus emerges, ninety-five per cent of such surplus or such higher percentage thereof as the Government may approve shall be allocated to or reserved for the life insurance policy-holders of the Corporation and the remainder shall be paid to the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">31</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. Except to the extent otherwise expressly provided in this Order, on and from the commencement of this Order the general subsidiary Corporations shall have the exclusive privilege of carrying on general insurance business and the life subsidiary Corporation shall have the exclusive privilege of carrying on life insurance business in Bangladesh; and on and from such commencement any certificate of registration under the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), held by any insurer immediately before such commencement shall cease to have effect in so far as it authorises him to carry on any insurance business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. Where any property or right appertaining to the undertaking of an insurer is transferred to and vested in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 or would be so transferred and vested but for the fact that such transfer and vesting are governed otherwise than by the law of Bangladesh, the insurer shall comply with such directions as may be given to him by the subsidiary Corporation for the purpose of securing that the ownership of the property, or as the case may be, that the rights is effectively transferred to the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. The sums assured by all policies issued by the subsidiary Corporations including any bonuses declared in respect thereof and the sums assured by all policies issued to citizens of Bangladesh by any insurer the liabilities under which have vested in a subsidiary Corporation under this Order, and all bonuses declared in respect thereof, whether before or after the commencement of this Order, shall be guaranteed as to payment in cash by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies shall apply to a Corporation and a Corporation shall not be wound up save by order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. An insurer, being a company the undertaking of which has vested in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17, shall stand dissolved in Bangladesh on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">36</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. If any person wilfully withholds or fails to deliver to a subsidiary Corporation, as required by Article 20, any property or any book, document or other paper which may be in his possession or unlawfully retains in his possession any property of an insurer which has vested in a subsidiary Corporation under clause (1) of Article 17 or wilfully applies any such property to purposes other than those expressed in or authorised by this Order or fails to comply with any order of the Government made under clause (2) of Article 21, he shall, on the complaint of the subsidiary Corporation, be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine which may extend to one thousand taka or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">37</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. Nothing in this Order shall apply in relation to—</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any insurer whose business is being voluntarily wound up or is being wound up under the orders of the court;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any insurer to whom the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), does not apply by reason of the provisions contained in section 2B thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        postal life insurance business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        any insurer, being a company incorporated under the law of any foreign country other than Pakistan carrying on life insurance business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">38</p><p style="text-align: justify;">38. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any Director, officer or employee of a Corporation for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">39</p><p style="text-align: justify;">39. Any dispute between the controlling Corporation and a subsidiary Corporation, or between two subsidiary Corporations, may be referred by any of the Corporations involved in the dispute to the Government whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">40</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40. The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct that any power which by or under any of the provisions of this Order is conferred on it shall, subject to such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the Order, be exercisable also by the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">41</p><p style="text-align: justify;">41. The provisions of the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938) shall, as far as may be, apply to a Corporation as they apply to any other insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">42</p><p style="text-align: justify;">42. If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Order, the Government may make such Order, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order, as may appear to it to be necessary for the purpose of removing difficulty.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">43</p><p style="text-align: justify;">43. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the form and manner in which capital of a Corporation may be subscribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the manner of appointment of a part time Director of the controlling Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the terms and conditions of service of the Chairman and other Directors of the controlling Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the powers, functions and duties of the Chairman and other Directors of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the time and place at which meetings of a Board may be held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the manner in which compensation shall be determined and distributed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the form in which the annual report of a Corporation shall be prepared;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        any other matter which has to be or may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">44</p><p style="text-align: justify;">44. (1) Every Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that regulations made by a subsidiary Corporation shall be forwarded to the Government, through the controlling Corporation, for approval and shall not also be inconsistent with the provisions of the regulations made by the controlling Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this Article shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Sub-clauses (a) and (b) were substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President`s Order No. 133 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (1A) was inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 133 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
408	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH JUTE RESEARCH INSTITUTE ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH JUTE RESEARCH INSTITUTE ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XIII OF 1974).[6th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to establish a Jute Research Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a Jute Research Institute for the purpose of undertaking agricultural and technical research on Jute and for matters incidental or ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the 1[ Bangladesh] Jute Research Institute Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 10th day of November, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of 2[ Management]of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (c) “Council” means ???????? ???? ?????? ????????</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">established by ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(cc)      “Director-General” means the Director-General of the Institute;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Institute” means the Jute Research Institute established by this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Act, there shall be established an Institute to be called the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head Office, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head Office of the Institute shall be located at 4[ Dhaka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute may establish offices and branches at such other places as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Subject to rules and regulations made under this Act, the General direction and administration of the Institute and its affairs shall vest in a Board of 5[ Management] which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall be guided on questions of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain direction etc of Council to be given effect to</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 6. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Institute, or any of its functionaries shall, in relation to the affairs of the Institute, ensure that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any direction issued by the Council under or in pursuance of the provisions of section 8 or 14 of ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???) is, complied with and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any recommendation or determination made or advice given by the Council under or in pursuance of the said provisions is given effect to :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where, in the opinion of the Institute, it is not possible to give effect to such recommendation or advice or any part thereof,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Institute shall, without delay, communicate its opinion with reasons therefore to the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the Council may, after consideration of such opinion, modify or revoke its earlier recommendation or advice, or may issue fresh recommendation or advice on the same subject :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the recommendation or advice so modified or issued afresh, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be a direction under clause (a) and shall be complied with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6A. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Director-General, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        one eminent technologist in the field of jute products, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with Jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a representative of the Bangladesh Federation of Chambers of Commerce and Industries, to be nominated by that Federation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        a representative of the Council, to be nominated by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) a representative of the Bangladesh Jute Mills Corporation, not below the rank of Director, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with Jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         a representative of the Department of Agricultural Extension, not below the rank of Director, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the Directors of the Institute, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        two senior scientists of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         two representatives, one from among the farmers and the other from among the Non-Government Organisations (NGO's) performing the functions similar to those of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture; 7[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         three representatives, one from each of the Ministries and Divisions dealing with agriculture, finance and jute, not below the rank of Deputy Secretary, to be nominated by the respective 8[ Ministry or Division; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (k) a representative of the Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research(BCSIR), not below the rank of Member, to be nominated by the Ministry of Science and Information &amp; Communication Technology.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-in-charge of Administration of the Institute shall act as the Secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tenure of membership, resignation etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6B. (1) The members specified in clause (i) of section 6A (1) shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their nomination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such members may resign their membership in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall cease to be a member, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dies; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        being a member specified in clause (i) of section 6A(1)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         resigns his membership under the proviso to sub-section (1) of this section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        his tenure expires under sub-section (1) of this section; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       remains absent, without permission of the Chairman, from three consecutive meetings of the Board; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is declared by a competent court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) has been, on conviction for a criminal offence involving moral turpitude, sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than three months or to a fine not less than five thousand taka and unless a period of two years has elapsed since his release or realisation of the fine, as the case may be, a person so sentenced shall not be eligible to be a member.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ Director-General]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The 11[ Director-General] shall be appointed by the Government for such period and on such salary, terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 12[ Director-General] shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or assigned to him by the Board from time to time; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) divest himself of any directorship held by him in any other corporation, company or concern otherwise than on behalf of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The functions of Institute shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to 13[ * * *] promote agricultural, technological and economic research on jute and allied fibres and their manufactures and dissemination of results thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to organise production, testing and supply of improved pedigree of jute seeds and multiplication procurement and their distribution to recognised organisations, selected growers and such other agencies as may be approved by the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to set up research centres, sub-stations, pilot projects and farms in different regions of the country for carrying out research on different problems of jute and allied fibre crops, jute products and allied materials;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to establish project areas for demonstration of new varieties of jute developed by the Institute and to train the farmers for cultivation of those varieties of jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to publish annual reports, monograms, bulletins, and other literatures relating to jute research and the activities of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to organise training of officers and progressive farmers in modern improved method of jute and cultivation of allied fibre crops and also to train technical hands for utilisation of technological research findings; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to do and perform such other activities as may be necessary for the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the 14[ Secretary of the Board], with the prior approval of the Chairman, when he so thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Four members shall constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes the Chairman 15[ or the member presiding over the meeting] shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman, and in the absence of the Chairman, 16[ * * *] by a member elected for the purpose by the members present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Funds of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Institute shall have its own Fund which shall be utilised by it to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Fund shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        loans and foreign aids obtained by the Institute with the prior approval of the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all other sums received by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Institute may open a deposit account with any bank or banks.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Advisory Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ 11. (1) There shall be three Advisory Committees, namely, the Agricultural Research Committee, the Technological Research Committee and the Seed Production Committee, consisting of such persons as may be appointed by the Board from among persons who, by virtue of their knowledge and experience, can render valuable advice to the agricultural and technological research on jute and seed production.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 18[ Director-General] shall be the Chairman of the three committees.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Advisers, Directors, Officers etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19[ 12. For the efficient performance of the functions of the Institute-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Government may appoint such number of Directors and on such terms and conditions as it may determine from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Board may appoint such number of advisers, officers and other employees and on such terms and conditions as it may determine from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual budget statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Institute shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Institute shall maintain its accounts of the receipts and expenditures in such manner and in such form as the Government may, in consultation with Comptroller and Auditor-General, hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Institute shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Institute in consultation with the Auditor-General, and shall, in regard to the extent and method of their audit, be guided by such directions as may be given by the Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the Auditor-General may, at any time, either of his own motion or upon a request in this behalf from the Government, undertake such audit of the accounts of the Institute as may be considered necessary, and the Institute shall, at the time of such audit, produce the account books and connected documents at such place or places as the Auditor-General may direct, and furnish such explanation and information as the Auditor-General or any officer authorised by him in this behalf may ask for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance-sheet of the Institute and shall examine it together with the accounts and vouchers relating thereto, and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Institute, and shall at all reasonable times have access to books of accounts and other documents of the Institute, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance-sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether in their opinion the balance-sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of affairs of the Institute and, if they have called for an explanation or information from Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Institute for the protection of the interest of the Government and of the creditors of the Institute or upon the sufficiency of the information and other means placed at the disposal of the auditors in auditing the accounts of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Statement of accounts, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Institute shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of the accounts audited by the auditors together with a report of the Board thereon and an annual report on the conduct of its affairs during the year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall furnish to the Government such other statements, returns and reports as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The copies of the statement of the audited accounts and the annual report received by the Government shall be published in official Gazette and laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public servants, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The 20[ advisers, Director-General, Directors and other officers and] employees of the Institute shall, while acting or purporting to act in pursuance of any provision of this Act or the rules and regulations made thereunder, be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall not be construed as a “factory”, “shop”, “establishment”, “commercial establishment”, “industrial establishment” or “industry” within the meaning of the Factories Act, 1965 (E. P. Act IV of 1965), the Shop and Establishments Act, 1965 (E.P. Act VII of 1965), the Employment of Labour (Standing Orders) Act, 1965 (E. P. Act VIII of 1965) or the Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (Ord. XXIII of 1969).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of the Bangladesh Central Jute Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. Upon the commencement of this Act, the Bangladesh Central Jute Committee registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (Act XXI of 1860), shall notwithstanding anything contained in that Act, stand dissolved, and upon such dissolution-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets of the Bangladesh Central Jute Committee, hereinafter referred to as the said Committee, shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation. The expression “assets” includes all rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances and all other interests and rights in, or arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the said Committee subsisting immediately before the commencement of this Act shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)         all officers and other employees of the staff of the said Committee shall be deemed to be officers and other employees of the Institute and shall hold office on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before the commencement of this Act and shall continue to do so unless and until their remuneration or terms and conditions are duly altered by the Institute:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may alter their remuneration or terms and conditions of service whenever it deems fit so to do.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Institute may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, or the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provisions are necessary or expedient for the purposes of giving effect to the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Jute Research Institute Ordinance, 1973 (Ord. XXIV of 1973), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any order made, notification issued or direction given under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made, issued or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “Bangladesh” was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “Management” was substituted for the word “Governors” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clauses (c) and (cc) were substituted for the former clause (c) by section 3 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “Dhaka” was substituted for the word “Dacca” by section 4 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “Management” was substituted for the word “Governors” by section 5 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Sections 6, 6A, 6B were substituted for former section 6 by section 6 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word “and” was omitted by Section 2 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XIX of 2002)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words and semi-colon “Ministry or Division; and” were substituted for the words and full stop “Ministry or Division.” by Section 2 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XIX of 2002)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clause (k) was added by Section 2 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XIX of 2002)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word “Bangladesh” was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the words “Executive Director” by section 7 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the words “Executive Director” by section 7 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The words and comma “regulate, control and” were omitted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 The words “Secretary of the Board” were substituted for the words “Executive Director” by section 9 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 The words “or the member presiding over the meeting” were inserted by section 9 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The words “by the Vice-Chairman or in his absence” were omitted by section 9 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 Section 11 was substituted by section 3 of the Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXI of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the words “Executive Director” by section 10 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19 Section 12 was substituted by section 11 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20 The words and commas “advisers, Director-General, Directors and other officers and” were substituted for the words and commas “Directors, officers, advisers and other” by section 12 of the Bangladesh Jute Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. VIII of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
409	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH KRISHI BANK ORDER, 1973   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE BANGLADESH KRISHI BANK ORDER, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT’S ORDER NO. 27 OF 1973).[31st March, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a Krishi Bank to provide credit facilities to agriculturists and persons engaged in cottage industries and to provide for the vesting in that bank of the undertakings of the Agricultural Development Bank of Bangladesh and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Krishi Bank Order, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of 1[ Bangladesh except the Rajshahi Division].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th  December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “agriculture” includes the raising of crop of any kind, horticulture, forestry, fishery, animal husbandry, poultry farming, dairying, bee-keeping and sericulture and other agro-industries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “agriculturist” means any individual engaged in agriculture or in the development of agriculture or agricultural products or in storage, warehousing, marketing or processing of agricultural produce, and any public or private limited company or co-operative society incorporated or registered by or under any law for the time being in force and so engaged, and any person, company or co-operative society incorporated or registered as aforesaid, who satisfies the Bank that the loan to be taken shall be spent on agriculture or the development of agricultural products or on the storage, warehousing, or marketing of agricultural products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan” means the Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan established by the Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan Ordinance, 1961;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Agricultural Development Bank of Bangladesh” means the Agricultural Development Bank of Bangladesh which took up the functions of the Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan within the territory of Bangladesh immediately on the liberation of Bangladesh on the 16th December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Auditor-General” means the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Bank” means the Bangladesh Krishi Bank established under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “Bangladesh Bank” means the Bangladesh Bank established under the Bangladesh Bank Order, 1972 (P. O. No. 127 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) “co-operative society” means a society registered in Bangladesh under any law for the time being in force relating to registration of co-operative societies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) “cottage industry” means any industry which is carried on wholly or mainly by the members of a family either as a whole-time or as a part-time occupation or by a group of such persons who have formed themselves into a co-operative society;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “Managing Director” means the Managing Director of the Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) “small agriculturist” means an agriculturist in occupation of a holding which is normally tilled by himself and the members of his family.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Order, there shall be established a Bank to be called the Bangladesh Krishi Bank to carry out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Bank shall be a body corporate by the name of Bangladesh Krishi Bank, having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to hold an dispose of property and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Bank shall be deemed to be a banking company for the purpose of the 2[ Banking Companies Ordinance, 1962 (Ord. LVII of 1962),] and the Bangladesh Bank Order, 1972 (P. O. No. 127 of 1972) and any other law for the time being in force relating to banking companies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Notwithstanding anything contained in any of the laws mentioned in clause (3), the Bank may refer to the Bangladesh Bank for reconsideration of any directives issued under any of the said laws by the Bangladesh Bank and in the event of a difference of opinion between the Bank and the Bangladesh Bank, the matter shall be referred to the Government whose decision thereon shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The authorised capital of the Bank shall be twenty crore taka to be subscribed by the Government from time to time according to the requirements of the Bank and in such form and manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may increase the authorised capital of the Bank from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Head Office of the Bank shall be at Dacca and may be shifted to such other place as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Bank may open such other offices and branches at such places as it may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to the rules made under this Order, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of the Bank shall be entrusted to a Board of Directors, to be constituted in accordance with the provisions of Article 7 and such Board may exercise all such powers and do all such acts and things as may be exercised or done by the Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board, in discharging its functions, shall act on commercial considerations but with due regard to the interest of agriculture and development of agriculture and cottage and other allied industries in the rural as well as urban areas and to the public interest generally and shall be guided on questions of policy by the instructions, if any, given to it by the Government which shall be the sole judge as to whether a question is a question of policy or not.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Until the first Board is constituted under Article 7, the Managing Director appointed under the said Article shall exercise all powers and do all acts and things as may be exercised or done by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 7. (1) The Board shall consist of the following Directors to be appointed by the Government, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Managing Director;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) seven officials; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) two non-officials.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman shall be appointed from amongst persons who are not in the service of the Republic.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The 4[ Chairman, Managing Director] and other Directors shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, at any time, terminate the appointment of the 5[ Chairman, Managing Director] or any other Director without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The 6[ Chairman, Managing Director] or any other Director may, at any time, resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Managing Director shall be the chief executive officer of the Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 7[ Chairman,] Managing Director and other Directors shall exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be prescribed or assigned to them by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. 8[ (1) There shall be an Executive Committee consisting of the Chairman, Managing Director and another Director:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members of the Executive Committee, other than the Chairman and the Managing Director, shall be elected by the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the rules made in this behalf, the Executive Committee shall deal with any matter within the competence of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The minutes of any meeting of the Executive Committee shall be laid before the Board at its meeting next following the meeting of the Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director who,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is a salaried official of the Bank, other than the Managing Director; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is or has at any time been adjudicated an insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is found lunatic or becomes of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is or has at any time been convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) is a minor; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board or, if he is a member of the Executive Committee, from three consecutive meetings of the Committee, without leave of absence from the Chairman or, in the case of the Chairman, from the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11A. [Omitted by section 5 of the Bangladesh Krishi Bank (Second Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (XLIII of 1983).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) No business of the Board or of the Executive Committee shall be transacted except at a meeting at which a quorum of four Directors in the case of the Board and two members in the case of the Executive Committee is present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Board and of the Executive Committee shall be held at such time and at such places as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If a Director appointed under 10[ sub-clause (c) or sub-clause (d) of clause (1)] of Article 7 is unable to attend for unavoidable reasons a meeting of the Board or of the Executive Committee of which any such Director is a member, the Government may, by order in writing, appoint another person in his place for the purpose of such meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board or of the Executive Committee shall be presided over by the Chairman and in his absence by a Director or member chosen for that purpose by the Directors or members present from amongst their number.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) At a meeting of the Board or of the Executive Committee, each Director or member of the Committee, as the case may be, shall have one vote and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceeding of the Board or of the Executive Committee shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board or the Executive Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. 11[ (1) The Directors, other than the Managing Director, shall be paid such fees for attending the meetings of the Board and the Executive Committee as may be prescribed by rules.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Directors shall be reimbursed such travel costs and other expenditure for attending the meetings of the Board and the Executive Committee as may be prescribed by rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All fees, travel costs and other expenses under this Article shall be payable by the Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Bank may appoint a Committee of experts to be called the Technical Advisory Committee to give it technical advice on schemes submitted to the Bank for financial assistance or on any point that may be referred to the Committee by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Bank shall provide credit in cash or in kind and credit facilities including the hiring and renting of anything which it may advance by way of loan and the provision for ware housing facilities, for such term and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by rules, to agriculturists for the purpose of agriculture and to persons engaged in cottage and other allied industries in rural as well as urban areas for the purpose of such industries as may carry on and transact the several kinds of business hereinafter, specified, that is to say,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the accepting of money on deposit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the borrowing of money for the purposes of the Bank's business against the security of its assets or otherwise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the issuing and selling of bonds and debentures;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) for the purpose of securing loans and advances made by the Bank, accepting pledge, mortgage, hypothecation or assignment to the Bank of any kind of movable and immovable property or unconditional Bank guarantee of a scheduled bank or drawing, accepting, discounting, buying and selling or rediscounting bills of exchange and promissory notes bearing two or more good signatures, one of which shall be that of a scheduled bank or other negotiable instruments:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where a loan not exceeding two thousand taka in the aggregate is made to an individual agriculturist, it may be secured by a bond with one or more sureties as the Bank may deem necessary if such agriculturist makes an agreement with the Bank creating a charge on any of his specified property to secure the performance of the stipulations of the bond;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the buying, stocking and supplying on credit, of seeds, agricultural machinery, implements and equipments, fertilizers and chemicals and any other material used in agriculture and acting as agent for any organisation for such goods;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the subscribing to the debentures, being debentures repayable within a period not exceeding ten years of any body corporate concerned with agriculture or the financing of agriculture, the financing of cottage and other allied industries in rural as well as urban areas;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the custody of gold ornaments, jewels, securities, saving certificates, title deeds and other valuable articles and the collection of the proceeds, whether principal, interest or dividends of any such securities or saving certificates;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the administration of estates for any purpose whether as executor, transferee or otherwise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the paying, receiving, collecting and remitting of money and securities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the acquiring, maintaining and transferring of all movable and immovable property, including residential premises, for carrying on its business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the taking over of business, including the capital, assets and liabilities of any other Bank or financial corporation, with the previous approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) the guaranteeing against the security of agricultural property of loans granted by scheduled banks;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       the opening of accounts or the making of any agency arrangement with, and the acting as agent or correspondent of, any Bank or financial corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        the investing of its funds in Government securities as a purely temporary measure:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the investment of fund exceeding fifty laks of taka shall not be made except with the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        the selling and realising of all properties, whether movable or immovable, which may in any way come into the possession of the Bank in satisfaction or part satisfaction of any of its claim and the acquisition and the holding of, and generally the dealing with, any right, title or interest in any property, movable or immovable, which may be the Bank's security;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) generally the doing of all such acts and things as may be necessary, incidental or conducive to the attainment of the object of the Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything in clause (1), any loan guaranteed by the Government may be made without any specific security.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any law for the time being in force, it shall be lawful for any agriculturist or persons engaged in cottage industry or in any other allied industries in the rural as well as urban areas to pledge, mortgage, hypothecate
