No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid by reason only of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of the Board, or any defect in the appointment or qualification of a Director.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Corporation shall have its head office at 12[ Chittagong] and may establish such other offices in Bangladesh and abroad, as the Board thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Corporation may invest its funds in any securities of the Government and may make such other investments as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Corporation may, with the previous sanction of the Government and on such terms and conditions as the Government may approve of, borrow money in Bangladesh or foreign currency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited by not less than two Auditors who shall be chartered accountants and appointed for the purpose by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every auditor appointed under clause (1) shall be given a copy of the annual balance sheet of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the accounts and vouchers relating thereto, and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation and shall, at all reasonable times, have access to the books of accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any 13[ Director, Executive Director] or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The auditors shall report to the shareholders upon the annual balance sheet and accounts and in the report they shall state whether in their opinion the balance sheet is a full and fair balance sheet containing all necessary particulars and properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of the Corporation's affairs, and in case they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Board, may at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Corporation for the protection of the interest of its shareholders and creditors or upon the sufficiency of the information and other means placed at the disposal of the auditors in auditing the accounts of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A statement of the accounts audited by the auditors and a report of the Board thereon shall be furnished to the Government by the Corporation as soon as possible after the end of every financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) The annual general meeting of the shareholders shall be held at the head office of the Corporation within six months from the date on which the annual accounts of the Corporation are closed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any other general meeting of the shareholders may be convened by the Board at any time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The shareholders present at the annual general meeting shall be entitled to discuss and adopt or make recommendations to the Board with regard to annual accounts, the annual report of the Board on the working of the Corporation and the auditors report on the annual balance sheet and accounts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Corporation shall furnish to the Government at such time, after the end of every financial year, in such forms and in such manner as may be prescribed by rules an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) Out of its earnings, the Corporation shall establish a general reserve fund and create from time to time such other special reserves as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) After making provision for interest, taxes, bad and doubtful debts, depreciation of assets, maintenance of reserves and any other matter determined by the Board, the Corporation may declare a dividend out of the profits accruing in a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. No provision of law relating to the winding up of companies or corporations shall apply to the Corporation and the Corporation shall not be wound up save by an order of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. The Board may with the previous sanction of the Government make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order and the rules to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. (1) Every Director shall be indemnified by the Corporation against all losses and expenses incurred by him in the discharge of his duties except such as are caused by his own wilful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Director shall not be held responsible for the acts, omissions or inefficiency of any other Director or of any officer or employees of the Corporation resulting in any loss or expense to the Corporation or in deficiency in the value of title to any property or security required or taken on behalf of the Corporation or for anything done by himself in good faith in the execution of the duties of his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ 29. The National Shipping Corporation Ordinance, 1963 (IV of 1963), is hereby repealed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 30. For removal of doubt, it is declared that notwithstanding anything contained in this Order or in any other law for the time being in force,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        no debt or liability incurred, obligation undertaken, contract entered into or agreement made by or with the National Shipping Corporation established under the National Shipping Corporation Ordinance, 1963 (IV of 1963), shall be deemed to have been transferred to, or incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by or with the Corporation or the Government and no suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Corporation or the Government in respect of such debt, liability, obligation, contract or agreement; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        no suit, appeal or other proceeding pending against the aforesaid National Shipping Corporation shall be deemed to be suit, appeal or proceeding pending or continuing against the Corporation or the Government and no order or decree made in any suit, appeal or other proceeding instituted against the aforesaid Shipping Corporation shall be enforceable against, or binding on, the Corporation or the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clauses (3) and (4) were added by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 33 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Article 5 was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2006 (Act No. 35 of 2006)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Article 8 was substituted for the former Articles 8 and 9 by section 3 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clause (1) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. II of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Articles 8 was substituted for the previous Articles 8 and 9 by section 3 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The brackets and figure “(1)” was omitted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Article 12 was substituted by section 5 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The words “executive Director” were substituted for the word “Director” by section 6 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word “five” was substituted for the word “three” by section 7 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The words “Directors and Executive Directors” were substituted for the word “Directors” by section 8 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The word “Chittagong” was substituted for the word “Dacca” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XXXVI of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The words and comma “Directors, Executive Directors” were substituted for the word “Director” by section 8 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 Article 29 was added by Article 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 33 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 Article 30 was added by section 2 of the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1973 (Act No. XVIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
435	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH SPECIAL (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> SPECIAL (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 49 OF 1972).[22nd May, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the remuneration and privileges of the President, Prime Minister, 1[ Members of the Council of Ministers], Ministers of State and Deputy Ministers of the Government of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh and holders of certain scheduled offices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Special (Remuneration and Privileges) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the first day of January, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (b) “Minister” means a member of the Council of Ministers and includes a Minister of State and a Deputy Minister but does not include the Prime Minister;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Prescribed” means prescribed under the rules framed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        The “President” means the President of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        The “Prime Minister” means the Prime Minister of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Scheduled Office” means an office enumerated in the schedule to this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The President, the Prime Minister, a Minister and the holders of the offices enumerated in the Schedule shall be paid such salary and allowances and shall be entitled to such privileges as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Prime Minister and a Minister in receipt of a salary or allowances under this Order shall not be entitled to receive any sum out of funds provided by Legislature by way of salary or allowances in respect of his membership of the Legislature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The date on which any person becomes or ceases to be the President, Prime Minister, a Minister or the holder of a scheduled office shall be published in the official Gazette, and any such notification shall be conclusive evidence of the fact that he became, or ceased to be the President, the Prime Minister, a Minister or the holder of a scheduled office on that date for the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. All salaries paid or payable for the period commencing on the first day of January, 1972 and ending with the commencement of this Order to any person to whom this Order applies, all charges incurred before the commencement of this Order in respect of accommodation provided in any hospital for or on the medical treatment of any such person or any member of his family and all payments before such commencement by way of travelling or dearness allowances to any such persons, shall be deemed to have been paid, payable or incurred or made under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. Any rules made by the Government before the commencement of this Order, providing for the remuneration and privileges of the Ministers, shall be deemed to have been made under the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, amend the schedule to this Order by addition of further offices to which the provisions of this Order shall apply.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Ministers (Terms and Conditions) Order, 1962, and the East Pakistan Ministers (Terms and Conditions) Order, 1962, are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “Members of the Council of Ministers” were substituted for the words “Ministers of the Cabinet” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Laws (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIII of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (b) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Laws (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIII of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
436	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH (TAKING OVER OF CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT OF INDUSTRIAL AND COMMERCIAL CONCERNS) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (TAKING OVER OF CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT OF INDUSTRIAL AND COMMERCIAL CONCERNS) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACTING PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 1 OF 1972).[3rd January, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for the taking over of control and management of certain industrial and commercial concerns;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Acting President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) Where the owners, directors or managers, or majority of the owners, directors or managers, of any industrial or commercial concern have left Bangladesh or are not available to control and manage the concern, or where, in the opinion of the Government of Bangladesh, the owners or directors of any industrial or commercial concern cannot be allowed, in the public interest, to control and manage the concern, the Government of Bangladesh may, notwithstanding anything contained in any law for the time being in force or in any instrument or document relating to the incorporation, registration, creation, constitution or formation of the concern, 1[ * * *] take over its control and management, or appoint a Management Board or Administrator, or direct any autonomous or semi-autonomous body or any other authority, to take over its control and management.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where 2[ the Government of Bangladesh takes over the control or management of any industrial or commercial concern under clause (1),] all the powers and duties of the owners, directors, Board of Directors and managers of the concern, including the power to operate bank accounts, shall vest in the Government of Bangladesh. Management Board, Administrator, autonomous or semi-autonomous body or the authority, as the case may be, which takes over the control and management of the concern.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (2A) The Government may, from time to time, publish for general information lists of Industrial and Commercial Concerns taken over under this Order.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Management Board or the Administrator appointed under clause (1) shall hold office for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government of Bangladesh may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) An autonomous or semi-autonomous body or an authority taking over the control and management of any industrial and commercial concern under clause (1) shall act on such terms and conditions as the Government of Bangladesh may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The Management Board, Administrator, autonomous or semi-autonomous body or the authority controlling and managing any industrial or commercial concern under this Order shall exercise powers and perform duties under the direct supervision and control of the Government of Bangladesh, and shall submit such statements and furnish such information to the Government of Bangladesh as it may direct or require from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. No action taken under this Order shall be called in question by or before any court of law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. For the purpose of this Order, “industrial and commercial concern” includes any insurance company, factory or shop, but does not include any bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Acting President's Order No. 1-35/71/13, dated the 26th December, 1971, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding the repeal, all notifications issued under the said Order shall be deemed to have been issued under the relevant provision of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No liability shall attach to the Government of Bangladesh or any official for anything done in good faith or any order made under the said Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and comma “by notification in the official Gazette,” were omitted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 151 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words, brackets, figure and comma “the Government of Bangladesh takes over the control or management of any industrial or commercial concern under clause (1),” were substituted for the words, brackets, figure and comma “a notification is published under clause (1) in respect of any industrial or commercial concern,” by Article 2 of the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 151 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (2A) was inserted by Article 2 of the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) (Amendment) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 151 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
437	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH TAXATION LAWS (ADAPTATION) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> TAXATION LAWS (ADAPTATION) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 62 OF 1972).[8th June, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the Laws Continuance Enforcement Order provides that all laws which were in force on the 25th day of March, 1971 in the territories now comprised in the People’s Republic of Bangladesh shall continue to be in force in Bangladesh subject to such consequential changes as may be necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Taxation Laws (Adaptation) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 26th day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The taxation laws specified in the Schedule shall, until repealed or amended by competent authority, have effect and be deemed to have at all material times had effect subject to the modifications directed by the Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
438	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH TRANSFER OF IMMOVABLE PROPERTY (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> TRANSFER OF IMMOVABLE PROPERTY (TEMPORARY PROVISIONS) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 142 OF 1972).[20th November, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for restricting the transfer of immovable property in Bangladesh in public interest;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Bangladesh Transfer of Immovable Property (Temporary Provisions) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “transfer” includes transfer by sale, exchange, gift, heba, will, mortgage, lease, sub lease or any other manner of transfer or any agreement for such transfer or change of management through a power of attorney or otherwise, but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         a mortgage to the Government or to a local authority or to a Scheduled Bank or to a statutory Corporation or to a Co operative Society, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        any transfer by the Government or any local authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement, no transfer of any immovable property made after the commencement of this Order shall be deemed to be valid and legal unless the provisions of this Order have been complied with.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. No document of transfer of immovable property shall be submitted for registration unless it is accompanied by an affidavit stating the nationality of the transferor and affirming the following facts-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        that the immovable property proposed to be transferred is not under attachment under the Bangladesh Collaborators (Special Tribunals) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 8 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        that the immovable property proposed to be transferred is not an abandoned property within the meaning of the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 16 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        that the immovable property proposed to be transferred has not vested in, or does not stand forfeited to, the Government under any law for the time being in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        that the proposed transfer does not contravene any provision of any other law for the time being in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        that the proposed transfer is not liable to be void under Article 5A of the Bangladesh Land Holding (Limitation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 98 of 1972); and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         that the immovable property proposed to be transferred has been correctly described and has not been undervalued and the applicant has transferable rights in such property.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No Registering Officer shall register any document of transfer of immovable property unless it is accompanied by the affidavit referred to in Article 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. No person shall, without joining the Government which shall be a necessary party, file or proceed with any suit-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        for the specific performance of any contract relating to the transfer of any immovable property or for declaration of title to, or assertion of ownership of, any such property,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for enforcement of mortgage security in relation to any immovable property except where the mortgagee is the Government or a local authority or a scheduled Bank or a statutory Corporation or a Co-operative Society, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for partition of immovable property where the total area or the property involved exceeds one hundred standard bighas.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. A transfer of immovable property in contravention of the provisions of this Order shall be null and void and the property so transferred shall stand forfeited to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- Any wrong, incorrect of false statement made in the affidavit referred to in Article 4 or in the document of transfer or any other relevant document relating to the property shall be deemed to be a contravention of the provisions of this Order for the purpose of this Article.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, if, in the opinion of the Government, any transfer of property was made under duress or was not a bona fide transfer for consideration, within the period from the 26th March, 1971, to the date of commencement of this Order, the Government may take such action in respect of such transfer (including the setting aside thereof) as it thinks fit and the action so taken shall not be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Every officer acting under this Order shall be deemed to be acting judicially within the meaning of the Judicial Officers' Protection Act, 1850 (Act XVIII of 1850).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Every officer acting under this Order shall have the powers of a Civil Court for the purpose of receiving evidence, administering oaths, enforcing the attendance of witnesses and compelling the production of documents.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. An officer acting under this Order may, by notice, require any person to make and deliver to him a statement or to produce records or documents in his possession or control relating to any immovable property at a time or place specified in the notice and every such person shall be legally bound to do so within the meaning of sections 175 and 176 of the Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may make rules and issue instructions for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
439	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH UNNAYAN GOBESHONA PROTISHTHAN ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> UNNAYAN GOBESHONA PROTISHTHAN ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXIX OF 1974).[16th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 2 3 An Act to establish the 4[ Bangladesh Unnayan Gobeshona Protishthan].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of 5[ a Protishthan] for the purpose of undertaking and promoting study, research and dissemination of knowledge in the field of development economics, demography and other social sciences and for connected purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the 6[ Bangladesh Unnayan Gobeshona Protishthan] Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless context otherwise requires,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the 7[ Board of Trustees of the Protishthan] constituted under section 7;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (aa) “Committee” means a Committee constituted under this Act;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (b) “Chairman”, “Director-General” and “Senior Fellows” respectively means the Chairman or his nominee as provided in section 8(2), the Director-General and the Senior Fellows of the Protishthan;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act 11[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Protishthan” means the Bangladesh Unnayan Gobeshona Protishthan established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Protishthan.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and incorporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Act, there shall be established 12[ a Protishthan to be called the Bangladesh Unnayan Gobeshona Protishthan (BIDS)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Protishthan shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Headquarters of the Protishthan</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Headquarters of the Protishthan shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Protishthan may establish its branches at such places as the Board may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Aims and objects of the Protishthan</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The aims and objects of the Protishthan shall be -</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to function as an agency for undertaking and promoting study, research and dissemination of knowledge in the field of development economics, demography and other social sciences relating to planning for national development and social welfare;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to collect information, conduct investigations and undertake research projects for purposes of assistance in planning, and formulation of policy, and implementation of plans and policies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to provide facilities for training in economics, demography and other social sciences;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to provide information and offer advice on modern research techniques and methodology in economics, demography and other social sciences.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the above aims and objects, the Protishthan shall have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to conduct survey, experiment, demonstration, to hold meetings and to arrange lectures, seminars, discussions and conferences on economics, demography and other social sciences relating to studies of problems of national development and social welfare, hereinafter referred to as the studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to publish books, periodicals, reports and research and working papers on the studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to undertake investigations including field work on the studies on its own behalf or on behalf of, or in collaboration with, the Government or any institution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to establish and maintain contact with foreign scholars and their works on the studies through co-operative studies, seminars and exchange of visits or otherwise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to maintain libraries and reading rooms and equipment and instruments, such as printing presses, computational and other research and office equipment, photographic and other reproduction instruments for its proper functioning;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to institute Research Associateships, Fellowships of different categories including National Research Fellowships for professional workers on the studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to create within itself from time to time branches, divisions, sections, centres and other units for the proper and efficient conduct of the activities of the Protishthan in different fields of the studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to accept endowments, gifts, donations, grants and other funds and payments in lieu of services rendered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to take such other actions as may further the aims and objects of the Protishthan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The general direction and superintendence of the affairs of the Protishthan shall vest in the Board which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Protishthan in accordance with the provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Board shall consist of the 13[ following Trustees]-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Minister for Planning, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Deputy Chairman, Planning Commission, 14[ or a Member of the Planning Commission to be nominated by the Chairman;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ (c) the Director-General of the Protishthan, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Chairman, or a member, of the University Grants Commission to be nominated by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the Governor, Bangladesh Bank, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the Secretary, Ministry of Finance, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the Secretary, Ministry of Education, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the Chairman, Social Science Research Council, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         two Senior Fellows to be elected from amongst themselves for a term of three years;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ (j) three senior staff members of the Protishthan to be nominated by the Director-General on the recommendation of the Policy Co-ordination Committee for a term of three years;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)         the Director-General, Bangladesh Rural Development Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)          one Trustee to be appointed by the President.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ Chairman]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Minister for Planning, Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, shall 18[ ex-officio be the Chairman of the Protishthan].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 19[ Chairman] may from time to time nominate a 20[ Trustee] of the Board to act in his place in the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Director-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. 21[ (1) The Director-General shall be appointed by the Board for a term of three years on such conditions as the Board may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Director-General shall be eligible for re-appointment for another term.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be the chief executive of the Protishthan and subject to the provisions of the Act, he shall administer the affairs and the funds of the Protishthan in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Director-General shall be responsible for implementation of the decisions of the Board in directing, conducting and co-ordinating the research and other activities of 22[ the Protishthan with the assistance of the Committees].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director-General may, with the approval of the Board, appoint such officers and employees as may be considered necessary for efficient performance of the functions of the Protishthan on such terms and conditions as may be determined.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) [Omitted by section 10 of the Bangladesh Institute of Development Studies (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXXI of 1984).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Secretary</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ 10. (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Protishthan who shall be appointed by the Board on such terms and conditions as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Secretary shall be responsible to the Director-General and shall assist the Director-General and the Committees in the discharge of their duties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Secretary shall act as Secretary to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10A. The Protishthan shall constitute the following Committees, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        The Policy Co-ordination Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Administrative Affairs Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Finance Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        such other Committees as the Protishthan may deem fit to constitute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Policy Co-ordination Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10B. (1) The Policy Co-ordination Committee shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Director-General, ex-officio, who shall also be the Chairman of the Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all Research Directors of the Protishthan, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all Chiefs of Divisions of the Protishthan, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Chairmen of the Administrative Affairs Committee and the Finance Committee, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the Secretary, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         one Research Fellow of the Protishthan to be nominated by the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        one member-secretary to be nominated by other members of the Committee from among the Research Fellows of the Protishthan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member, other than an ex-officio member, shall hold office for a term of one year but shall continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Committee shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        make recommendations to the Director-General on the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         allocation of research fund and awarding of scholarships and fellowships;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        nomination of representatives of the Protishthan to seminars, workshops and other professional activities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       appointment to temporary posts for a period not exceeding six months;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       control, management and administration of the projects;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        nomination of members of the Administrative Affairs Committee and the Finance Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        exercise such other powers and perform such other functions as may be assigned to it by this Act or the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Committee may set up sub-committees to assist it in the discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Administrative Affairs Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10C. (1) The Administrative Affairs Committee shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        two members of the research staff not below the rank of Research Fellow of the Protishthan to be nominated by the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Secretary, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        such heads of Sections of the Protishthan as the Board may nominate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The most senior research staff of the Committee shall be its Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A member, other than an ex-officio member, shall hold office for a period of one year but shall continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Committee shall make recommendations to the Director-General on the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        accommodation, transport and general administration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        personnel matters of the non-research staff of the Protishthan excluding section heads;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        any other matter that may be referred to it by the Board or the Director-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Finance Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10D. (1) The Finance Committee shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        three members of the research staff not below the rank of Research Fellow of the Protishthan to be nominated by the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Secretary, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Chief of the Accounts Section of the Protishthan, ex-officio.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The most senior research staff of the Protishthan shall be its Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A member, other than an ex-officio member, shall hold office for a period of one year but shall continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Committee shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        supervise the income and expenditure of the Protishthan;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        advise the Director-General on all matters relating to accounts, administration of property, funds, preparation of budget and clearance of bills;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        perform such other functions as may be assigned to it by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Disagreement among Committees, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10E. In the event of any disagreement between two Committees or between a Committee and the Director-General, the matter shall be referred to the Board and the decision of the Board shall be final.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Senior Fellows</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) There shall be not more than twelve Senior Fellows who shall be appointed by the Protishthan from amongst the person who, by virtue of their high professional qualifications and experience, have attained eminence in the field of development economics, demography and other social sciences and are willing to serve in their individual capacity without any honoraria to achieve the aims and objects of the Protishthan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Senior Fellow shall be appointed for a term of three years and shall be eligible for re-appointment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Senior Fellows shall advise and assist the Protishthan in formulating and carrying out its research, training, publication and other professional programmes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Senior Fellow who fails to attend three or more consecutive meetings of the Senior Fellows of the Protishthan shall be deemed by the Protishthan to have resigned as a Senior Fellow and such resignation shall become effective upon notification thereof by the Protishthan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Director-General and every officer, adviser and employee of the Protishthan shall be indemnified by the Protishthan against all losses and expenses incurred by him in or in relation to the discharge of his duties except such as have been caused by his wilful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that meeting of the Board may also be otherwise convened by the Director-General if he so desires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Five Trustees including the Chairman shall form the quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Board, each Trustee shall have one vote, but in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman or his nominee shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and in his absence by such other Trustee who may be so nominated by the Chairman as provided in section 8(2) and in the absence of both of them, by a person elected for the purpose by the Trustees present from amongst themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) All acts done by a person acting in good faith as the Director-General of the Protishthan or a Trustee of the Board shall be valid, notwithstanding that it may afterwards be discovered that his appointment was invalid by reason of any defect or disqualification or had terminated by virtue of any provision contained in any law for the time being in force:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this section shall be deemed to give validity to any act of the Director-General or a Trustee of the Board after his appointment has been shown to be invalid or to have been terminated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25[ 13A. (1) The meetings of the Committees shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the meetings of the Committees may also be otherwise convened by the Chairman of the Committee if he so desires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Not less than one-third of the total number of members shall form the quorum at a meeting of the Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Committee, each member shall have one vote, but in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman of the Committee shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The meeting of a Committee shall be presided over by the Chairman of the Committee and, in the absence of the Chairman, by a member elected for the purpose by the members present from among themselves.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Protishthan shall have its own fund which shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        gifts and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        sale proceeds and royalties of publications;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        income from research undertakings;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        assistance from aid-giving agencies including foreign Governments and foundations; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         other sources.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All funds of the Protishthan shall be kept in any bank or banks approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Protishthan shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval, a budget in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure 26[ * * *] during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts of Receipts and Expenditure</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Board shall maintain in the prescribed manner the accounts of all receipts and expenditure of the Protishthan and such account shall be audited annually by such auditors as may be appointed by it in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) At the request of the Government, copies of such audited report may be supplied to them for their examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Report, Statement of accounts, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Protishthan shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, prepare an annual report of the working of the Protishthan and a statement of the estimate of the receipts and expenditure of the Protishthan for the next financial year and present the same in the next meeting of the Board for discussion and approval.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18.
