justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to prescribe, subject to the approval of the Syndicate and upon the recommendations of the Committees of Courses and Studies, the Courses of Reading, the Syllabuses and outlines of texts in each paper for all the examinations:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Academic Council shall have power only to accept, reject or refer back, but not to amend the recommendations of the Committees of Courses and Studies:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that in the event of difference of opinion between the Academic Council and the Committee of Courses and Studies after the first reference the opinions of both the bodies shall be placed before the Syndicate for decision which shall be final;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to approve or reject any subject proposed for this by a candidate for the degree of a Doctor in any subject after consideration of the report of the Board of Advanced Studies:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in the event of difference of opinion between the Academic Council and the Board of Advanced Studies after the first reference, the opinions of both the bodies shall be placed before the Syndicate for decision which shall be final;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to recognise the examinations of other Universities or Boards as equivalent to the corresponding examinations of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to advise upon the proposals referred to it on new developments in teaching and research in the University by the Planning and Development Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p popular-posts="" style="text-align: justify                      &lt;/div&gt;                    &lt;/div&gt;                  &lt;/article&gt;                                    &lt;div class=" widget="" widget_categories=""></p><h3 449	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE COMPTROLLER AND AUDITOR-GENERAL (ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS) ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE COMPTROLLER AND AUDITOR-GENERAL (ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXIV OF 1974).[13th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to prescribe certain additional functions of the Comptroller and Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS clause (3) of article 128 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh provides that Parliament may by law require the Comptroller and Auditor-General to exercise such functions, in addition to those in clause (1) of that article, as such law may prescribe;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 16th day of December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “accounts”, in relation to a commercial undertaking of the Government, includes subsidiary accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “appropriation accounts” means accounts relating to expenditure brought into account during a financial year to the several items specified in the Appropriation Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Auditor-General” means the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (cc) “public enterprise” means a company or firm, whether incorporated or registered or not, in which the Government has at least fifty per cent share or interest;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “statutory public authority” means any authority,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">corporation or body the activities or the principal activities of which are authorised by any Act, Ordinance, Order or instrument having the force of law in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Keeping of Government accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), the Auditor-General shall be responsible for the keeping of the accounts of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Auditor-General shall not be responsible for the keeping of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        initial accounts that may be required to be kept in the Treasuries; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        initial and subsidiary accounts, accounts of stores and stock, manufacturing, trading and profit and loss accounts that may be required to be kept in any Ministry, Division or office of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 3A. The Government may, subject to such conditions as may be specified therein, direct that all or any of the provisions of this Act shall not apply in respect of such Ministry, Division or Office of the Government as it may specify.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of appropriation and finance accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Auditor-General shall, from the accounts kept by him 3[ and by other persons responsible for keeping public accounts], prepare annually appropriation accounts and finance accounts showing disbursements or, as the case may be, the annual receipts and disbursements for the purposes of the Government, distinguished under the respective heads thereof, and shall submit these accounts to the President on such dates as he may, with the concurrence of the President, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit of accounts of statutory public authorities, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force 4[ or in any memorandum or articles of association or in any deed], the Auditor-General may audit the accounts of any statutory public authority 5[ , public enterprise] or local authority and shall submit his report on such audit to the President for laying it before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of any audit under sub-section (1) the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in that behalf shall have access to all records, books, vouchers, documents, cash, stamps, securities, stores or other property of the statutory public authority 6[ , public enterprise] or local authority concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of commercial accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Auditor-General shall prepare annually, after audit, commercial accounts on the basis of manufacturing, trading and profit and loss accounts, balance sheets and any other accounts that are kept by the Ministries, Divisions and offices of the Government, statutory public authorities 7[ , public enterprises] and local authorities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of general financial statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Auditor-General shall prepare annually in such form as he may, with the concurrence of the President, determine, and submit to the President, a general financial statement incorporating a summary of the accounts of the Government, statutory public authorities 8[ , public enterprises] and local authorities for the last preceding year and the particulars of their balances and outstanding liabilities and containing such other information as to their financial position as the President may direct to be included in the statement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inspection of certain offices, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Auditor-General may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        inspect any office of the Government which is responsible for the keeping of any account; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        require that any book or other document relating to transactions to which his duty in respect of audit extend shall be sent to such place as he may appoint for inspection by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Information, etc to be given by the Auditor-General to the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Auditor-General shall, so far as the accounts for the keeping of which he is responsible enable him so to do, give the Government such information and assistance in the preparation of its annual financial statement as it may ask for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Information to be given by the Government to the Auditor-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government shall give the Auditor-General such information as he may require for the preparation of any account or report which it is his duty to prepare.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Making of rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Auditor-General may make rules and give directions in respect of all matters pertaining to audit of any accounts he is required to audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Audit and Accounts Order, 1952 (G.G.O. No. 9A of 1952), and the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Ordinance, 1973 (Ord. XXX of 1973), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any order made or direction given under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (cc) was inserted by section 2 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 3A was inserted by section 2 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “and by other persons responsible for keeping public accounts” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “or in any memorandum or articles of association or in any deed” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The comma and the words “, public enterprise” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The comma and the words “, public enterprise” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The comma and the words “, public enterprises” were inserted by section 4 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The comma and the words “, public enterprises” were inserted by section 5 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
450	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE COMPTROLLER AND AUDITOR-GENERAL (ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS) ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE COMPTROLLER AND AUDITOR-GENERAL (ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXIV OF 1974).[13th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to prescribe certain additional functions of the Comptroller and Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS clause (3) of article 128 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh provides that Parliament may by law require the Comptroller and Auditor-General to exercise such functions, in addition to those in clause (1) of that article, as such law may prescribe;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 16th day of December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “accounts”, in relation to a commercial undertaking of the Government, includes subsidiary accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “appropriation accounts” means accounts relating to expenditure brought into account during a financial year to the several items specified in the Appropriation Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Auditor-General” means the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (cc) “public enterprise” means a company or firm, whether incorporated or registered or not, in which the Government has at least fifty per cent share or interest;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “statutory public authority” means any authority,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">corporation or body the activities or the principal activities of which are authorised by any Act, Ordinance, Order or instrument having the force of law in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Keeping of Government accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), the Auditor-General shall be responsible for the keeping of the accounts of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Auditor-General shall not be responsible for the keeping of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        initial accounts that may be required to be kept in the Treasuries; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        initial and subsidiary accounts, accounts of stores and stock, manufacturing, trading and profit and loss accounts that may be required to be kept in any Ministry, Division or office of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 3A. The Government may, subject to such conditions as may be specified therein, direct that all or any of the provisions of this Act shall not apply in respect of such Ministry, Division or Office of the Government as it may specify.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of appropriation and finance accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Auditor-General shall, from the accounts kept by him 3[ and by other persons responsible for keeping public accounts], prepare annually appropriation accounts and finance accounts showing disbursements or, as the case may be, the annual receipts and disbursements for the purposes of the Government, distinguished under the respective heads thereof, and shall submit these accounts to the President on such dates as he may, with the concurrence of the President, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit of accounts of statutory public authorities, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force 4[ or in any memorandum or articles of association or in any deed], the Auditor-General may audit the accounts of any statutory public authority 5[ , public enterprise] or local authority and shall submit his report on such audit to the President for laying it before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of any audit under sub-section (1) the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in that behalf shall have access to all records, books, vouchers, documents, cash, stamps, securities, stores or other property of the statutory public authority 6[ , public enterprise] or local authority concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of commercial accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Auditor-General shall prepare annually, after audit, commercial accounts on the basis of manufacturing, trading and profit and loss accounts, balance sheets and any other accounts that are kept by the Ministries, Divisions and offices of the Government, statutory public authorities 7[ , public enterprises] and local authorities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of general financial statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Auditor-General shall prepare annually in such form as he may, with the concurrence of the President, determine, and submit to the President, a general financial statement incorporating a summary of the accounts of the Government, statutory public authorities 8[ , public enterprises] and local authorities for the last preceding year and the particulars of their balances and outstanding liabilities and containing such other information as to their financial position as the President may direct to be included in the statement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inspection of certain offices, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Auditor-General may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        inspect any office of the Government which is responsible for the keeping of any account; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        require that any book or other document relating to transactions to which his duty in respect of audit extend shall be sent to such place as he may appoint for inspection by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Information, etc to be given by the Auditor-General to the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Auditor-General shall, so far as the accounts for the keeping of which he is responsible enable him so to do, give the Government such information and assistance in the preparation of its annual financial statement as it may ask for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Information to be given by the Government to the Auditor-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Government shall give the Auditor-General such information as he may require for the preparation of any account or report which it is his duty to prepare.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Making of rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Auditor-General may make rules and give directions in respect of all matters pertaining to audit of any accounts he is required to audit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Audit and Accounts Order, 1952 (G.G.O. No. 9A of 1952), and the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) Ordinance, 1973 (Ord. XXX of 1973), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any order made or direction given under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (cc) was inserted by section 2 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 3A was inserted by section 2 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “and by other persons responsible for keeping public accounts” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXVIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “or in any memorandum or articles of association or in any deed” were inserted by section 3 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The comma and the words “, public enterprise” were inserted by section 3 of the style="text-align: justify;">7 The comma and the words “, public enterprises” were inserted by section 4 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The comma and the words “, public enterprises” were inserted by section 5 of the Comptroller and Auditor-General (Additional Functions) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XIV of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align:
