and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (7), for the proviso the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Provided that, if the amount of tax is reduced as a result of such reference, the amount overpaid shall be refunded with such interest as the Commissioner may allow unless the High Court Division, on intimation given by the Commissioner within thirty days of the receipt of the result of such reference that he intends to ask for leave to appeal to the Appellate Division makes an order authorising the Commissioner to postpone payment of such refund until the disposal of the appeal by the Appellate Division.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)         in section 18, for the words “High Court” the words “High Court Division” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) section 27B shall be omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) after section 33, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“33A. No suit shall be brought in any Civil   Court to set aside or modify any assessment made under this Act.”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XIV of 1963</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The following amendments shall be made in the Gift Tax Act, 1963 (XIV of 1963), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act, for the words “rupee” or “rupees” the word “Taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) after section 13, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“13A. (1) Every person who is required to furnish a return under sub-section (1) of section 13 shall pay, on or before the date on which he furnishes such return, the amount of tax payable on the basis of the return.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any person has, without reasonable cause failed to pay the tax under sub-section (1), he shall be deemed to be an assessee in default.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 26,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        throughout the section, for the words “High Court” the words “High Court Division” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (7), for the words “Supreme Court” the words “Appellate Division” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In section 27,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)         for the words “a case has been stated”, the words “an application has been made” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on and from the first day of July, 1971; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for the words “High Court”, wherever occurring, the words, “High Court Division” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) after section 27, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“28. Appeal to Appellate Division.- (1) An appeal shall lie to the Appellate Division from any judgment of the High Court Division delivered on a case referred to under section 26 in any case which the High Court Division certifies as a fit case for appeal to the Appellate Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        Where the judgment of the High Court Division is varied or reversed on appeal under this section, effect shall be given to the order of the Appellate Division in the manner provided in sub-section (6) of section 26.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The High Court Division may, on application made to it for the execution of any order of the Appellate Division in respect of any costs awarded by it, transmit the order for execution to any Court subordinate to the Supreme Court.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) section 32A shall omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) section 32B shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XV of 1963</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The following amendments shall be made in the Wealth Tax Act, 1963 (XV of 1963), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act, for the words “rupee” or “rupees” the word “Taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 14A the existing provision shall be renumbered as sub-section (1) and after sub-section (1) renumbered as aforesaid, the following new sub-section shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(2) If any person has, without reasonable cause, failed to pay the tax under sub-section (1), he shall be deemed to be an assessee in default.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 27,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        throughout the section, except in sub-section (7), for the words “High Court” the words “High Court Division” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for sub-section (7) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(7) Where the amount of any assessment is reduced as a result of any reference to the High Court Division, the amount, if any, overpaid as wealth-tax shall be refunded with such interest as the Commissioner may allow, unless the High Court Division, on intimation given by the Commissioner within thirty days of the receipt of the result of such reference that he intends to ask for leave to appeal to the Appellate Division, makes an order authorising the Commissioner to postpone payment of such refund until the disposal of the appeal by the Appellate Division.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In section 28,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        for the words “a case has been stated” the words “an application has been made” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on and from the first day of July, 1971; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for the words “High Court” the words “High Court Division” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) after section 28, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“29. Appeal to Appellate Division.- (1) Appeal shall lie to the Appellate Division from any judgment of the High Court Division delivered on a case referred to under section 27 in any case which the High Court Division certifies as a fit case for appeal to the Appellate Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where the judgment of the High Court Division is varied or reversed on appeal under this section, effect shall be given to the order of the Appellate Division in the manner provided in sub-section (6) of section 27.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The High Court Division may, on application made to it for the execution of any order of the Appellate Division in respect of any costs awarded by it, transmit the order for execution to any Court subordinate to the Supreme Court.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) section 31B shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) section 31C shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) for the Schedule the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income Tax and Super Tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-sections (2), (3), (4) and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        income-tax shall be charged at the rates specified in Part I of the Third Schedule, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the rates of super-tax shall, for the purposes of section 55 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), be those specified in Part II of the Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        Where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “interest on securities” the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Order, 1972, on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Where the total income of a Company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the super-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent. of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        Where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the income-tax and super-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of such taxes payable on his total income according to rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1942 (XII of 1942), the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income so however that the aggregate of the taxes, so computed in respect of such inclusion shall not, in any case, exceed the amount of tax payable on such inclusion at the rate of 30 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I, or paragraph B of Part I and paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule as if the assessee were a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of the said Part II applied, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I of the Third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in clause (i) of the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973, where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (i) of paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax and super-tax, if any, payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c) be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922(XI of 1922)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), shall be charged as respects any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973, at the rates specified in Part III of the Third Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Vessels Plying on Inland Waters</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) During the period from the 1st day of July, 1973 to the 30th day of June, 1974 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected a toll on every mechanically propelled vessel registered under the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), plying on inland waters at the rates specified below, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Description of vessels   Rate of Toll</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        Vessels for carrying passengers for hire.            On the maximum registered passenger carrying capacity at the rate of Taka ten per passenger.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Vessels for carrying cargo   Taka two per ton on the maximum registered cargo carrying capacity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Other vessels and crafts       Taka ten per brake horse power or fraction thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if a vessel remains idle for breakdown of engine or otherwise for a continuous period exceeding three months in the year, toll payable shall be reduced in such proportion as the period or the aggregate of such periods for which the vessel remained idle bears to the year for which the toll is payable, subject to the condition that the owner of the vessel shall give a notice to the Assessing Officer within 15 days from the first day the vessel remained idle, failing which he shall not be entitled to any relief on account of the idle period:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any vessel or class of vessels from payment of toll under this sub-section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation I.- Vessels carrying both passengers and cargo shall be charged on the total of the maximum registered carrying capacity of passengers and cargo at the rate specified in sub-clause (a) and (b).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation II.- For the purpose of sub-clause (c) one nominal horse power shall be calculated as equivalent to 5.65 brake horse power.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation III.- Where there are more than one maximum registered passenger carrying capacity, the maximum registered passenger carrying capacity shall mean the highest one.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The toll shall be payable by the owner or charterer of the vessel.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may make rules regulating the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of the toll and other matters incidental to its levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this section and in sections 12 and 15 “mechanically propelled vessel” and “inland water” have the same meaning as in the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Fares and Freights on Traffic by Inland Vessels</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) During the period from the 1st day of July, 1973 to the 30th day of June, 1974 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected on fares and freights charged for transport by mechanically propelled vessels registered under the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), plying on inland waters, a toll according to the scale specified in the Fourth Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The toll shall be collected by the owner or the charterer of the vessel and paid to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may make rules regulating the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of the toll and any other matter incidental to its levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Motor Vehicles Carrying Goods by Road on Freights</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (Beng. I of 1932), during the period from the 1st day of July, 1973 to the 30th day of June, 1974 (both days inclusive) there shall be levied and collected a toll on every motor vehicle carrying goods by roads on freights according to the rates specified below, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Motor Vehicles carrying goods by road other than on freights</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (Beng. I of 1932), during the period from the 1st day of July, 1973 to the 30th day of June, 1974 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected a toll on motor vehicles carrying goods by road, other than on freights, at the rate of Taka forty per annum per ton of registered goods carrying capacity or fraction thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any motor vehicle or any class of motor vehicles from payment of toll under this clause.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- For the purpose of levying the toll, less than half of a ton shall be ignored and half of a ton or above shall be treated as one ton.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The toll shall be payable by the owner of the motor vehicle.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may make rules regulating the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of the toll and any other matter incidental to its levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar to renewal of Certificate of Survey and Certificate of Fitness</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), or the Motor Vehicles Act, 1939 (IV of 1939), an application for the renewal of a certificate of survey in the case of a mechanically propelled vessel or for the renewal of a certificate of fitness in the case of a motor vehicle shall not be allowed unless it is accompanied by a certificate in the prescribed manner to the effect that no arrear toll in respect of any such mechanically propelled vessel or motor vehicle is due under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Finance Act, 1950 (EB XVI of 1950)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. In the Finance Act, 1950 (E.B. XVI of 1950), in section 3, in sub-section (1), for clause (d), the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(d) (i) Contractors or Suppliers supplying goods, commodities or services to Government or autonomous bodies:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Finance Act, 1957 (EP X of 1957)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. During the period from the 1st day of July, 1973 to the 30th day of June, 1974 (both days inclusive), section 6 of the Finance Act, 1957 (E.P. X of 1957), shall have effect as if in sub-section (1) of section 6 for the word and figure “annas 2” the word and figures “Taka 2.00” were substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Continuance of rules framed under the Finance Act, 1957 (E P X of 1957)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The rules made under the provisions of the Finance Act, 1957 (E.P. X of 1957) shall, so far as they are not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, be deemed to be rules under the corresponding provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Urban Immovable Property Tax Act, 1957 (EP XI of 1957)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. In the Urban Immovable Property Tax Act, 1957 (E.P. XI of 1957), clause (c) of section 6 shall be deleted and shall be deemed to have been so deleted with effect from the 28th day of February, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Finance Act, 1966 (E P III of 1966)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. In the Finance Act, 1966 (E.P. III of 1966), in section 5, for sub-section (3) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3)      the tax shall be levied according to the scale specified below:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. If a person, on whom a tax is levied or who is responsible for the collection and payment of any tax or toll under this Act, fails to pay the tax or toll or, fails to collect and pay the tax or the toll as provided in this Act and the rules made thereunder he shall be liable to a penalty not exceeding the amount of the tax or toll payable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public Demand</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. A tax or toll leviable under any provision of this Act or any penalty imposed thereunder shall be recoverable as a public demand under the Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913 (Beng. III of 1913).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar of Suits in Civil Courts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. No suit shall lie in any Civil   Court to set aside or modify any assessment of tax or toll made under this Act and the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. No suit, prosecution or legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act or the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inland Postage Rates</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. For the year beginning on the first day of July, 1973, the Schedule contained in the Fifth Schedule to this Act shall be inserted in the Post Office Act, 1898 (VI of 1898) as the First Schedule to that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (Bengal Act I of 1932)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. In the Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (Bengal Act I of 1932), in the First Schedule, for item No. II, the following shall be substituted, namely,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“II – Vehicles for carrying passengers not plying for hire-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Seating not more than one person – Tk. 70.00</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Seating not more than three persons – Tk. 150.00</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Seating not more than four persons – Tk. 225.00</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Seating more than four persons, for every additional passenger that can be seated – Tk. 60.00”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
459	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FINANCE ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XLIV OF 1974).[29th June, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Finance Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act, 1931 (XVI of 1931), and the declaration made thereunder, this Act shall, except as otherwise provided, come into force on the 1st day of July, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act VI of 1898</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In the Post Office Act, 1898 (VI of 1898), for the First Schedule thereto, the Schedule set out in the First Schedule to this Act shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act II of 1899</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Stamp Act, 1899 (II of 1899),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in section 34, for the words “fifteen paisa” the words “thirty poisha” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in Schedule 1A, in Article 53, in the second column, for the words “fifteen paisa” the words “thirty poisha” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        for the words “Pakistan Penal Code” wherever occurring the words “Penal Code” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for the words “Bangladesh Law” or “a Bangladesh Law” wherever occurring the words “Act of Parliament” or “an Act of Parliament” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) clause (4a) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in clause (4A), for sub-clause (iii) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(iii) agricultural land in taxable territories, not being land situate-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in any area which is comprised within the jurisdiction of a municipality (whether known as a municipality, municipal corporation, town, or by any other name) or a cantonment board and which has a population of not less than ten thousand according to the last preceding census of which the relevant figures have been published before the first day of the previous year; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in any area within such distance, not being more than five miles, from the local limits of any municipality or cantonment board referred to in item (i), as the Government may, having regard to the extent of, and scope for, urbanisation of that area and other relevant considerations, specify in this behalf by notification in the official Gazette.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        sub-clause (iv) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        in clause (6A), in the second proviso, for the words and figure “or section 12” the comma, words, figures and letter “, section 12 or section 14A” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In section 4,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in sub-section (1), in Explanation 3, for the word, figure and letter “section 15B” the words, figures and letters “section 14A or section 15B” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for clause (i) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(i)       Any income derived from property held under trust or other legal obligation wholly for religious or charitable purposes, and in the case of property so held in part only for such purposes, the income applied, or finally set apart for application, thereto:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where any income is not applied or is not deemed to have been applied to charitable or religious purposes in taxable territories during the previous year but is accumulated, or finally set apart, for application to such purposes in taxable territories, such income shall not be included in the total income of the previous year of the person in receipt of the income provided the following conditions are complied with, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        such person specifies, by notice in writing given to the Income-tax Officer in the prescribed manner, the purpose for which the income is being accumulated or set apart and the period for which the income is to be accumulated or set apart, which shall in no case exceed ten years;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the money so accumulated or set apart is-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         invested in any Government security as defined in clause (2) of section 2 of Public Debt Act, 1944, or in any other security which may be approved by the Government in this behalf, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        deposited in any account with the Post Office Savings Bank:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that where any income which-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is applied to purposes other than charitable or religious purposes or ceases to be accumulated or set apart for application thereto, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) ceases to remain invested in any security or deposited in any account referred to in the first proviso, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is not utilised for the purpose for which it is so accumulated or set apart during the period preferred to in the first proviso or in the year immediately following the expiry thereof,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be deemed to be the income of such person of the previous year in which it is so applied or ceases to be so accumulated or set apart or ceases to remain so invested or deposited or, as the case may be, of the previous year immediately following the expiry of the period aforesaid:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that for the purposes of this clause “property held under trust or other legal obligation” includes a business undertaking so held and where a claim is made that the income of any such undertaking shall not be included in the total income of the person in receipt thereof, the Income-tax Officer shall have the power to determine the income of such undertaking in accordance with the provisions of this Act relating to assessment; and where any income so determined is in excess of the income as shown in the accounts of the undertaking, such excess shall be deemed to be applied to purposes other than charitable or religious purposes;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in clause (xiiiaa), for the words “Pakistani firm” occurring twice, the words “Bangalee firm” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 10,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        sub-section (2), in clause (vii), in the third proviso, for the words “such export to transfer” the words “such export or transfer” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (3A),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for the words “by person other than the assessee” the words “by any person other than the assessee” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        for the words “computation of excess” the words “computation of any excess” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        In sub-section (3B),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for the words “local authority or person” the words “local authority or any person” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        for the words “under of the said clauses” the words “under any of the said clauses” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       for the words “apply to donation” the words “apply to any donation” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 14, sub-section (5) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) after section 14, the following new section 14A shall be inserted , namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“14A. Tax holiday for certain new industrial investments.- (1) Subject to the provisions of this Act, the income, profits and gains of an industrial undertaking set up in taxable territories between the first day of July, 1973, and the thirtieth day of June, 1978 (both dates inclusive), shall be exempt from the income-tax and super-tax payable under this Act for a period of five years beginning with the month in which the commercial production of the undertaking is commenced.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The exemption under sub-section (1) shall apply to an industrial undertaking which fulfils the following conditions, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        that it is owned and managed by a company formed and registered under the Companies Act, 1913 or a body corporate formed in pursuance of an Act of Parliament, having-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         its registered office in taxable territories;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        a subscribed and paid up capital of not less than one lakh taka and not more than thirty-five lakhs taka; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       its capital wholly subscribed by Bangalees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        that it belongs to the class of industries specified in the Industrial Investment Schedule issued by the Government for the purpose of this section;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        that as respects the industrial undertaking set up in the areas notified by the National Board of Revenue in this behalf in the official Gazette not less than sixty per cent of the income, profits and gains exempted under this section are reinvested in the industrial undertaking from which such income, profits and gains have been derived or are invested in the purchase of bonds issued by the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in the case of an industrial undertaking set up in areas other than the areas as referred to above, this clause shall have effect as if for the words “sixty per cent” the words “thirty per cent” were substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) that an application for exemption in the prescribed form and verified in the prescribed manner has been made to the National Board of Revenue within four months of the month in which the undertaking goes into commercial production:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in respect of any undertaking which was set up and the commercial production of which commenced on any day between the first day of July, 1973 and the thirtieth day of June, 1974, the period of four months shall be reckoned from the first day of July, 1974;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) that it is approved by the National Board of Revenue for purposes of this section:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an industrial undertaking approved under this clause may, not later than six months from the date of approval, apply in writing to the National Board of Revenue for the cancellation of such approval, and the National Board of Revenue may pass such orders thereon as it may deem fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that where any exemption has been allowed under sub-section (1) and it is subsequently discovered by the Income-tax Officer that any one or more of the conditions specified in this sub-section was or were not fulfilled, as the case may be, the exemption originally allowed shall be deemed to have been wrongly allowed and the Income-tax Officer may, notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, recompute the total income of the assessee for the relevant previous year and the provisions of section 34 shall, so far as may be, apply thereto, the period of four years specified under sub-section (2) of that section being reckoned from the end of the assessment year relevant to the previous year in which the infringement was discovered.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The profits and gains of an industrial undertaking to which this section applies shall be computed in accordance with the provisions of section 10:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing contained in-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         clause (vi) of sub-section (2) of section 10 in so far as it relates to the further sum referred to therein; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        clause (vii) of that sub-section; shall apply to such profits and gains derived by the undertaking in respect of the period specified in sub-section (1):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that such profits and gains shall be computed separately from other income, profits and gains of the assessee, if any, and where the assessee sustains a loss from such undertaking, it shall be carried forward and set off against the profits and gains of the said undertaking for the following year and where it cannot be wholly so set off, the amount of the loss not so set off shall be carried forward to the next year and so on, but no loss shall be carried forward beyond the period for which the income, profits and gains of the undertaking are exempt under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Nothing contained in this section shall be deemed to exempt the following income of an industrial undertaking, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the amount representing the face value of any bonus shares or the amount of any bonus declared, issued or paid by a company which owns and manages the industrial undertaking to its shareholders with a view to increasing the paid up capital; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        any capital gains chargeable according to the provisions of section 12B.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The National Board of Revenue may make rules regulating the procedure for the grant of the exemption and any other matters connected with, or incidental to, the operation of this section.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 15CC, in sub-section (1), the comma, brackets, figure and letter “,(3A)” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) in section 15D, in sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        clause (cc) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in the first proviso, for the colon at the end a fullstop shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the second proviso shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) in section 16, in sub-section (2), for the words “net Pakistan rate” the words “net Bangladesh rate” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the twenty-sixth day of March, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) in section 17, in sub-section (5), in clause (b), in sub-clause (ii), for paragraph (2) the following shall be substituted, namely :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(2)      the amount of the said income as reduced by an amount equal to fifty per cent of the amount of the said income.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11) in section 45, for the words “Income-tax Officer in his discretion” the words “Income-tax Officer may in his discretion” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(12) in section 46, in sub-section (8), for the word “National” the word “Central” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(13) in section 49D, for the words “Pakistan Income-tax” wherever occurring the words “Bangladesh Income-tax” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the twenty-sixth day of March, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(14) in section 54, in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in clause (a), for the words “Bangladesh Penal Code” the words “Penal Code” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in clause (cc), the words and comma “a Provincial Government,” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on the twenty-sixth day of March, 1971; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       in clause (e), for the words “Comptroller and Auditor-General of Pakistan” the words “Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(15) in section 54A, in sub-section (1), the word “Pakistan” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p “as specified in sub-section (3)” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the first day of July, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: rule 4, the word “Pakistan” shall be omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in rule 7, the word “Pakistan” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on the twenty-sixth day of March, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p twenty-sixth day of March, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of section 3 Ben Act V of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. In the Amusement Tax Act, 1922 (Ben. Act V of 1922), in section 3 in the entries under the heading “Rate of tax”, for the figures “75”, “100” and “125” the figures “100”, “125” and “150” shall respectively be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XXXII of 1934</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Corrugated iron sheets          ..         ..          50% ad val.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">B. Other ..        ..          ..           ..         ..          40% ad val.”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act I of 1944</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. In the Finance Act, 1950 (E. B. Act XVI of 1950), in section 3, in sub-section (1), in clause (d), for sub-clause (iii) the following shall be substituted, namely:- “(iii)(a) clearing, forwarding agents registered at a customs-port.  2,000</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        clearing, forwarding agents registered at a land customs-station or a customs-air-port.    1,000”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of EP Act X of 1957</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. In the Finance Act, 1957 (E.P. Act III of 1966), section 5 shall be repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act IV of 1969</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. In the Customs Act, 1969 (IV of 1969), in section 193, after the words “this Act”, the words “not being an order passed under section 82” shall be inserted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. [Tax on vessels.- Repealed by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. [Tax on Motor vehicles carrying goods for hire.- Repealed by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. [Import licence tax.- Repealed by section 2 of the Finance(Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XXXVII of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. [Exchange tax.- Repealed by section 2 of the Finance(Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XXXVII of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. [Tax on house-rent.- Repealed by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. [Betterment tax.- Repealed by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Primary Education Cess</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) There shall be levied and collected in such manner as may be prescribed by rules on all lands on which rent is payable under the State Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950 (E.B. Act XXVIII of 1951), or would have been so payable had not the State Acquisition and Tenancy (Third Amendment) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 96 of 1972), come into force, a primary education cess at the rate of twenty per cent of such rent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any primary education cess payable under any other law for the time being in force shall, notwithstanding anything contained in such law, cease to be payable upon the commencement of this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) This section shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 1st day of July, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income-tax and Super-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-sections (2), (3), (4) and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1974,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        income-tax shall be charged at the rates specified in Part I of the Fourth Schedule, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the rates of super-tax shall, for the purposes of section 55 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), be those specified in Part II of the Fourth Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1974,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “interest on securities” the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1973 (XI of 1973), on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the total income of a company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the super-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1974, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I, or paragraph B of Part I and paragraph A of Part II of the Fourth Schedule as if the assessee were a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of the said Part II applied, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I of the Fourth Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in clause (i) of the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1974, where the total income of an assessee, not being a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of Part II of the Fourth Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax and super-tax, if any, payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c) be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), shall be charged as respects any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1974, at the rates specified in Part III of the Fourth Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. [Restriction on renewal of certificate of survey, etc.- Repealed by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public demand</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. A 1[ cess under section 22] or any penalty imposed thereunder shall be recoverable as a public demand under the Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913 (Ben. Act III of 1913).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. 2[ (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to provide for the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of any cess leviable under section 22; and such rules may provide for matters relating to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the person by whom the cess shall be payable;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the time and manner of such payment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) penalty for default or delay in the payment of the cess of an amount not exceeding the amount of the cess; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) such other matters as may be necessary for the efficient assessment and collection of the cess.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The rules made under the Finance Act, 1957 (E.P. Act X of 1957), shall be deemed to be rules made under the corresponding provisions of this Act in so far as they are not inconsistent with those provisions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and figures “cess under section 22” were substituted for the words, figures and commas “tax or toll leviable under sections 14, 15, 16, 17, 20, 21, and 22 ” by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 10 of the Finance Act, 1975 (Act No. III of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
460	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FINANCE ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. III OF 1975).[30th June, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Finance Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act, 1931 (XVI of 1931), and the declaration made thereunder, this Act shall, except as otherwise provided, come into force on the 1st day of July, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the words “Commissioner of Income-tax” and “Commissioners of Income-tax” wherever occurring, the words “Commissioner of Taxes” and “Commissioners of Taxes” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for the words “Assistant Commissioner”, “Assistant Commissioner of Income-tax” and “Assistant Commissioners of Income-tax”, wherever occurring, the words “Joint Commissioner”, “Joint Commissioner of Taxes” and “Joint Commissioners of Taxes” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for the words “an Income-tax Officer”, “Income-tax Officer” and “Income-tax Officers” wherever occurring, the words “a Deputy Commissioner of Taxes”, “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes” and “Deputy Commissioners of Taxes” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) for the words “Assistant Income-tax Officer” and “Assistant Income-tax Officers” wherever occurring, the words “Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes” and “Extra Assistant Commissioners of Taxes” shall respectively be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) for the words “Inspector of Income-tax” and “Inspectors of Income-tax” wherever occurring, the words “Inspector of Taxes” and “Inspectors of Taxes” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for clause (3) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3)      “Appellate Joint Commissioner” means a person appointed to be an Appellate Joint Commissioner of Taxes under section 5;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for clause (3A) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3A) “Assistant Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be an Assistant Commissioner of Taxes under section 5;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) after clause (5B) the following new clause (5BB) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(5BB) “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be a Deputy Commissioner of Taxes under section 5 and includes a person appointed to be a Special Officer, an Assistant Commissioner of Taxes, an Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes and an Examining Officer;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) after clause (6AAA), the following new clause (6AAAA) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(6AAAA) “Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be an Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes under section 5;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) for clause (6D) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(6D) “Inspecting Joint Commissioner” means a person appointed to be an Inspecting Joint Commissioner of Taxes under section 5;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) clause (7) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 4, in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) clause (vii) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in clause (xii), in sub-clause (e), for the full-stop at the end a semi-colon shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p of a Deputy Commissioner of Taxes or, as the case may be, a Tax Recovery Officer under this Act in respect of such individual, Hindu-undivided family or company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.
