For the purpose of this sub-section, “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes and Tax Recovery Officer having jurisdiction”, in relation to an individual or Hindu-undivided family who has no income assessable to income-tax under the Income-tax Act, means the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes or, as the case may be, the Tax Recovery Officer of the area in which that individual or Hindu-undivided family resides.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in Chapter III, after section 13, the following new section 13A shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“13A.   Reference in respect of Wealth-tax authorities.- References in any Act, Ordinance, Regulation, Rule, Order, bye-law, deed, document or any other instrument of whatever nature to Commissioner of Wealth-tax, Assistant Commissioner of Wealth-tax and Wealth-tax Officer shall, with grammatical variations, except where the context otherwise requires, be construed as references respectively to Commissioner of Taxes, Joint Commissioner of Taxes and Deputy Commissioner of Taxes; and any such Act, Ordinance, Regulation, Rule, Order, bye-law, deed, document or any other instrument of whatever nature shall have effect accordingly.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 31A, for the words “Income-tax Officer” the words “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes”, and for the words “Wealth-tax Officer” the words “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes under this Act” shall respectively be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 32 for the words “and to Wealth-tax Officer and Commissioner of Wealth-tax instead of to Income-tax Officer and Commissioner of Income-tax” the words “and to Deputy Commissioner of Taxes and Commissioner of Taxes under this Act instead of to Deputy Commissioner of Taxes and Commissioner of Taxes under that Act” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) for the Schedule the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“THE SCHEDULE</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(See section 3)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">RATES OF WEALTH-TAX</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. On the first Taka four lakhs of net wealth or, where an assessee, being a person owning and occupying a house for purposes of his own residence, exercises the option to have the value of such house being excluded from his assets, on the first Taka three lakhs of net wealth.       .. Nil.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. On the next Taka two lakhs of net wealth      .. 1%</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. On the next Taka five lakhs of net wealth</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. On the next Taka five lakhs of net wealth</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. On the next Taka five lakhs of net wealth</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. On the balance of net wealth</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">.. 1½ %</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">.. 2%</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">.. 2½ %</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">.. 3%”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XLIV of 1974</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. In the Finance Act, 1974 (XLIV of 1974),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) sections 14, 15,16, 17,20, 21 and 25 shall be repealed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 26, for the words, figures and commas “tax or toll leviable under sections 14, 15, 16, 17, 20, 21 and 22” the words and figure “cess under section 22” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 27, for sub-section (1) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(1)      The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to provide for the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of any cess leviable under section 22; and such rules may provide for matters relating to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the person by whom the cess shall be payable;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the time and manner of such payment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        penalty for default or delay in the payment of the cess of an amount not exceeding the amount of the cess; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        such other matters as may be necessary for the efficient assessment and collection of the cess.”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) the Third Schedule shall be repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income-tax and Super-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-sections (2), (3), (4) and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        income-tax shall be charged at the rates specified in Part I of the Third Schedule, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the rates of super-tax shall, for the purposes of section 55 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), be those specified in Part II of the Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “interest on securities” the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1974 (XLIV of 1974), on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        where the total income of a company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the super-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent. of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I, or paragraph B of Part I and paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule as if the assessee were a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of the said Part II applied, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I of the Third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in clause (i) of the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975, where the total income of an assessee, not being a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax and super-tax, if</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">any, payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c) be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amount.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 per cent. of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Plus an additional 1 per cent. for every increase of 10 per cent. in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall maximum of 25 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Minus 1 per cent. for every decrease of 10 per cent. in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall minimum of 10 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nil.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 per cent. of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20 per cent. of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25 per cent. of the income-tax and super-tax, if any, attributable to export sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) Where the goods exported abroad had not been manufactured by the assessee who exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) and where the export sales during the relevant year exceed the export sales of the preceding year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) and where the export sales during the relevant year do not exceed the export sales of the preceding year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        Where the goods exported had been manufactured by the assessee who had exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        where the export sales do not exceed 10 per cent. of the total sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        where the export sales exceed 10 per cent. but do not exceed 20 per cent. of the total sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        where the export sales exceed 20 per cent. but do not exceed 30 per cent. of the total sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        where the export sales exceed 30 per cent. of the total sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in the case of a registered firm super-tax payable by it under paragraph C of Part II of the Third Schedule shall be reduced under this clause by an amount calculated on the basis of the income-tax payable on its total income under paragraph A of Part I had it been the total income of an unregistered firm;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Nothing contained in clause (a) shall apply in respect of the following goods or class of goods, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         tea,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) raw jute,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       jute manufacture,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       such other goods as may be notified by the National Board of Revenue from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        The National Board of Revenue may make rules providing for the computation of profits and the tax attributable to export sales and for such other matters as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of this sub-section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In cases to which section 17 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), applies the tax chargeable shall be determined as provided in that section, but with reference to the rates imposed by sub-section (1), and in accordance, where applicable, with the provisions of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) For the purposes of making deduction of tax under section 18 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), the rates specified in Part I and Part II of the Third Schedule shall apply as respects the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975, and ending on the thirtieth day of June, 1976.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) For the purposes of this section and of the rates of tax imposed thereby, the expression “total income” means total income as determined for the purposes of income-tax or super-tax, as the case may be, in accordance with provisions of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922); and the expression “public company” means a company-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in which not less than fifty per cent. of the shares are held by the Government, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        whose shares were the subject of dealings in a registered stock exchange in the taxable territories at any time during the previous year and remained listed on the stock exchange till the close of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Surcharge under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), shall be charged as respects any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1975, at the rates specified in Part III of the Third Schedule to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
461	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE FINANCE ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 77 OF 1972).[30th June, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purposes hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Finance Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Except as otherwise provided in this Order, this Article and Articles 2 and 3, clause (11) of Article 4 shall come into force at once and other Articles shall be deemed to have come into force on the first day of July, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XXXII of 1934</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The amendments set out in the First Schedule to this Order shall be made in the Tariff Act, 1934.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act I of 1944</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The following amendment shall be made in the Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (Act I of 1944), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        Except where the context otherwise requires, references to “Pakistan”, “Central Government”, “Provincial Government”, “Central Board of Revenue” and “Central Excise Officer” wherever occurring in the said Act shall be replaced by references to “Bangladesh”, “Government of Bangladesh”, “Government of Bangladesh”, National Board of Revenue” and “National Excise Officer” respectively.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the First Schedule, the schedule set out in the Second Schedule to this Order shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, for the words “Central Board of Revenue” the words “National Board of Revenue” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substitute on the sixteenth day of December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        for clause (4B) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(4B). “the National Board of Revenue” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in clause (6A), in the second proviso for the words, figures and letters “Section 12 or section 15BB” the words and figure “or section 12” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 4,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-section (1), in Explanation 3, the words and figures “or section 15BB” shall be omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) clause (XV) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        for clause (xvii) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(xvii)   Any income, not exceeding taka five thousand, chargeable under the head ‘interest on securities' received by an assessee, being an individual, from interest on any securities of the Government”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) in clause (xviii), in the proviso, the words, brackets and figure “clause (xv) and” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 5A, in sub-section (4), the word “ordinarily” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 7, in sub-section (1), in the fourth proviso, for the words “three hundred and sixty” the words “six hundred” and for the words “two hundred and forty” the words “three hundred and sixty” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6)        in section 10,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in sub-section (2),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (iii), the second proviso shall be omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in clause (va), in Explanation, for paragraph (1) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(1)      “specified year“ means the year immediately following the year in which industrial undertaking was set-up; and”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in sub-section (9), the proviso shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) section 15BB shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) in section 15D, in sub-section (1), in the second proviso, the words and commas “not being a donation to the Quaid-E-Azam Memorial Fund,” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) in section 15H, for the word “one” the word “two” shall be substituted';</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) in section 30, in sub-section (1), for the existing third proviso the following shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the first day of July, 1971, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Provided further that no appeal shall be filed under this section in respect of any order in any case where the said order has been passed by an Inspecting Assistant Commissioner of Income-tax exercising the powers conferred on an Income-tax Officer under sub-section (5) of section 5,”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11)       in section 34, in sub-section (2), in the proviso in clause (1),</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-clause (b), the word “and” appearing after the semi-colon shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in sub-clause (c), after the semi-colon the word “and” shall be substituted.”</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) after the sub-clause (c), amended as aforesaid, the following new sub-clause (d) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(d) in relation to the income, profits or gains which were first assessable in the year 1967-68, the words “five years” were substituted”.;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(12) in section 66, in sub-section (1), the words “in the prescribed form” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on the 1st day of July, 1971 and for the word “rupees” the word “taka” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(13)      in the Third Schedule, Rule 6 shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act X of 1950</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following amendments shall be made in the Estate Duty Act, 1950 (X of 1950), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, for the words “Central Board of Revenue” the words “National Board of Revenue” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the sixteenth day of December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        in section 2, in clause (3), for the words, figure and commas “Central Board of Revenue constituted under the Central Board of Revenue Act, 1924,” the words, figure and commas “National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972,” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 59A, in sub-section (1), the words “in the prescribed form” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on the 1st day of July, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act III of 1951</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The following amendments shall be made in the Sales-tax Act, 1951 (III of 1951), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, for the words “Central Board of Revenue” the words “National Board of Revenue” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the sixteenth day of December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2, for clause (3a) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3a) “Board” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 17, in sub-section (1), the words “in the prescribed form” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on the 1st day of July, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XIV of 1963</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The following amendments shall be made in the Gift Tax Act, 1963 (XIV of 1963), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, for the words “Central Board of Revenue” the words “National Board of Revenue” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the sixteenth day of December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2, for clause (v) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(v) “Board” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 26, in sub-section (1), the words “in the prescribed form” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act XV of 1963</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The following amendments shall be made in the Wealth Tax Act, 1963 (XV of 1963), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Throughout the Act, for the words “Central Board of Revenue” the words “National Board of Revenue” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on the sixteenth day of December, 1971;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2, for clause (f) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(f) “Board” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 27, in sub-section (1), the words “in the prescribed form” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income Tax and Super Tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Subject to the provisions of subsections (2), (3), (4), and (5) in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1972-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) income-tax shall be charged at the rates specified in Part I of the Third Schedule, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the rates of super-tax shall, for the purposes of section 55 of the Income-Tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), be those specified in Part II of the Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1972,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “interest securities”, the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance (1971-72) Order, 1972, on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Where the total income of a Company includes any profits and gains from life insurance business, the super-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, include any profits and gains from life insurance business, the income-tax and super-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of such taxes payable on his total income according to rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1942 (XII of 1942), the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income so however that the aggregate of the taxes, so computed in respect of such inclusion shall not, in any case, exceed the amount of tax payable on such inclusion at the rate of 30 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1972, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I, or paragraph B of Part I and paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule as if the assessee were a company to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (1) of paragraph A of the said Part II applied, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of Part I of the Third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in clause (i) of the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1972, where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, to which the proviso to sub-paragraph (i) of paragraph A of Part II of the Third Schedule does not apply, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax and super-tax, if any, payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c) be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Surcharge under the Income Tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Surcharge under the Income Tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), shall be charged as respects any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1972, at the rate of ten per cent of the income-tax and super-tax payable by an assessee, not being a company, having total income, profits or gains exceeding Taka thirty-six thousand provided that the surcharge payable shall in no case exceed the amount by which the total income, profits or gains exceed Taka thirty-six thousand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Withdrawal of exemption of unexpired period of Tax holiday under the Income Tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Notwithstanding any exemption from payment of income-tax and super-tax granted to or any rights or privileges acquired by an industrial undertaking under section 15BB, since omitted under this Order, of the Income Tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), as respects any income, profits and gains of any previous year ending on any day after the thirtieth day of June, 1971 and of any previous year thereafter, such exemption, rights or privileges shall stand withdrawn or cancelled, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Vessels Plying on Inland Waters</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) During the period from the 1st day of July, 1972, to the 30th day of June, 1973 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected a toll on every mechanically propelled vessel registered under the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), plying on inland waters at the rate specified below, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on Fares and Freights on Traffic Inland Vessels</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) During the period from that 1st day of July, 1972, to the 30th day of June, 1973 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected on fares and freights charged for transport by mechanically propelled vessels registered under the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), plying on inland waters, a toll according to the scale specified in the Fourth Schedule to this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The toll shall be collected by the owner of the charterer of the vessel and paid to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may make rules regulating the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of the toll and any other matter incidental to its levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll no motor vehicles carrying goods by road on freights</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Bengal Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (I of 1932), during the period from the 1st day of July, 1972, to the 30th day of June, 1973 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected a toll on every motor vehicle carrying goods by road on freights according to the rate specified below, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Toll on motor vehicles carrying goods by road other than on freights</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Bengal Motor Vehicles Tax Act, 1932 (I of 1932), during the period from the 1st day of July, 1972, to the 30th day of June, 1973 (both days inclusive), there shall be levied and collected a toll on motor vehicles carrying goods by road, other than on freights, at the rate of Taka twenty-five per annum per ton of registered goods carrying capacity or fraction thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the motor vehicles owned by the Government shall be exempt from payment of toll under this clause.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation - For the purpose of levying the toll, less than half of a ton shall be ignored and half of a ton or above shall be treated as one ton.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The toll shall be payable by the owner of the motor vehicle.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may make rules regulating the procedure for the assessment, collection and payment of the toll and any other matter incidental to its levy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar to renewal of certificate of survey and certificate of fitness</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917 (I of 1917), or the Motor Vehicles Act, 1939 (IV of 1939), an application for the renewal of a certificate of survey in the case of a mechanically propelled vessel or for the renewal of a certificate of fitness in the case of a motor vehicle shall not be allowed unless it is accompanied by a certificate in the prescribed manner to the effect that no arrear toll in respect of any such mechanically propelled vessel or motor vehicle is due under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of section 3 of East Bengal Act XVI of 1950</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. In the East Bengal Finance Act, 1950 (XVI of 1950), in section 3, for sub-section (1), the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(1) As from the first day of July, 1972, there shall be levied and collected by the Government from the following classes of persons a tax for each financial year at the rate shown against each in addition to any tax, rate, duty or fee which they may be liable to pay under any other enactment for the time being in force, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Companies, not being registered co-operative societies, transacting business anywhere in Bangladesh-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of East Pakistan Act X of 1957</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) In the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1957 (X of 1957), in section 2, in sub-section (1) for the word “five” the word “ten” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) During the period from the 1st day of July, 1972, to the 30th day of June, 1973 (both days inclusive), section 6 of the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1957 (X of 1957), shall have effect as if in sub-section (1) of the said section 6 for the word and figure “annas 2” the word and figures “Taka 2.00” were substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Continuance of rules framed under the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1957 (X of 1957)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The rules made under the provisions of the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1957 (X of 1957), shall, so far as they are not inconsistent with the provisions of this Order, be deemed to be rules under the corresponding provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the East Pakistan Urban Immovable Property Tax Act, 1957 (XI or 1957)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. In the East Pakistan Urban Immovable Property Tax Act, 1957 (XI of 1957)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) Sub-section (2) of section 3 of the East Pakistan Urban Immovable Property Tax Act, 1957 (XI of 1957), shall be deleted and sub-section (1) of that section shall be renumbered as section 3.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 6, after clause (e), the following shall be inserted as clause (f), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(f)       Power houses and lands on which they are situate vesting in or belonging to the Bangladesh Water and Power Development Authority;”</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) the existing clauses “(f)” and “(g)” shall be renumbered as clauses “(g)” and “(h)” respectively;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 6, in clause (h) as so renumbered for the word and figures “Rs. 1,000” the word and figures “Taka 1,500” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) After section 6, the following new section 6A shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“6A. General Power of Exemption-The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt, either wholly or in part, from the payment of any tax imposed under the Act, any person or class of persons or any property or class of property”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) For the Schedule to the Act, the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1966 (III of 1966)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. In the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1966 (III of 1966), in section 5, for sub-section (3), the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3) The tax shall be levied according to the scale specified below:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. If a person, on whom a tax is levied or who is responsible for the collection and payment of any tax or toll under this Order, fails to pay the tax or toll or fails to collect and pay the tax or the toll as provided in this Order and the rules made thereunder he shall be liable to a penalty not exceeding the amount of the tax or toll payable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public Demand</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. A tax or toll leviable under any provision of this Order or any penalty imposed thereunder shall be recoverable as a public demand under the Bengal Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913 (III of 1913).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar of suits in Civil Courts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. No suit shall lie in any Civil   Court to set aside or modify any assessment of tax or toll made under this Order and the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. No suit, prosecution or legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Order or the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) Section 6 of the East Pakistan Finance Act, 1966 (III of 1966), providing for levy of tax on hotels, in hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, any direction issued or action taken or order passed or proceeding commenced or right accrued or liability incurred under any provision of the said section shall continue in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) Articles 12, 13, 15, 16, 17, 19, 20, 21, 22, and 23 of the Finance (1971-72) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 52 of 1972), are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, any direction issued or action taken or order passed or proceeding commenced or right accrued or liability incurred under any provision of the said Order shall continue in force and shall be deemed to have been issued, taken, passed, commenced, accrued or incurred, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
462	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GANDHI ASHRAM (BOARD OF TRUSTEES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GANDHI ASHRAM (BOARD OF TRUSTEES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LI OF 1975).[4th October, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the constitution of a Board of Trustees for the better administration and development of the Gandhi Ashram at Jayag in the district of Noakhali.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of a Board of Trustees for the better administration and development of the Gandhi Ashram at Jayag in the district of Noakhali and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 20th August, 1975, and in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Gandhi Ashram (Board of Trustees) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Trustees of the Gandhi Ashram constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Gandhi Ashram” means the Gandhi Ashram at Jayag in the district of Noakhali;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Trustee” means a Trustee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, constitute a Board to be called the Board of Trustees of the Gandhi Ashram.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The head office of the Board shall be at Jayag in the district of Noakhali or at such other place as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, constitute a Board to be called the Board of Trustees of the Gandhi Ashram.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The head office of the Board shall be at Jayag in the district of Noakhali or at such other place as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Board shall consist of a Chairman and six other Trustees to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and the other Trustees shall hold office for a period of three years:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may terminate the appointment of the Chairman or any other Trustee before the expiration of his term.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to administer and develop the Gandhi Ashram;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to establish vocational institutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to establish homes for widows, orphans and destitutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to provide for training in spinning, weaving, bee-keeping, pisciculture and such other subjects as would help the trainees to undertake gainful occupation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to establish cottage industries;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to provide for Ambar Charkha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to do such other things as would enable the people to live in peace and harmony and to be self reliant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be called by the Chairman on such dates and at such times and places as may be specified by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than three Trustees, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman, and, in his absence, by a Trustee authorised by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by the majority of the Trustees present and voting, and in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Proceedings of the meetings of the Board shall be recorded and maintained by the Secretary and circulated by him among the trustees within a month and submitted for confirmation at the next meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Secretary and other Officers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Board who shall be appointed by the Board on such terms and conditions as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may appoint such other officers and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Secretary and the other officers and employees of the Board shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or assigned by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Funds of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The funds of the Board shall comprise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants or donations from any foreign Government, institution or organisation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) receipts from any institute or training centre maintained by it; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) income from sale of goods produced in the Gandhi Ashram.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The funds of the Board shall be kept in any bank, and its bank account shall be operated by such trustee or officer as it may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and account</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Board shall keep proper accounts of all moneys received and expended by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Board shall submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Board to furnish any report, statement or information regarding any matter under the control of the Board, and the Board shall comply with such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, by general or special order, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or by the Secretary or by such Trustee or officer of the Board as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Extinction of the Ambika-Kaliganga Charitable Trust</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, or in any agreement, deed or other instrument, upon the constitution of the Board-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Ambika-Kaliganga Charitable Trust created by Mr. Hemanta Kumar Ghose by a deed of trust dated the 5th of June, 1949 (hereinafter referred to as the trust deed) shall stand extinguished;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Gandhi Ashram, together with all lands, buildings and other properties, movable or immovable, and funds belonging to it, and all lands and buildings described in the trust deed and all other properties, movable or immovable, funds, rights and powers which, immediately before the constitution of the Board, were vested in or held by the trustees of the said Ambika-Kaliganga Charitable Trust shall stand transferred to and vest in the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts, liabilities and obligations of the Gandhi Ashram, and of the trustees of the said Ambika-Kaliganga Charitable Trust, subsisting immediately before the constitution of the Board shall stand transferred to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matters specified in sub-section (1), make such orders as it considers expedient, and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
463	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE GOVERNMENT EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING INSTITUTIONS (ADAPTATION) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING INSTITUTIONS (ADAPTATION) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 71 OF 1972).[24th June, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to adapt the Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1961 (E. P. Ord. No. XXVI of 1961) in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972 and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Government Educational and Training Institutions (Adaptation) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In the Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1961 (E.P. Ord. No. XXVI of 1961), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance in the citation of the Ordinance the words “East Pakistan” shall be omitted and in the long title and the first paragraph of the preamble for the words “East Pakistan” the word “Bangladesh” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the said Ordinance, in section 1,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in sub-section (1), the words “East Pakistan” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (2), for the words “East Pakistan” the word “Bangladesh” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in sub-section (4), the word “Provincial” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. In the said Ordinance, in section 2, in paragraph (c), the word “Provincial” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. In the said Ordinance, in section 3, in sub-section (1), the word “Provincial” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. In the said Ordinance, in section 4,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in sub-section (1), for the words “the Governor of East Pakistan” the words “the President of Bangladesh” shall be substituted and for the words “Governor” the word “President” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in sub-section (2), for the words “the Governor of East Pakistan” the words “President of Bangladesh” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. In the said Ordinance, in section 5, for the words “the Governor of East Pakistan” the words “President of Bangladesh” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. In the said Ordinance, in section 7, the word “Provincial” appearing in the proviso to paragraph (b) and also in paragraphs (c) and (f) shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. In the said Ordinance, in section 8, for the word “Province” the word “State” shall be substituted and the word “Provincial” appearing in other portions of the said section shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. In the said Ordinance, in sections 9, 10, 12, 13, 14, 15 and 18, the word “Provincial” wherever it occurs shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. In the said Ordinance, in section 15, the word “Pakistan” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
464	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT OF BANGLADESH (SERVICES) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1975</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT OF </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> (SERVICES) (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLIV OF 1975).[22nd August, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Government of Bangladesh (Services) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Government of Bangladesh (Services) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 9 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 20th August, 1975, and in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance :-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Government of Bangladesh (Services) (Repeal) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of PO No 9 of 1972</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The Government of Bangladesh (Services) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 9 of 1972), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
465	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT-OWNED NEWSPAPERS (MANAGEMENT) ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT-OWNED NEWSPAPERS (MANAGEMENT) ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XLI OF 1975).[21st July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the management and development of Government-owned newspapers and for the dissolution of certain companies established mainly for carrying on the business of publication of newspapers and printing.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the management and development of Government-owned newspapers, for the dissolution of certain companies established mainly for carrying on the business of publication of newspapers and printing and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.
