(1) This Act may be called the Government-owned Newspapers (Management) Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 13th day of June, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Management for Government-owned Newspapers constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “dissolved company” means a company dissolved under section 6.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of Board of Management</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may, for the purposes of this Act, constitute a Board to be called the Board of Management for Government-owned Newspapers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall consist of a Chairman and such number of other members as the Government may deem fit to appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The terms and conditions on which the Chairman and other members shall hold office and the procedure of the meetings of the Board shall be such as may be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The functions of the Board shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to manage, develop, expand and modernise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the newspapers owned by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) the printing presses owned by the Government and used for the purposes of printing and publication of newspapers owned by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       the printing presses vested in the Government under section 6;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if so authorised by the Government, to enter into or make any contract, agreement or other arrangement relating to the newspapers and printing presses under its management;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to purchase any plant, machinery, maintenance spares, raw materials and stores or any other goods necessary for the newspapers and printing presses under its management and to dispose of them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        with the special sanction of the Government, to borrow or raise money on the security of any property under its management;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to do such other acts and things as the Government may direct, or as may be necessary for the performance of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Principle to be followed by the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Board shall, in the discharge of its functions, act on sound commercial lines so as to adequately meet the needs of mass communication media of the country and constructively project the progressive national image abroad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall, in the discharge of its functions, be guided by such directions as the Government may give from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 5A. (1) If, at any time, the Government considers it expedient, it may, by order in the official Gazette, dissolve the Board constituted under section 3.       (2) Upon the dissolution of the Board under sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        sections 3, 4 and 5 shall be ineffective and shall be deemed to have been omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the newspapers and printing presses owned by, or vested in, the Government shall be managed, developed, expanded and modernised in such manner as the Government may determine in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding the dissolution of the Board under sub-section (1), anything done or any action taken by the Board prior to its dissolution shall be deemed to have been done or taken by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of certain companies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Companies Act 1913 (VII of 1913), or in any other law for the time being in force, or in any trust or wakf or in any deed or other instrument, the companies specified in the Schedule shall, upon the commencement of this Act, stand dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the dissolution of the companies under sub-section (1)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all such assets, rights, powers and privileges and properties, movable and immovable, of the dissolved companies, including shares thereof and their shares in any other company, corporation or trust, as have not already vested in the Government under the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) Order,1972 (P.O.No. 16 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Order, and all printing presses, cash and bank balances, reserve funds and investments of the dissolved companies and all other interest and rights in, or arising out of, such property of, or in the possession, power or control of, the dissolved companies shall stand transferred to and vest in the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all engagements made by, or with, and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for, any of the dissolved companies for the purpose of, or in relation to, its business and functions shall stand transferred to, and be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or made by, with or for, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        any sum payable to, or recoverable by, any of the dissolved companies for the purpose of, or in relation to, any of its business and functions shall be payable to, or recoverable by, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        any reference to any of the dissolved companies in any deed, bond, power-of-attorney, grant of legal representation and other instrument of whatever nature for the purpose of, or in relation to, the business and functions of such company shall, except where the context otherwise requires, be construed as reference to the Government and such deed, bond, power, grant or instrument shall have effect accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        all suits, appeals and other legal proceedings instituted by or against any of the dissolved companies for the purpose of, or in relation to, its business and functions before its dissolution under this section shall be deemed to be suits, appeals and legal proceedings by or against the Government and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         unless in the case of any person the Government by special order terminates his appointment or services and until the Government determines and redefines the terms and conditions of service, the services of all officers and other employees of the dissolved companies shall, notwithstanding anything contained in any contract or agreement or in the conditions of service, stand transferred to the Government on such terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before the dissolution of those companies; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) no officer or other employee of any of the dissolved companies whose services are, by or under this Act, terminated or transferred to the Government shall be entitled to any compensation on account of such termination or transfer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the avoidance of dispute it is hereby declared that the properties of the dissolved companies as have vested in the Government under the said Order shall for all purposes whatever cease to be abandoned property within the meaning of the said Order and shall accordingly cease to be subject to the provisions of that Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compensation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) In respect of the shares in a dissolved company which have vested in the Government under section 6 and the rights arising out of such shares, there shall be paid to the holders of such shares as compensation,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if the full amount of the value of the shares had been paid, a sum equivalent to the face-value of those shares, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if the full amount of the value of the shares had not been paid, a sum equivalent to the amount actually paid on account of such shares.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Acceptance by a shareholder of a dissolved company of the compensation payable under sub-section (1) shall operate as full and complete discharge of such shareholder from any obligations in respect of the debts and liabilities of such company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If a shareholder declines to accept the compensation payable in respect of his shares under sub-section (1), he shall be entitled to such compensation or, as the case may be, be liable to make such contribution, according as, after assessment of the dissolved company, the value of the assets exceeds or falls short of the liabilities as he would have been entitled or liable had the dissolved company been wound up under the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Government-owned Newspapers (Management) Ordinance, 1975 (XXXIV of 1975), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, any Board constituted, any appointment made, anything done or any action taken under any provision of the said Ordinance shall, in so far as it is not inconsistent with any provision of this Act, be deemed to have been constituted, appointed, done or taken, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the removal of doubts it is hereby declared that the Janata Printing and Packaging Limited purported to have been dissolved by the said Ordinance shall be deemed never to have been so dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 5A was inserted by section 2 of the Government-owned Newspapers (Management) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
466	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (REVIEW OF PENALTIES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE GOVERNMENT SERVANTS (REVIEW OF PENALTIES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XLVIII OF 1975).[2nd September, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the review of orders imposing penalties upon some Government servants and Corporation employees under certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the review of orders imposing penalties upon some Government servants and Corporation employees under Martial Law Regulation No. 58 of 1969 and the Government of Bangladesh (Services) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 9 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 20th August, 1975, and in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definition </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ 2. In this Ordinance, “Review Board” means the Review Board constituted under section 3A.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override other laws, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force, or in any rules, regulations, contract or terms or conditions of service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Review Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 3A. (1) The Government shall constitute a Review Board for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Review Board shall consist of three members, of whom two shall be persons who are or have been Judges of the Supreme Court and the other shall be a person who is or has been a senior officer in the service of the Republic, and they shall be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government shall appoint one of the members of the Review Board who is or has been a Judge of the Supreme Court to be its Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In this section, “Supreme Court” includes a Court which at any time before the commencement of the Constitution of the People's Republic of Bangladesh exercised jurisdiction as a High Court in the territory  of Bangladesh.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application for review</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Any person who was aggrieved by any order passed under Martial Law Regulation No. 58 of 1969, or by any order or declaration passed or made under the Government of Bangladesh (Services) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 9 of 1972), may, within sixty days from the date of commencement of this Ordinance, apply in writing to the Review Board for review of such order or declaration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure of Review Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. On receipt of an application under section 4, the Review Board shall examine the records of the case in which the order or declaration, the review of which is applied for, was passed or made and hear the applicant, and make to the President any one of the following recommendations, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        rejection of the application;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) cancellation of the order or declaration, the review of which is applied for;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) modification of the order, the review of which is applied for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers of Review board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 5A. (1) The Review Board may, if it considers necessary for the purpose of review of any order or declaration, examine any person or require any person to produce any record, document or other material in his possession or control for its examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Review Board shall have the same powers as are vested in a Civil Court under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (V of 1908), for the purpose of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        enforcing the attendance of any person for examining him; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) compelling the production of any record, document and other material.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Order of President</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. On receipt of the recommendations of the Review Board, the President may pass such order as he deems fit, and the order of the President shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Review Committees and procedure thereof</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 6A. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, as soon as may be, after the commencement of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1977 (XXXVII of 1977), the Government shall constitute a Review Committee in each Ministry for the purpose of reviewing orders and declarations passed or made against persons who were or, but for such orders or declarations, would be non-gazetted officers or employees of that Ministry or of any office or Directorate under it or who were or, but for such orders or declarations, would be officers or employees of any corporation or institution under it holding a status equivalent to that of a non-gazetted Government officer or employee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Review Committee shall consist of a Chairman and two other members to be appointed by the Government from among officers of the Ministry concerned:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Chairman shall not be an officer below the rank of a Joint Secretary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Review Committee shall exercise the same powers and follow the same procedure as are exercised and followed by the Review Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Review Committee shall make its recommendations to the Minister or Adviser in charge of the Ministry concerned who may, on receipt of the recommendations, pass such order as he deems fit, and his order shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) On the constitution of Review Committee in a Ministry,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all applications pending before the Review Board immediately before such constitution filed by persons mentioned in sub-section (1) shall stand transferred to that Review Committee for disposal; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all recommendations made to the President by the Review Board in respect of the applications filed by such persons on which the President passed no orders before such constitution shall stand transferred to the Minister or Adviser in charge of that Ministry, who may pass such orders thereon as he deems fit, and his orders shall be final.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Section 2 was substituted by section 2 of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1975 (Ordinance No. LVIII of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 3A was inserted by section 3 of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1975 (Ordinance No. LVIII of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Section 5A was inserted by section 4 of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1975 (Ordinance No. LVIII of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Section 6A was added by section 2 of the Government Servants (Review of Penalties) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1977 (Ordinance No. XXXVII of 1977)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
467	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE HUNDRED-TAKA DEMONETISED NOTES (MODE OF PAYMENT AND RECOVERY OF TAXES) ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE HUNDRED-TAKA DEMONETISED NOTES (MODE OF PAYMENT AND RECOVERY OF TAXES) ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXXV OF 1975).[21st July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for special mode of payment of the value of the demonetised notes and recovery of taxes therefrom.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for special mode of payment of the value of the demonetised notes and recovery of taxes therefrom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Hundred-Taka Demonetised Notes (Mode of Payment and Recovery of Taxes) Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the seventh day of April, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “agency” means any bank, post office, treasury or sub-treasury;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “demonetised note” means a Bangladesh Bank Note of one-hundred-Taka denomination which has ceased to be legal tender with effect from the seventh day of April, 1975, in pursuance of the declaration made by the Government by notification No. I F. 5/31/75-95, dated the 6th April, 1975 (hereinafter referred to as the said notification);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “depositor” means a person who has deposited any demonetised note with any agency mentioned in the said notification within the time specified therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of Act and rules inconsistent with other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Act or any rule made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Mode of payment of value of demonetised notes to be determined by Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The value of the demonetised notes deposited by a depositor shall be paid by an agency on such date and in such form and manner as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recovery of taxes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) If the Government is satisfied that any taxes are recoverable from a depositor under any law for the time being in force, it may, by order in writing, direct the recovery of such taxes from the value of the demonetised notes deposited by him and send the order to the agency with which the demonetised notes have been deposited.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On receipt of an order under sub-section (1), the agency shall deduct the amount specified in the order from the value of the demonetised notes deposited by the depositor and pay the balance, if any, to him on such date and in such form and manner as may be determined by the Government under section 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any person or class of persons or amount of demonetised notes from the operation of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) No action taken under this Act against any depositor in respect of the demonetised notes deposited by him shall be called in question in any manner by or before any court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government or the Bangladesh Bank or any agency for delay in the payment of the value of demonetised notes or for payment of the value thereof in any form or manner other than in cash or for deduction of any tax from the value of such notes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Hundred-Taka Demonetised Notes (Mode of Payment and Recovery of Taxes) Ordinance, 1975 (Ord. XXV of 1975), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under any provision of the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
468	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE INSURANCE CORPORATIONS ACT, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE INSURANCE CORPORATIONS ACT, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. VI OF 1973).[23rd June, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to establish a Jiban Bima Corporation and a Sadharan Bima Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Jiban Bima Corporation and a Sadharan Bima Corporation for the purpose of taking over the undertakings of the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation, the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation, the Karnaphuly Bima Corporation and the Teesta Bima Corporation, and for the dissolution of the Bangladesh Jatiya Bima Corporation, and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title, extent and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Insurance Corporations Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 14th May,  1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Directors of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Corporation” means a Corporation established by section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Director” means a Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “insurer” means an insurer as defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), who carries on insurance business in Bangladesh and includes a provident society as defined in section 65 of that Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Managing Director” means a Managing Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Order” means the Bangladesh Insurance (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 95 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All other words and expressions used in this Act but not defined and defined in the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">This Act and rules to override other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Act and any rules made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Corporations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) On the commencement of this Act, there shall be established two Corporations to be called the Jiban Bima Corporation and the Sadharan Bima Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each Corporation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Capital</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The authorised capital of each Corporation shall be Taka 1[ twenty] crore to be subscribed by the Government from time to time according to the requirements of the Corporation and in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General direction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to rules made under this Act, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of each Corporation shall vest in a Board of Directors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each Board in discharging its functions shall act on commercial considerations having due regard to public interest generally.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Each Board shall be guided on questions of policy by such general or special instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time and, if any question arises as to whether any question is a question of policy or not, the decision of the Government shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Board of each Corporation shall consist of the Managing Director and six other Directors to be appointed by the Government, at least three of whom shall be from amongst persons who, in the opinion of the Government, have had the experience and shown capacity in the field of insurance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall appoint one of the Directors, other than the Managing Director, to be the Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other Directors of a Corporation, other than the Managing Director, shall, unless removed earlier, hold office for a term of three years and shall be eligible for re-appointment:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may at any time remove any Director, including the Chairman, from office and appoint in his stead another person to fill the vacancy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman or any other Director may at any time resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Managing Director</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Managing Director shall be appointed by the Government for such period and on such salary, terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Managing Director shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        be a Director of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        exercise such powers, perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be entrusted to him by the Government or as may be prescribed or assigned to him by the Board from time to time; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        divest himself of any directorship held by him in any other corporation, company or concern otherwise than on behalf of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If, in the opinion of the Government, the Managing Director appointed under sub-section (1) is, for illness or for any other reason, incapable of performing his duties under this Act, the Government may appoint another person to perform the duties of the Managing Director during the period of such incapability, and the person so appointed shall be exempt from the provision of clause (d) of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Qualifications and disqualifications of Directors</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No person shall be or shall continue to be a Director of a Corporation who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is or at any time has been adjudicated insolvent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is found to be a lunatic or of unsound mind;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is or at any time has been convicted of an offence which, in the opinion of the Government, is an offence involving moral turpitude;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        is a minor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Board without leave of absence granted by the Chairman or, in the case of the Chairman, by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         is, except in the case of the Managing Director, a salaried official of the Corporation; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        is not a citizen of Bangladesh or acquires the citizenship of or affirms or acknowledges allegiance to, a foreign State.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The meetings of a Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a meeting may also be otherwise convened by the Managing Director, if the Chairman so directs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than three Directors, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of a Board each Director shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No director shall vote on any matter in which he is directly or indirectly interested.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If for any reason the Chairman of a Board is unable to be present at a meeting a Director elected by the Directors present shall preside over the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceeding of a Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Each Board may appoint such committee or committees as it thinks fit to assist it in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) Subject to the rules made under this Act, it shall be the function of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Jiban Bima Corporation to carry on all kinds of life insurance and reinsurance business; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Sadharan Bima Corporation to carry on all kinds of general insurance and reinsurance business, whether in or outside Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, every Corporation shall, in particular, have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to acquire, hold and dispose of any property for the purpose of its business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to transfer the whole or any part of its insurance business carried on outside Bangladesh to any other person or persons, if in the interest of the Corporation it is expedient so to do;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to carry on any other business which may seem to the Corporation to be capable of being conveniently carried on in connection with its business and calculated directly or indirectly to render profitable the business of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to do all such things as may be incidental or conducive to the proper exercise of any of the powers of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The head office of each Corporation shall be at such place as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each Corporation may establish as many other offices in Bangladesh and, with the previous approval of the Government, abroad as it thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of undertakings of existing Bima Corporations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) On the commencement of this Act, there shall be transferred to and vested in-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Jiban Bima Corporation the entire undertakings of the Surma Jiban Bima Corporation and the Rupsa Jiban Bima Corporation established by the Order, hereinafter in this Act referred to as the existing Bima Corporations; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Sadharan Bima Corporation the entire undertakings of the Karnaphuli Bima Corporation and the Teesta Bima Corporation established by the Order, hereinafter in this Act referred to as the existing Bima Corporations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The undertakings transferred to and vested in a Corporation under sub-section (1) shall be deemed to include all business, assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable or immovable, cash balances, reserve funds, investments, deposits and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property as were immediately before the commencement of this Act in the ownership, possession, power or control of the existing Bima Corporations in relation to the undertakings within or without Bangladesh, and all books of account, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, and shall be deemed to include all borrowings, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind then subsisting of the existing Bima Corporations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If, according to the laws of any country outside Bangladesh, the provisions of this Act by themselves are not effective to transfer or vest any asset situated in that country which forms part of the undertakings of an existing Bima Corporation to, or in, the Corporation concerned, the affairs of the existing Bima Corporations in relation to such assets shall, on and from the commencement of this Act, stand entrusted to the chief executive officer for the time being of the Corporation concerned, and the chief executive officer may exercise all such powers and do all such acts and things as may be exercised or done by the existing Bima Corporations for the purpose of effectively transferring such asset.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The chief executive officer of the Corporation concerned shall, in exercise of the power conferred on him by sub-section (3), take all such steps as may be required by the laws of any such country outside Bangladesh for the purpose of effecting such transfer or vesting, and may either himself or through any person authorised by him in this behalf realise any asset of the existing Bima Corporations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All contracts, deeds, bonds, agreements, powers of attorney, grants of legal representation and other instruments of whatever nature subsisting or having effect immediately before the commencement of this Act and to which an existing Bima Corporation whose undertaking has been transferred to and vested in a Corporation under sub-section (1) is a party or which are in favour of such existing Bima Corporation shall, in so far as they relate to such undertaking of the existing Bima Corporation, be of as full force and effect against or in favour of the Corporation, and may be enforced or acted upon as fully and effectually as if in the place of the existing Bima Corporation the Corporation had been a party thereto or as if they had been entered into or issued in favour of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Any suit, appeal or other proceeding of whatever nature pending on the date of the commencement of this Act by or against an existing Bima Corporation in relation to any of its undertakings shall be deemed to be suit, appeal or other proceeding pending by or against the Corporation in which the undertaking has vested under sub-section (1), and may be continued or prosecuted and enforced by or against the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty arising out of, or in connection with, the transfer of any undertaking of an existing Bima Corporation to a Corporation or any matter supplemental or incidental to, or consequential upon, such transfer or any other matter specified in this section, make such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to, as part of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of certain immovable property by a Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 14A. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, a Corporation shall, if the Government so directs, transfer any immovable property transferred to and vested in it under this Act to any insurer on a price fixed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers and employees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Each Corporation may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Corporation may employ such officers and other employees of an existing Bima Corporation, whose undertaking has been transferred to and vested in it under sub-section (1) of section 14, as it may specify, and the officers and other employees so employed shall hold their office or service in the Corporation on such terms and conditions as it may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or other employee may, within such time as may be specified by the Corporation which employs him, exercise his option not to continue in the service of that Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If any question arises out of the transfer of an officer or other employee of an existing Bima Corporation under sub-section (2), the question shall be referred to the Government whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The transfer of service of any officer or other employee from an existing Bima Corporation to a Corporation shall not entitle any such officer or other employee to any compensation and no such claim shall be entertained by any court, tribunal or other authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in any rules, regulations, contract or agreement relating to the terms and conditions of service made or entered into by an existing Bima Corporation, no person shall be entitled to any compensation against the existing Bima Corporation or against any Corporation for the loss of his office or service or for the premature termination of any contract or agreement of management entered into by him with the existing Bima Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, a Corporation shall not determine the pay scales of the different classes of its officers and other employees without the previous approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual budget statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. Each Corporation shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement, to be called the annual budget statement, in the prescribed form for every year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Investment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. Subject to the provisions of the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), each Corporation may invest its funds in such manner as its Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Borrowings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. Each Corporation may, with the prior approval of the Government, borrow such sums, with or without security, as may be required by it to discharge its functions under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) Each Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and shall, at the expiry of each year, prepare in the prescribed form with reference to that year a balance sheet, a profit and loss account and revenue accounts in respect of such class of insurance business together with such other abstracts and statements as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of each Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being Chartered Accountants within the meaning of the Chartered Accountants Ordinance, 1961 (Ord. X of 1961), who shall be appointed by the Government in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor-General on such terms and conditions as the Government may fix, and shall, in regard to the extent and method of their audit, be guided by such directions as may be given by the Comptroller and Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the provisions of sections 12A and 33 of the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), shall apply to each Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance sheet and other accounts of the Corporation and shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation, and shall at all reasonable times have access to the books of accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether in their opinion the balance sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of affairs of the Corporation and, if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Corporation concerned for the protection of the interest of the Government and of the creditors of the Corporation concerned or upon the sufficiency of the procedure in auditing the affairs of the Corporation concerned, and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the copy of the audit or direct that different procedure in audit shall be adopted or that any other examination shall be made by the auditors or any other person or persons if, in its opinion, the interest of the Government or of the creditor so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Actuarial valuation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Jiban Bima Corporation shall, once at least in every two years cause an investigation to be made by actuaries into the financial condition of its business, including a valuation of its liabilities in respect thereto, and submit the report of the actuaries to the 3[ Chief Controller of Insurance] and also to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Returns, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) Each Corporation shall furnish to the Government such returns, reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each Corporation shall furnish to the Government and the 4[ Chief Controller of Insurance], within six months of the close of each year, the audited accounts, statements and abstracts referred to in section 19, together with a report on the working of the Corporation during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)The copies of the audited accounts and annual report received by the Government under sub-section (2) shall be published in the official Gazette and shall be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Profit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) After making provision for bad and doubtful debts, depreciation of assets and any other matter determined by the Board, the Sadharan Bima Corporation may, out of its net annual profits, establish a reserve fund and any surplus remaining thereafter shall be paid to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If as a result of any investigation undertaken by the Jiban Bima Corporation under section 20 any surplus emerges, ninety-five per cent of such surplus or such higher percentage thereof as the Government may approve shall be allocated to or reserved for the life insurance policy-holders of the Corporation and the remainder shall be paid to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public Property to be insured with the Sadharan Bima Corporation only</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 23. 6[ (1) Fifty percent of all insurance business relating to any public property or to any risk or liability appertaining to any public property shall be placed with the Sadharan Bima Corporation and the remaining fifty percent of such business may be placed either with that Corporation or with any other insurer in Bangladesh.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any policy of insurance taken or issued in contravention of sub-section (1) shall be void:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any claim for loss, damage, compensation or refund of premium arising out of, or relating to, such policy shall be binding on the insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In this section, “public property” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any property movable or immovable which belongs to, or the protection of which is the legal responsibility of,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Government or a local authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        any company, firm, undertaking, institution, organisation or other establishment which is managed or controlled by the Government or a local authority or in which the Government, by itself or jointly with a local authority or company managed or controlled by it, holds controlling financial share or interest or which is specified by the Government for the purpose of this section; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a project financed out of an external loan or with external aid until it reaches-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in the case of an industrial project, the stage at which it is capable of commencing normal production; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in the case of any other project, the stage at which it is capable of being put to the use for which it is intended.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Re-insurance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ 23A. (1) Every insurer registered and carrying on insurance business in Bangladesh shall re-insure, on generally acceptable terms and conditions, such portion of his insurance business as he cannot retain on his own account.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Fifty per cent of the re-insurable general insurance business shall be re-insured with the Sadharan Bima Corporation and the remaining fifty per cent of such business may be re-insured either with that Corporation or with any other insurer whether in or outside Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The whole or any portion of the re-insurable life insurance business may be re-insured with any insurer outside Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Whoever contravenes the provisions of this section shall be punishable with fine which may extend to ten thousand taka.]]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Guarantee of policies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. The sums assured by all policies issued by a Corporation including any bonuses declared in respect thereof and the sums assured by all policies issued by any existing Bima Corporation the liabilities under which have vested in a Corporation under this Act, and all bonuses declared in respect thereof, whether before or after the commencement of this Act, shall be guaranteed as to payment in cash by the Government 8[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this provision shall not apply in the case of any policy issued by a Corporation after the commencement of the Insurance Corporations (Amendment) Act, 1990 (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)?]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up of the Corporations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. No provisions of law relating to the winding up of companies shall apply to a Corporation and a Corporation shall not be wound up save by order of the Government and in such manner as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Omitted]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. [Exceptions.- Omitted by section 4 of the Insurance Corporations (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (LI of 1984).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Government or any Director, officer or employee of a Corporation for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct that any power which by or under any of the provisions of this Act is conferred on it shall, subject to such</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the 9[ Chief Controller of Insurance].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Act IV of 1938 to apply</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. The provisions of the Insurance Act, 1938 (Act IV of 1938), shall, as far as may be, apply to a Corporation as they apply to any other insurer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the form and manner in which capital of a Corporation may be subscribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the manner of appointment of a Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the terms and conditions of service of the Chairman and other Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the powers, functions and duties of the Chairman and other Director of a Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the time and place at which meetings of a Board may be held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the form in which the annual report of a Corporation shall be prepared; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        any other matter which has to be or may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. (1) Each Corporation may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of the Jatiya Bima Corporation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. (1) On the commencement of this Act, the Bangladesh Jatiya Bima Corporation established by the Order, hereinafter in this section referred to as the said Corporation, shall stand dissolved and the entire undertaking of the said Corporation shall stand transferred to, and vested in, the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The undertaking transferred to and vested in the Government under sub-section (1) shall be deemed to include all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable or immovable, cash balances, reserve funds, investments, deposits and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property as were immediately before the commencement of this Act in the ownership,
