(Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XCIV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The words, figures, brackets, letters and commas “Article XXI (b) of, and paragraph 5(d) of Schedule D to, the Fund” were substituted for the words, figures, brackets and letter “Article XXVII(b) of the Fund” by section 8 of the International Financial Organisations (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XCIV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
471	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ISLAMIC DEVELOPMENT BANK ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ISLAMIC DEVELOPMENT BANK ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXVIII OF 1975).[18th July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the implementation of the Agreement establishing the Islamic Development Bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS the People's Republic of Bangladesh is a signatory to the Agreement establishing the Islamic Development Bank, and it is expedient to provide for the implementation of that Agreement and for carrying out the obligations of the People's Republic of Bangladesh as a founder member of that Bank and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Islamic Development Bank Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 29th day of January, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Agreement” means the Agreement establishing the Islamic Development Bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Bank” means the Islamic Development Bank established by the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Financial provisions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be paid out of the Consolidated Fund all such sums as may, from time to time, be required for the purpose of making payments on behalf of the People's Republic of Bangladesh under any provision of the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any sums received by the People's Republic of Bangladesh from the Bank in pursuance of the Agreement shall be paid into the Consolidated Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain provisions of the Agreement to</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law, the provisions of Chapter VII of the Agreement set out in the Schedule shall have the force of law in Bangladesh:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in Article 59 of the Agreement shall be construed as-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        entitling the Bank to import into Bangladesh goods free of any duty of customs without any restriction on their subsequent sale therein;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) conferring on the Bank any exemption from duties or taxes which form part of the price of goods sold; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) conferring on the Bank any exemption from duties or taxes which are in fact no more than charges for services rendered.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, amend the Schedule in conformity with any amendment, which may hereafter be duly made and adopted, of the provisions of the Agreement set out therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to take steps to discharge obligations and liabilities under the Agreement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may take all such steps and make all such arrangements as may be considered necessary to enable it to discharge its financial obligations and other liabilities under the Agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Islamic Development Bank Ordinance, 1975 (Ord. I of 1975), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
472	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ISLAMIC FOUNDATION ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE ISLAMIC FOUNDATION ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XVII OF 1975).[14th July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to establish an Islamic Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish an Islamic Foundation for the purposes of founding, managing and assisting mosques and Islamic centres, academies and institutes, undertaking research on the contributions of Islam to culture, science and civilization, propagating the basic Islamic ideals of universal brotherhood, tolerance and justice and promoting studies and research in Islamic history, philosophy, law and jurisprudence and to provide for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Islamic Foundation Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 28th day of March, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of 1[ Governors] of the Foundation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (bb) “Director-General” means the Director-General appointed under section 5A;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Foundation” means the Islamic Foundation established under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (cc) “Governor” means a member of the Board;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules 5[ ;]]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (e) “Vice-Chairman” means the Vice-Chairman of the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Foundation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Act, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish a Foundation to be called the Islamic Foundation to carry out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Foundation shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Head office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The head office of the Foundation shall be at Dacca.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Foundation may establish as many branches and at such places as it thinks fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General direction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The general direction and administration of the affairs of the Foundation shall vest in a Board of 7[ Governors] which may exercise all powers and do all things which may be exercised or done by the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Director-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ 5A. (1) There shall be a Director-General of the Foundation to be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be the chief executive officer of the Foundation with responsibilities for carrying out the decisions of the Board and shall act as the Secretary of the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ 6. (1) The Board shall consist of the following Governors, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Minister-in-charge of the 10[ Ministry of Religious Affairs], who shall also be the Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (aa) the Secretary, Ministry of Religious Affairs, who shall also be the Vice-Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Chairman, University Grants Commission of Bangladesh, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Secretary, Education Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Vice-Chancellor, Islamic University, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Chairman, Bangladesh Madrasha Education Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) three persons to be elected by the members of the Foundation from amongst their number in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) five persons to be nominated by the Government from amongst the eminent Muslim scholars and theologians of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) two members of Parliament to be nominated by the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the Director General, who shall also be the Member-Secretary of the Board, ex-officio.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Governor, other than an ex-officio Governor, shall hold office for a term of three years:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that notwithstanding the expiration of his term, a Governor, other than an ex-officio Governor, shall continue to hold office until his successor enters upon office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Governor, other than an ex-officio Governor, may resign his office by notice in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may declare the office of a Governor, other than an ex-officio Governor, vacant if it is satisfied that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        such Governor is, by reason of illness or any other cause, unable to discharge the functions of his office; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) his continuance in office is not in the interest of the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than five 12[ Governors] shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All questions at a meeting of the Board shall be decided by a majority of the 13[ Governors] present and voting, and in the case of an equality of votes the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ (4) All meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and, in the absence of both, by a Governor nominated for the purpose by the Chairman.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Board may appoint such committee or committees as it thinks fit to assist it in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Members of the Foundation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 9. (1) The Foundation may have its Patrons, Fellows, life-members and members who shall have, subject to the provisions of this Act, such functions and privileges as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to their own functions and privileges, the Patrons and Fellows shall also have the functions and privileges of the life-members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Board shall enter in its books maintained for the purpose-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        as Patrons of the Foundation the names of such distinguished persons as may, upon its invitation, consent to be such Patrons; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) as Fellows of the Foundation the names of such persons with outstanding contributions in the field of Islamic learning and social service as may desire or agree to be such Fellows.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Patron or a Fellow of the Foundation shall, unless he indicates his desire to relinquish the privilege, continue to be such Patron or Fellow during his life-time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Board may, on an application made in this behalf, admit in such manner and upon fulfilment of such conditions as may be prescribed any person having interest in the objects and purposes of the Foundation as a life-member or a member of the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9A. (1) The Board shall convene every year an annual general meeting of the members of the Foundation,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">a) to consider the annual report of the activities of the Foundation during the next preceding year to be laid before the meeting by the Director-General;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">b) to offer suggestions in respect of the functions and activities of the Foundation for the consideration of the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">c) to elect, as and when necessary, the Governors required to be elected to the Board by the members of the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may at any time convene other general meetings of the members of the Foundation to consider such matters as may be placed before the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 17[ (3) A general meeting of the members of the Foundation shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and, in the absence of both, by a Governor nominated for the purpose by the Chairman.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The proceedings of the general meeting of the Foundation shall be regulated in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations made under this Act.]]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ 10. (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Foundation who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may determine and perform such functions as the Board or the Director-General may assign to him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Foundation may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The functions of the Foundation shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to establish, manage and maintain mosques and Islamic centres, academies and 19[ institutes];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to render financial assistance to mosques and Islamic centres, 20[ academies, institutes and organisations dedicated to social services];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to undertake research on the contributions of Islam to culture, thoughts, science and civilization;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to propagate and assist in propagating the basic Islamic ideals of universal brotherhood, tolerance and justice 21[ and to recommend measures, including institutional development, for the realisation of Islamic values and principles in the cultural, social and economic life of the community];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to organize and promote studies and research in Islamic history, philosophy, culture, law and jurisprudence 22[ with a view to popularising Islamic values and principles and to publish, and promote the publication and dissemination at cheap prices of popular Islamic Literature];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ (f) to translate, compile and publish books, periodicals and pamphlets on Islam and Islamic subject;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to organize conferences, lectures, debates and symposia on matters relating to Islamic history, philosophy, culture, law and jurisprudence;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to institute prizes and medals for outstanding contributions in the field of Islamic studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24[ (hh) to sponsor, undertake or assist projects on Islam;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to award scholarships for Islamic studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to manage and develop Baitul Mokarram Mosque; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to do all other acts and things ancillary or incidental to any of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) There shall be a Fund of the Foundation to which shall be credited-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        funds of the Baitul Mukarram and the Islamic Academy transferred to the Foundation under section 20;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants and loans from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) loans raised in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) aids and grants received from foreign countries or organizations with the prior approval of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) incomes from investments, royalties and properties; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) all other receipts of the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Fund of the Foundation shall be utilized by it to meet charges in connection with its functions under this Act and all payments of the Foundation shall be made out of that Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All moneys of the Foundation shall be deposited with any bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Foundation shall keep its account in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Foundation shall, by such date in each year as may be fixed by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a budget in such form as the Government may specify for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The accounts of the Foundation shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General) in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (1), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Foundation and may examine any 25[ Governor, the Director-General] or any other officer or employee of the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Auditor-General shall submit his audit report to the Government and shall forward a copy thereof to the Foundation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Foundation shall furnish to the Government such reports and statements as the Government may from time to time require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Foundation shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government statement of audited accounts together with an annual report on the condition of its affairs of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Foundation may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman 26[ ,any Governor, the Director-General] or any other officer or employee of the Foundation as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27[ 18. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18A. (1) The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fixation of rent of properties of the Foundation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18AA. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any agreement or contract,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Foundation shall fix the rent of its properties in accordance with the schedule of rent fixed by the Government, from time to time, keeping in view the prevailing market rate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Foundation shall re-fix the rent of its properties in accordance with the schedule fixed under clause (a):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the rent of any property or any portion thereof shall not be re-fixed within twelve months in respect of each tenancy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any tenant refuses or fails to pay the rent fixed or re-fixed under sub-section (1), he shall be deemed to be an unauthorised occupant and shall be evicted from the property of the Foundation.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No provision of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Foundation, and the Foundation shall not be wound up except by order of the Government, and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dissolution of Baitul Mukarram and Islamic Academy</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any rule, regulation or bye-law, or in any trust, wakf, agreement, deed, or other instrument, upon the establishment of the Foundation-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the society known as the Baitul Mukarram, registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (XXI of 1860), hereinafter referred to as the said society, and the institute known as the Islamic Academy, Dacca, hereinafter referred to as the said institute, shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the ad hoc committee or any other committee or body of management of the said society, by whatever name called, shall stand dissolved, and all members of the said society and all members and the Administrator of the said institute shall cease to be such members and Administrator;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, reserve funds, investments and all other interests and rights and rights in, or arising out of, such property and all debts, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the said society and the said institute, subsisting immediately before their dissolution, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Foundation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all debts and obligations incurred, contracts entered into or rights acquired and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for the said society and the said institute before their dissolution shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into, acquired or engaged to be done by, with or for the Foundation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all officers and other employees of the said society and the said institute shall stand transferred to the Foundation and shall be deemed to have been appointed by the Foundation in accordance with the terms and conditions of service applicable to them, and no such officer or employee shall be entitled to any compensation because of such transfer; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said society and the said institute before their dissolution shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Foundation and shall be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the dissolution, transfer or other matters specified in sub-section (1), make such orders as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) The Islamic Foundation Ordinance, 1975 (Ord. XVII of 1975), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any order made, notification issued or direction given under any provision of the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made, issued or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “Governors” was substituted for the word “Trustees” by section 2 of the Islamic Foundation (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXVI of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 2 of the Islamic Foundation (Second 473	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE JAHANGIRNAGAR UNIVERSITY ACT, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE JAHANGIRNAGAR UNIVERSITY ACT, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXXIV OF 1973).[8th October, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to repeal the Jahangirnagar Muslim University Ordinance, 1970 and to provide for reconstitution and reorganisation of the Jahangirnagar  Muslim University</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to reconstitute and reorganise the Jahangirnagar Muslim University for the purpose of improving the teaching and research provided thereby and the administration thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Jahangirnagar University Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, and in all Statutes made hereunder, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Academic Council” means the Academic Council of the University constituted under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Authority” means any of the Authorities of the University hereinafter specified in this Act or the Statutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Commission” means the University Grants Commission of Bangladesh constituted under the University Grants Commission of Bangladesh Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 10 of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Hall” means a unit of residence for students of the University provided or maintained by the University for the corporate life and extra-curricular instructions of its students;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Provost” means the head of a Hall;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Registered Graduate” means a graduate registered under the provisions of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Senate” means the Senate of the University constituted under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Statutes”, “University Ordinances” and “Regulations” mean respectively the Statutes, Ordinances and Regulations of the University for the time being in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “Syndicate” means the Syndicate of the University constituted under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         “teachers” include Professors, Associate Professors, Assistant Professors and Lecturers of the University and any other person declared to be teacher by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “University” means the Jahangirnagar University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         “Warden” means an officer so designated and appointed by the University for management and administration of the affairs of a house of a Hall under the guidance and control of the Provost; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “year” means academic year beginning on the 1st day of July.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Jahangirnagar Muslim University shall be reconstituted at Savar in the district of Dacca in accordance with the provisions of this Act and the Campus of the University shall comprise its present site and such other areas as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chancellor and the Vice-Chancellor of the University and the members of the Senate, the Syndicate and the Academic Council and all persons who may hereafter become such officers or members, so long as they continue to hold such office, or membership, shall constitute a body corporate by the name of the Jahangirnagar University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The University shall have perpetual succession and common seal and shall sue and be sued by the said name.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The University shall be a residential one and shall exercise the powers conferred on it by or under this Act within the territorial limits of the University Campus.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers of the University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by or under the provisions of this Act, the University shall have the following powers:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to provide for instruction in such branches of learning, at Honours degree and post-Honours degree level, as the University may think fit, and to make provision for research and for the advancement and dissemination of knowledge;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to prescribe courses of studies to be taught by the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to hold examinations and grant and confer certificates, diplomas, degrees and other academic distinctions on persons who,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         have pursued a course of study provided for or prescribed by the University, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        have carried on research under conditions laid down in the Statutes, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       have carried on private study under conditions laid down in the Statutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to grant such diplomas to, and to provide such lectures and instructions for, persons not being students of the University as the University may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to confer honorary degrees or other distinctions on approved persons in the manner as laid down in the Statutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to provide such lectures and instructions for, and to grant, under conditions laid down in the Statutes, such diplomas or certificates to, persons as the University may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to co-operate with other Universities and authorities in such manner and for such purposes as the University may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to institute Professorships, Associate Professorships, Assistant Professorships, Lecturerships and any other teaching posts required by the University, and to appoint persons to such posts and such other teaching posts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to institute and award Fellowships, Scholarships, Prizes, and Medals in accordance with the Statutes, University Ordinances and Regulations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to demand and receive such fees as may be prescribed by the University Ordinances;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to set up and maintain academic museums, laboratories, schools and institutes for the development of teaching and research and to hold exhibitions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         to institute and maintain Halls for the residence of the students of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       to supervise and control the residence and discipline of the students of the University, to promote their extra-curricular activities and to make arrangements for promoting their health; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        to do all such other acts and things, whether incidental to the powers aforesaid or not, as may be required in order to further the objects of the University as teaching and examining body and to cultivate and promote arts, science and other branches of learning.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">University open to all classes and creeds</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The University shall be open to all persons of either sex and of whatever religion, race, creed, or class.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Teaching of the University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) All recognised teaching in connection with the University courses shall be conducted by the University and shall include lectures and work in the laboratories or workshops and other teaching conducted by the teachers thereof in such manner as may be prescribed by the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Authorities responsible for organising such teaching shall be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The courses and curricula shall be prescribed by the University Ordinances and the Regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Recognised teaching shall be supplemented by tutorial instructions to be given in accordance with conditions as may be provided by the University Ordinances and Regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Visitation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Commission shall have the right to cause an inspection to be made by such person or persons, as it may direct, of the University, its buildings, laboratories and equipment, and of any institutions associated with the University, and also of the examinations, teaching and other work conducted or done by the University and to cause an inquiry to be made in like manner in respect of any matter connected with the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Commission shall in every case give notice to the University of its intention to cause an inspection or inquiry to be made and the University shall be entitled to be represented thereat.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Commission shall communicate to the Syndicate its views with reference to the results of any such inspection or inquiry, and shall, after ascertaining the opinion of the Syndicate thereon, advise the University upon the action to be taken in that behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Syndicate shall report to the Commission the action, if any, which is proposed to be taken or has been taken upon the results of its inspection or inquiry.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Officers of the University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The following shall be the officers of the University:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Pro-Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Treasurer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the Deans;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the Registrar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the Director of Students Counselling and Guidance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the Provosts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Proctor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         the Deputy Registrar (Academic);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        the Deputy Registrar (Administration);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         the University Engineer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (m) the Director (Planning and Development);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        the Comptroller;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        the Librarian; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        such other officers as may be declared by the Statutes to be officers of the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Chancellor</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The President of the People's Republic of Bangladesh shall be the Chancellor of the University and shall preside at the convocation of the University for award of academic and honorary degrees, and in his absence the Vice-Chancellor shall preside at such convocations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chancellor shall have such powers as may be conferred on him by this Act or the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every proposal for the conferment of an honorary degree shall be subject to the confirmation of the Chancellor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (4) The President may, if he thinks fit, direct that the powers of the Chancellor under this Act shall be exercised by such person as he may authorise in this behalf; and the powers exercised by the person so authorised shall be expressed to have been exercised in the name of the Chancellor.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Vice-Chancellor</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Vice-Chancellor shall be appointed by the Chancellor for a period of four years from a panel of three persons to be nominated by the Senate on such terms and conditions as may be determined by the Chancellor, and shall be eligible for re-appointment for a further period of four years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (2) Where any temporary vacancy in the office of the Vice-Chancellor occurs by reason of leave, illness, resignation or any other cause, the Chancellor shall make such arrangement for carrying on duties of the office of the Vice-Chancellor as he may think fit.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Vice-Chancellor</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Vice-Chancellor shall be a whole-time principal executive and academic officer of the University and shall be Chairman of the Senate, the Syndicate and the Academic Council. He shall be entitled to be present and to speak at any meeting of any Authority but, shall not be entitled to vote thereat unless he is a member of the Authority concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Vice-Chancellor shall convene meetings of the Senate, the Syndicate and the Academic Council and shall preside over them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding any provision contained in this Act or in any law for the time being in force, the Vice-Chancellor may, in any emergency which, in his opinion, requires immediate action, take such action as he deems necessary, and shall within seven days thereafter report his action to the officer or Authority who or which, in the ordinary course, would have dealt with the matter.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Vice-Chancellor shall, if he does not agree with the resolution of any Authority of the University, have the power to withhold implementation of the resolution and refer it back to the Authority concerned, with his opinion thereon, for reconsideration in its next regular meeting. If, in the process of reconsideration, the Authority concerned does not agree with the Vice-Chancellor, the decision of the Syndicate shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Vice-Chancellor shall give effect to the orders of the Syndicate regarding the appointment, dismissal and suspension of the officers and teachers of the University, and shall exercise general control over the members of the University, and shall be responsible for the discipline of the University in accordance with this Act, the Statutes and University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Vice-Chancellor shall have the power to appoint, on a purely temporary basis, ordinarily for a period of not more than six months, officers (excepting the Pro-Vice-Chancellor and the Treasurer), teachers and administrative and subordinate staff and report such action to the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Vice-Chancellor may, with the approval of the Syndicate, delegate such of his powers and functions as he may consider necessary to such officer of the University as he may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) The Vice-Chancellor shall exercise such other powers as may be prescribed by the Statutes, University Ordinances and Regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Pro-Vice-Chancellor</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 13. (1) The Chancellor may, if he deems fit so to do, appoint 5[ one or more Pro-Vice-Chancellors] on such terms and conditions and for such period as he may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Pro-Vice-Chancellor shall perform such duties as may be prescribed by the Statutes and University Ordinances.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Treasurer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Treasurer shall be appointed by the Chancellor upon such conditions and for such period, and shall receive such remuneration from the funds of the University, as the Chancellor may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any temporary vacancy in the office of the Treasurer occurs by reason of leave, illness or other cause, the Syndicate shall forthwith report the same to the Chancellor who shall make such arrangements for carrying on the office of the Treasurer as he may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Treasurer shall exercise general supervision over the funds of the University, and shall advise in regard to its financial policy.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Treasurer shall, subject to the control of the Syndicate, manage the property and investments of the University; and shall be responsible for the presentation of the annual budget estimates and statement of accounts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Subject to the powers of the Syndicate, it shall be responsibility of the Treasurer to see that all monies are expended on the purpose for which they are granted or allotted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) All contracts shall be signed by the Treasurer on behalf of the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Treasurer shall exercise such other powers as may be prescribed by the Statutes and the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of other officers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Officers of the University, the manner of whose appointment has not been provided elsewhere in this Act, shall be appointed by the Syndicate in such manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Registrar</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Registrar shall act as Secretary of the Senate, the Syndicate and the Academic Council. He shall maintain a register of Registered Graduates in accordance with the Statutes and shall exercise such other powers as may be prescribed by the Statutes and the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The duties and powers of other officers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The duties and powers of the other officers of the University shall be prescribed by the Statutes, the University Ordinances and Regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authorities of the University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The following shall be the Authorities of the University:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Senate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Syndicate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Faculties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the Committees of Courses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the Boards of Advanced Studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the Finance Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the Planning and Development Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Selection Boards; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         such other Authorities as may be declared by the Statutes to be Authorities of the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Senate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Senate shall consist of the following persons:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 7[ (b) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, all the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(bb) the Treasurer];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        five Government officials to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        five Members of Parliament to be nominated by the Speaker;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        five distinguished educationists to be nominated by the Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         five representatives of research bodies to be nominated by the Syndicate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        five Principals of colleges to be nominated by the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the Chairman of the Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education, Dacca;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         twenty-five representatives of Registered Graduates to be elected by such graduates from among themselves;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         thirty-three representatives of teachers of the University other than Deans to be elected in a special meeting of the teachers of the University; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        five representatives of the students to be nominated by the University Central Students Union.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members of the Senate, other than the student members, shall hold office for a period of three years and the student members shall hold office for a period of one year. The members will continue in office till their successors having been elected, nominated or appointed, enter upon the office:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Members of Parliament, the Government officials, the Principals of the Colleges, Registered Graduates, teachers of the University and representatives of research bodies shall hold office so long as they continue to be a Member of Parliament, Government official, Principal of a College, Registered Graduate, teacher of the University or associated with any research body:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the student members shall lose membership if they cease to be students of the University.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The election of members of the Senate shall be held in such manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Senate shall, on a date to be fixed by the Vice-Chancellor, meet at least once in a year at a meeting to be called the annual meeting of the Senate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Vice-Chancellor may, whenever he thinks fit, and shall, upon a requisition in writing signed by not less than thirty members of the Senate, convene a special meeting of the Senate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Senate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Senate shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        amend and ratify the Statutes on the proposals of the Syndicate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        consider and pass resolutions on the annual report, the annual accounts and the financial estimates presented by the Syndicate; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed upon it by this Act or the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Syndicate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22.
