(1) The Syndicate shall consist of the following persons, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (b) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, all the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Treasurer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        two Principals of Colleges to be nominated by the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        six teachers of the University to be elected by such teachers from among themselves;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         two representatives of the Senate to be nominated by the Senate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        two persons to be nominated by the Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        two Government officials, not below the rank of Secretary, to be nominated by the Ministry of Education, Cultural Affairs and Sports; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one distinguished citizen to be nominated by the Senate from outside its membership.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The elections of members of the Syndicate shall be held in such manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the teachers of the University to be elected under clause (e) of sub-section (1), one shall be elected from each of the following categories, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Deans;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        Provosts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       Professors;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       Associate Professors;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        Assistant Professors; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       Lecturers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The members of the Syndicate shall hold office for a term of two years, but shall continue in office till their successors having been elected or nominated enter upon the office:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Principals of Colleges, teachers of the University, representatives of the Senate and Government nominee shall hold office so long as they continue to be such Principals, teachers, members and officials.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers and duties of the Syndicate</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) The Syndicate shall be the Chief Executive Body of the University, and, subject to the provisions of this Act and the powers conferred on the Vice-Chancellor, the Syndicate, shall have the general management and superintendence over the affairs, concerns and properties of the University and shall see that the provisions of this Act, Statutes, University Ordinances and Regulations, for the time being in force, are observed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of powers to be exercised under sub-section (1) the Syndicate shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        acquire, hold, control and administer the property and funds of the University, and shall, from time to time, obtain advice from the Finance Committee on financial matters;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        determine the form of the common seal of the University, the Authority in whose custody it shall be kept and the manner in which it shall be used;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        regulate and determine, subject to the powers conferred by this Act on the Vice-Chancellor, all matters concerning the University in accordance with this Act, the Statutes and the University Ordinances:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no action shall be taken by the Syndicate in respect of the fees paid to examiners and emoluments of teachers without consulting the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        lay before the Commission annually a full statement of all the bequests received by it and the financial requirements of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        administer any funds placed at the disposal of the University for specific purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         appoint, save as otherwise provided by this Act or the Statutes, the officers, teachers, clerical and other staff of the University, and define their duties and conditions of service, and fill temporary vacancies in their posts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        make, amend or repeal the Statutes subject to the approval of the Senate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        frame the University Ordinances subject to the provisions of this Act and the Statutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         accept bequests, donations and transfer of any movable or immovable property on behalf of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         arrange for the holding of, and publish the results of, the University examinations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        institute Professorship, Associate Professorship, Assistant Professorship or Lecturership or other teaching posts in accordance with the Statutes and recommendation of the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         delegate, subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by regulations, its power to appoint clerical and other staff of the University to such person or Authority as it may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed on it by this Act or the Statutes; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        exercise all other powers of the University not otherwise provided for by this Act or the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Syndicate at least one-third of the total number of members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Academic Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. The Academic Council shall be the principal academic body of the University, and shall, subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes and the University Ordinances, have the control and general supervision over, and be responsible for maintenance of standards of, instruction, education and examination within the University, and shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposed upon it by the Statutes. It shall have the right to advise the Syndicate on all academic matters.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Academic Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Academic Council shall consist of the following persons:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ex-officio members:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (aa) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, all the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Deans of the Faculties;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Professors and the Heads of Departments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the Librarian of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nominated members:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        not more than ten members, to be nominated by the Chancellor, so as to make the Academic Council representative of the various educational interests; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Elected members:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         three Associate Professors other than Heads of Departments or Deans and three teachers below the rank of Associate Professor other than Heads of Departments to be elected by the teachers themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Members other than ex-officio members shall hold office for a period of two years and shall continue in office until their successors having been nominated or elected enter upon the office:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Lecturers or teachers, nominated or elected as such shall hold office so long as they continue to be such Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Lecturers or teachers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">The Faculties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) The University may include the Faculties of Arts and Humanities, Social Sciences, Mathematical and Physical Sciences, Biological Sciences, Earth and Environmental Sciences and may divide or combine existing Faculties and create new Faculties in the manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Each Faculty shall, subject to the control of the Academic Council, have charge of the teaching and the courses of studies and the research work in such subjects as may be assigned to such Faculty by the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The constitution and powers of the Faculties shall be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) There shall be a Dean of each Faculty, who shall, subject to the control and general supervision of the Vice-Chancellor, be responsible for the due observance of the Statutes, University Ordinances and Regulations relating to the Faculty. He shall receive, in respect of his duties as Dean, such additional remuneration as may be fixed by the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Dean of a Faculty shall be elected from among the Professors and Associate Professors by all teachers belonging to the Departments within the Faculty and shall hold Office for two academic years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) All academic matters shall go to the Academic Council through the Faculties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of the Head of Department</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. The Head of every teaching Department shall be called the Chairman who shall be appointed in such manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees of Courses</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. For each subject or group of subjects, there shall be a Committee of Courses which shall be responsible for preparation of Courses and syllabuses and such other work as may be assigned to it under the Statutes and University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Boards of Advanced Studies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. There shall be Boards of Advanced Studies, for organising post-graduate studies in the University, which shall be constituted in such manner as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Finance Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) The Finance Committee shall consist of the following persons:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (aa) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, the Pro-Vice-Chancellor to be nominated by the Chancellor;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Treasurer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        one person to be nominated by the Syndicate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        one Dean to be nominated by the Academic Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one teacher of the University to be elected by the teachers thereof from among themselves;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         one person to be nominated by the Senate; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        two experts in the field of finance to be nominated by the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Treasurer of the University shall be the Chairman of the Finance Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Comptroller of the University shall be the Secretary of the Finance Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Finance Committee shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        supervise the income and expenditure of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        advise the Syndicate on all matters relating to accounts, property and funds of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        perform such other functions as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Planning and Development Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. (1) The Planning and Development Committee shall consist of the following persons:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Vice-Chancellor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (aa) the Pro-Vice-Chancellor or, if there is more than one, the Pro-Vice-Chancellor to be nominated by the Chancellor;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Treasurer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        four Deans of the Faculties by rotation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        one architect, one engineer and one expert in the field of finance to be nominated by the Syndicate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 12[ Director (Planning and Development)] of the University shall be the Member-Secretary of the Planning and Development Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The functions of the Planning and Development Committee shall be such as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Selection Boards</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. (1) There shall be Selection Boards for recommending the appointment of Professors, Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Lecturers and other teachers of the University in various subjects.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The constitution and functions of the Selection Boards shall be such as may be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Other Authorities of the University</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. The constitution, powers and duties of such other Authorities as may be declared by the Statutes to be Authorities of the University shall be prescribed by the Statutes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution etc of Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. The constitution, powers and duties of the Discipline Board and of all other Boards of the University shall be prescribed by the University Ordinances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Statutes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the conferment of honorary degrees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the institution of Fellowships, Scholarships, Exhibitions and prizes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the designations, powers, duties and conditions of service of teachers and officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the constitution, powers and duties of the Authorities of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the setting up and maintenance of academic museums, schools, institutes and holding of exhibitions for the development of teaching and research and administration and management thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the institution and maintenance of Halls;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the mode of selection and appointment of Professors, Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Lecturers and other teachers of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the constitution of pension, group insurance, benevolent fund and provident fund for the benefit of officers, teachers, clerical staff and other employees of the University;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the maintenance of a register of Registered Graduates; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)                      </p></div></div>
474	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE JATIYA RAKKHI BAHINI (ABSORPTION IN THE ARMY) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE JATIYA RAKKHI BAHINI (ABSORPTION IN THE ARMY) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LII OF 1975).[9th October, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the absorption of the members of the Jatiya Rakkhi Bahini in the Bangladesh Army.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the absorption of the members of the Jatiya Rakkhi Bahini in the Bangladesh Army and for matters connected therewith or ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 20th August, 1975, and in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) The Ordinance may be called the Jatiya Rakkhi Bahini (Absorption in the Army) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 3rd day of September,1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Bahini” means the Jatiya Rakkhi Bahini constituted under the Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “commencement of this Ordinance” means the 3rd day of September, 1975;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “member of the Bahini” means a person appointed or enrolled in the Bahini under the Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Order” means the Jatiya Rakkhi Bahini Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 21 of 1972).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to override other laws, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Ordinance and any order made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in the Order or in any other law for the time being in force, or in any contract, agreement, document or other instrument.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Absorption of members of the Bahini in the Army</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. On the commencement of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all members of the Bahini, who are willing to serve in the Bangladesh Army and found suitable in all respects for such service, shall be appointed in the Bangladesh Army on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all rights and assets and all property, movable or immovable, cash and bank balances, funds, arms, ammunition, explosives, wireless sets, equipment, stores, vehicles, vessels, and work shops, and all rights and interests in or arising out of such property, of the Bahini shall be transferred to the Bangladesh Army, or to such other Defence Service or branch thereof, in such manner as the Government may, by order, specify;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all debts, obligations and liabilities incurred, all contracts entered into, all agreements made, and all matters and things engaged to be done, by, with or for the Bahini shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into, made or engaged to be done by, with or for the Bangladesh Army or such other Defence Service or branch thereof as the Government may, by order, specify;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all deeds, bonds, agreements, powers of attorney, documents and other instruments of whatever nature to which the Bahini is a party or which are in favour of the Bahini shall be enforceable and of effect by, against or in favour of the Bangladesh Army or such other Defence Service or branch thereof as the Government may, by order, specify as if in place of the Bahini the Bangladesh Army or the Defence Service or branch thereof specified in the order had been named therein;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all budget grants made and sums sanctioned for the Bahini shall be deemed to be budget grants made and sums sanctioned for the Bangladesh Army;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) all projects and schemes of the Bahini shall be deemed to be projects and schemes of the Bangladesh Army;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) all suits and other legal proceedings by or against the Bahini shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Bangladesh Army and may be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Abolition of Bahini Organisation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. As soon as may be after action under clauses (a) and (b) of section 4 has been taken and the accounts of the Bahini have been audited, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette appoint a date on which the Bahini Organisation shall stand abolished.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of the Order</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. On the abolition of the Bahini Organisation under section 5, the Order shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Responsibility of Director-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Director-General of the Bahini shall, for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of clauses (a) and (b) of section 4 and abolition of the Bahini Organisation, take such steps as he deems necessary or as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall make available to the Director-General such staff and fund as may be necessary for the discharge of his functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of difficulties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Government may, by order, do anything which appears to it to be necessary for the purpose of removing the difficulty, and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
475	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE JUTE COMPANIES (ACQUISITION OF SHARES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE JUTE COMPANIES (ACQUISITION OF SHARES) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXXVI OF 1975).[21st July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the acquisition of the shares in M/S Khan Brothers Limited, M/S Helal Jute Press Limited and M/S Rangpur Jute Press Limited.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient in the public interest to provide for the acquisition of the shares in M/S Khan Brothers Limited, M/S Helal Jute Press Limited and M/S Rangpur Jute Press Limited and for matters connected therewith or ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS Parliament is not in session and the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render immediate action necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (1) of Article 93 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Jute Companies (Acquisition of Shares) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in so far as it relates to M/S Helal Jute Press Limited and M/S Rangpur Jute Press Limited, on the 2nd day of January, 1972;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in so far as it relates to M/S Khan Brothers Limited, on the 31st day of August, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “commencement of this Ordinance” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in so far as it relates to M/S Helal Jute Press Limited and M/S Rangpur Jute Press Limited, the 2nd day of January, 1972;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in so far as it relates to M/S Khan Brothers Limited, the 31st day of August, 1972;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “jute company” means M/S Helal Jute Press Limited, M/S Rangpur Jute Press Limited, or M/S Khan Brothers Limited.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance to over-ride other laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Shares of jute companies to vest in Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. On the commencement of this Ordinance, the shares in every jute company, which have not already vested in the Government by or under any law for the time being in force, shall, by virtue of this section, stand vested in, and allotted to, the Government free of any trust, mortgage, charge, lien, interest or other encumbrance whatsoever, and the Government shall, as from such commencement, be the sole shareholder of such jute company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Powers of Government in respect of jute companies</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. Notwithstanding anything contained in any memorandum or articles of association of any jute company, or in any agreement, contract or other instrument whatsoever, the Government may, in respect of such jute company,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        take such measures and do such things as it deems necessary or expedient for the purpose of efficient management of the affairs and business of such jute company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        dissolve the Board of Directors of such jute company, or constitute a new Board of Directors, or remove a Director, or appoint a new Director;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        modify or amend the memorandum or articles of association of such jute company or any agreement, contract or other instrument entered into or executed by or on behalf of or with such jute company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provisions of certain law, etc not to have any effect</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Every provision in any law or in any memorandum or articles of association of any jute company providing for any consequence to follow, or requiring any act or thing to be done, or entitling any person to do any act or thing or to take any action whatsoever, as a result of a reduction in the number of the members of such jute company below a certain number, shall be of no effect in relation to such jute company.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Government to modify Act VII of 1913</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Government may, by rules, modify in their application to any jute company any of the provisions of the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913), or of any rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compensation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Government shall pay in respect of the shares vested in it under section 4 such compensation as may be determined by it:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such compensation shall not exceed the paid up value of such shares.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Declaration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. It is hereby declared that the provisions of this Ordinance are made to give effect to the fundamental principles of state policy set out in articles 10 and 13(a) in Part II of the Constitution of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Validation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any court, anything done, or purported to have been done, or any action taken, or purported to have been taken, in respect of any jute company under the Bangladesh Abandoned Property (Control, Management and Disposal) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 16 of 1972), or under Acting President's Order No. IM-35/71/13, dated the 26th December, 1971, or under the Bangladesh (Taking Over of Control and Management of Industrial and Commercial Concerns) Order, 1972 (A.P.O. No. I of 1972), shall be deemed to have been done or taken in respect thereof under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
476	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE MEMBERS OF PARLIAMENT (REMUNERATION AND ALLOWANCES) ORDER, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE MEMBERS OF PARLIAMENT (REMUNERATION AND ALLOWANCES) ORDER, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(P. O. NO. 28 OF 1973).[4th April, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the 1[ remuneration] and allowances of the Members of Parliament;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of Article 68 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Members of Parliament ( 2[ Remuneration] and Allowances) Order, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Committee” means a Standing Committee or a Select Committee of Parliament or any other committee set up by or under the authority of Parliament and includes a sub-committee set up by any such committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Member” means a Member of Parliament but does not include the Speaker or the Deputy Speaker or the Prime Minister or a Minister or a Minister of State or a Deputy Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Parliament” means the Parliament for Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “term of office” means the period beginning with the date on which a Member enters upon his office and ending with the date on which he ceases to be a Member;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “year” means a year commencing on the date of the first meeting of Parliament after a general election and ending on the expiry of three hundred sixty-five days therefrom.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Remuneration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. A Member shall be entitled to receive a 3[ remuneration] at the rate of 4[ twenty seven thousand and five hundred] taka per mensem 5[ free of income-tax] and to the privileges and amenities provided in this Order during the whole of his term of office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constituency allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 7[ 3A. A Member shall be entitled to receive a constituency allowance at the rate of 8[ seven thousand and five hundred] taka per mensem.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article, “Member” shall include the Prime Minister, the Speaker, the Ministers, the Leader of the Opposition, the Deputy Leader of the House, the Deputy Speaker, the Chief Whip, the Deputy Leader of the Opposition, Ministers of State, the Whips and Deputy Ministers who are Members of Parliament.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sumptuary allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3B. A Member shall be entitled to receive a sumptuary allowance at the rate of 9[ three thousand] taka per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tax and duty free 10[ car, jeep or microbus]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3C. 11[ (1)] A Member shall be entitled to import free of customs duty, 12[ value added tax], development surcharge and import permit fee during the whole of his term of office, one 13[ car, jeep or microbus] of such specification, and on such conditions, as the Government may specify in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article, “Member” shall include the Prime Minister, the Speaker, the Ministers, the Leader of the Opposition, the Deputy Leader of the House, the Deputy Speaker, the Chief Whip, the Deputy Leader of the Opposition, Ministers of State, the Whips and Deputy Ministers who are Members of Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ (2) A member shall be entitled to import another new car, jeep or microbus after expiration of a period of five years from the date of his last import at the same terms and conditions provided in sub-section (1).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transport allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 3CC. A Member shall be entitled to receive a transport allowance at the rate of forty thousand taka per mensem.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation. - In this Article, “transport allowance” includes fuel allowance, vehicle maintenance allowance and salary of the driver.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Office expenses allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 3D. A Member shall be entitled to receive office expenses allowance at the rate of 17[ nine thousand] taka per mensem for maintaining an office in his constituency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article, “Member” shall include the Prime Minister, the Speaker, the Ministers, the Leader of the Opposition, the Deputy Leader of the House, the Deputy Speaker, the Chief Whip, the Deputy Leader of the Opposition, Ministers of State, the Whips and Deputy Ministers who are Members of Parliament.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Laundry and miscellaneous expenses allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ 3E. A Member shall be entitled to receive per mensem-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a laundry allowance at the rate of one thousand taka; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a miscellaneous expenses allowance at the rate of four thousand taka for purchasing cookeries, linen, toiletries and other goods.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Journey performed for the purpose of attending a session</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. For every journey performed for the purpose of attending a session of Parliament or a meeting of a Committee or for attending to any other business connected with his duties as Member from his usual place of residence to the place where the session or the meeting is held or other business is transacted and for the return journey from such place to his usual place of residence, a Member shall be entitled to receive travelling allowance at the following rates, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where a journey is performed by rail, air, steamer or launch, an amount equal to one and one-half of the fare for the highest class by the shortest route;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        where a journey or any part thereof cannot be performed by rail, air, steamer or launch and is performed by road, a mileage allowance at the rate of 19[ ten taka per kilometre] by the shortest route;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) where a journey or any part thereof can be performed by rail, air, steamer or launch but is performed by road, a mileage allowance at the rate of 20[ ten taka per kilometre] not exceeding in the aggregate the travelling allowance which he would have been entitled to receive had he travelled by air, rail, steamer, or launch:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a Member who performs a journey between the place of duty and a place which is not his usual place of residence may draw travelling allowance either for the actual journey or for a journey between the place of duty and his usual place of residence whichever is less.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Period of residence on duty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) For each day during any period of residence on duty, a Member shall be entitled to receive a daily allowance at the rate of 21[ 22[ three hundred] taka] and a conveyance allowance at the rate of 23[ 24[ seventy five] taka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article, “period of residence on duty” means the period during which a Member, for the purpose of attending a session of Parliament or a meeting of a Committee or for attending to any other business connected with his duties as Member, resides at the place, including his usual place of residence, where the session or the meeting is held or other business is transacted and includes,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in the case of a session of Parliament, a period of such residence, not exceeding three days, immediately preceding the commencement of the session and the period of such residence, not exceeding three days, immediately following the end of the session; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in the case of a sitting of a Committee or transaction of any other business, the period of such residence, not exceeding two days, immediately preceding the commencement of the business of the Committee or of the other business and the period of such residence, not exceeding two days, immediately following the conclusion of the business of the Committee or of the other business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25[ (1A) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), a Member shall be entitled to receive a daily allowance at the rate of 26[ eight hundred] Taka and a conveyance allowance at the rate of 27[ two hundred] Taka for each day he attends the sitting of Parliament or the meeting of Committee or any other official duties in Parliament and the allowances prescribed under this clause shall only be admissible where the presence of Member is supported by record.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If a Member arrives in the forenoon at the place of duty or departs from such place in the afternoon, he shall be entitled to draw daily allowance and conveyance allowance at the full rates for the day of arrival or the day of departure, as the case may be, and if he arrives at such place in the afternoon or departs therefrom in the forenoon, the daily allowance and the conveyance allowance drawn shall be at half such rate:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that not more than one daily allowance and one conveyance allowance at the full rate shall be claimed in respect of any one day.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where the interval between the termination of one session of Parliament or, as the case may be, one sitting of a Committee and the commencement of another session or sitting at the same place does not exceed seven days and, during such interval, a Member,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) remains at such place, he shall be entitled to receive for each day of residence at such place a daily allowance and a conveyance allowance at the rate specified in clause (1);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) leaves such place for another place, he shall be entitled to receive travelling allowance under the provisions of Article 4 but such travelling allowance shall not exceed the total amount of daily allowance and conveyance allowance to which he would have been entitled had he not left the place.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28[ (4) Where the interval between one sitting of a session and the commencement of another sitting of a session exceeds seven days and, during such interval, a Member leaves his residence on duty to usual place of residence, he shall be entitled to receive traveling allowance under the provisions of Article 4.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Travel within the country</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29[ 6. (1) A member shall be entitled to travel within Bangladesh at any time, and to perform such travel,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a member shall be entitled to receive a sum of seventy five thousand taka per annum as travelling allowance ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if a member opts not to accept travelling allowance under paragraph (a), he shall be, in lieu thereof, provided with a non-transferable pass of such amount not exceeding seventy five thousand taka for a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where a person becomes a Member in the middle of a year, he shall be entitle to receive same proportion to seventy five thousand taka as the unexpired portion of the year bears to a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The provision of this Article shall not in any way affect the right of a Member to receive travel allowances determined under Article 4.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Insurance cover</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30[ 6A. A Member shall be provided with an insurance cover for 31[ ten lakh] taka at Government expense against death or permanent disablement caused by accident during his term of office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article, “permanent disablement” shall, unless otherwise provided in the insurance policy mean such disablement as permanently incapacitates a person for earning his livelihood.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discretionary grant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32[ 6B. (1) There shall be placed at the disposal of a Member as discretionary grant an amount not exceeding taka 33[ three lakh] per annum,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The expenditure from the discretionary grant shall be subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by rules made under Article 9.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Medical facilities for family members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. A Member and the members of his family shall be entitled to the same medical facilities as are admissible to a gazetted officer (Class I) of the Government and the members of the family of such officer under the Government Servants (Medical Attendance) Rules, 1963:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34[ Provided that, notwithstanding anything contained in the said Rules, a Member shall be entitled to a sum of 35[ seven hundred] taka per mensem as medical allowance, but shall not be entitled to reimbursement of any expenses incurred by him for his treatment or for the treatment of the members of his family.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Allowances shall be free of income-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36[ 7A. Any allowance received by a Member under this order shall be free of income-tax.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Telephone at residence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37[ 8. (1) A Member shall be entitled to have one telephone installed at his residence at Government expense where facilities for such installation are available.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Member shall be entitled to receive a sum of 38[ seven thousand and eight hundred] taka per mensem in respect of the rental of such telephone and the calls made therefrom.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8A 39[ Omitted]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8A. [Omitted by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 1993 (Act No. XI of 1993).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rule</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40[ 9. The Parliament Secretariat Commission may, by notification in the Official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In this Article “Parliament Secretariat Commission” means the Parliament Secretariat Commission constituted by the Parliament Secretariat Act, 1994 (Act No. 8 of 1994).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Members of the Constituent Assembly (Salaries and Allowances) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 24 of 1972), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “remuneration” was substituted for the word “salaries” by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXXV of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word “Remuneration” was substituted for the word “Salaries” by section 3 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXXV of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “remuneration” was substituted for the word “salary” by section 4 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXXV of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “twenty seven thousand and five hundred” were substituted for the words “fifteen thousand” by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2009).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “free of income-tax” were inserted by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1974 (Act No. XXII of 1974)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Article 3A and 3B were inserted by section 3 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. IV of 1987)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Article 3A was substituted by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXIII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words “seven thousand and five hundred” were substituted for the words “five thousand” by section 3 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The words “three thousand” were substituted for the words “two thousand” by section 4 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word “Remuneration” was substituted for the word “Salaries” by section 3 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXXV of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Existing provision number as sub-section (1) by section 5 (b) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The words “value added tax” were substituted for the words “sales tax” by section 5 (b) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The words “car, jeep or microbus” were substituted for the words “car or jeep” by section 5 (b) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 Sub-section (2) was added by section 5 (b) of The Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July,  2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 Article 3CC was inserted by section 6 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 Article 3D was inserted by section 5 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XVIII of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The words “nine thousand” were substituted for the words “six thousand” by section 7 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18 Article 3E was inserted by section 8 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20 The words “ten taka per kilometre” were substituted for the words “six taka per kilometre” by section 9 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21 The words “seventy-five taka” were substituted for the words “fifty takas” by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XXV of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22 The words “three hundred” were substituted for the words “two hundred” by section 10 (a) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23 The words “twenty-five taka” were substituted for the words “fifteen takas” by section 2 of the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 1980 (Act No. XXV of 1980)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24 The words “seventy five” were substituted for the words “fifty” by section 10 (a) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25 Clause (1A) was inserted by section 3 of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances)(Amendment) Act, 2000 (Act No. IV of 2000).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26 The words “eight hundred” were substituted for the words “four hundred” by section 10 (b) of the Members of Parliament (Remuneration and Allowances) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. XXI of 2010) (with effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27 The words “two hundred” were substituted for the words “one
