477	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE MEMBERS OF THE BANGLADESH PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION (TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SERVICE) ACT, 1974   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE MEMBERS OF THE </strong><strong>BANGLADESH</strong><strong> PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION (TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SERVICE) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXI OF 1974).[12th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to determine the terms and conditions of service of the members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission. 1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to determine the terms and conditions of service of the members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “chairman” means the chairman of 2[ the commission];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (b) “commission” means the Bangladesh Public Service Commission established under section 3 of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission Ordinance, 1977 (Ord. LVII of 1977);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “member” means a member of commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Salary of Chairman and members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 3. (1) Subject to sub-section (2), there shall be paid to the Chairman and to every other member a salary at the following rates, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (a) Chairman........................... Taka 23,750 per mensem;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Member............................. Taka 20,700 per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a person who is, or has been, in the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise is appointed as the Chairman or a Member, he shall be paid the salary specified in sub-section (1) or a salary which would have been admissible to him in the National Scale of Pay for the post last held by him had he continued in that post, whichever is higher;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (b) a person is, at the time of his appointment as the Chairman or a Member, a retired servant of the Government or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise, he shall be paid the salary specified in sub-section (1), and no pensionery benefit, if any, will be deducted from the salary which the Chairman or a Member is entitled to draw under sections 3 (1) and 3 (2); ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (c) a person appointed as the Chairman or a Member, retires from the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise during the term of his office as the Chairman or a Member, he shall with effect from the date of his retirement, be paid the salary specified in sub-section (1), and no pensionary benefit, if any, will be deducted from the salary which the Chairman or a Member is entitled to draw under sections 3(1) and 3(2).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Dearness Allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ 3A. There shall be paid to the Chairman and every other member, until the Government, otherwise directs by order in this behalf, dearness allowance at the rate of Taka 400 per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Residence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The chairman shall be entitled to a rent-free Government accommodation 9[ or a house allowance at the rate of 10[ 50 per cent] of his salary per mensem in lieu of such accommodation].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (2) A member shall be entitled to a rent-free Government accommodation or a house allowance at the rate of 12[ 50 per cent] of his salary per mensem in lieu of such accommodation.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (3) The Chairman and the members shall each be entitled to the re-imbursement of the actual charges of electricity, waterand gas in the residence for an amount not exceeding 14[ Taka 1,950] per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transport</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 5. (1) The chairman shall be entitled to a Government transport for official purposes free of charge or a conveyance allowance of Taka 1,000 per mensem in lieu of such transport:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the Government transport is also used otherwise than for official purposes, the chairman shall make payment to the Government for such use at the rate at which a Government servant pays for such use of official transport.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member shall be entitled to a Government transport for official purposes free of charge or a conveyance allowance of Taka 650 per mensem in lieu of such transport.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Telephone</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The chairman and the members shall each be entitled to have one telephone installed at his residence at Government expense and no charges on account of rental of the telephone and the calls made therefrom, except personal trunk-calls, shall be payable by the chairman or member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sumptuary allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16[ 6A. The chairman and the members shall each be entitled to a sumptuary allowance of 17[ Taka 600 and 325] respectively per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Domestic Aid Allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ 6AA. A Chairman shall be paid a domestic aid allowance of 19[ Taka 1000] per mensem.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income-tax on salary and allowances</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6B. Income-tax payable by the chairman or a member on account of salary and allowances received by him under this Act shall be deemed to have been paid by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Leave of chairman and members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A person who is, at the time of his appointment as chairman or member, in the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise shall, until he retires from that service, be entitled to such leave as would have been admissible to him had he not been so appointed, and, after his retirement from that service, be entitled to such leave as is admissible to a temporary Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person who is not, at the time of his appointment as chairman or member, in the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise shall be entitled to such leave as is admissible to a temporary Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Gratuity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ 8. A person who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is not, at the time of his appointment as chairman or member, in the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        at any time before his appointment as chairman or member retired from or ceased to be in any such service without any pension, gratuity or other retirement benefits being admissible to him,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be entitled to a gratuity which shall be equal to one month's pay for every completed year of his service as chairman or member and payable after he ceases to hold office.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provident fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) Where a person appointed as chairman or member is, at the time of his appointment, a subscriber to any contributory provident fund and continues to be such subscriber after his appointment, the Government shall contribute to such fund the amount which would have been required to be contributed by his employer had he not been so appointed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where a person is not, at the time of his appointment as chairman or member, in the service of the Republic or of a statutory body or nationalised enterprise, he shall be eligible to be a subscriber to a general provident fund on the same conditions as are applicable to a temporary Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Travelling allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The chairman or member travelling on duty shall be entitled to such travelling allowances as are admissible to a class I Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Medical facilities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The chairman or member shall be entitled to such medical benefits as are admissible to a class I Government servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Act, the words “Bangladesh Public Service Commission”, “The chairman” and “the chairman” were substituted for the words “public service commissions”, “A chairman” and “a chairman” by section 2 of the Members of the Public Service Commissions (Terms and Conditions of Service)(Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLVII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “the commission” were substituted for the words “a commission” by section 4 of the Members of the Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLVII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (b) was substituted by section 4 of the Members of the Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLVII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Section 3 was substituted by section 2 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Act, 2000 (Act No. V of 2000)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clauses (a) and (b) were substituted for the former clauses (a) and (b) by section 2 of the Members of the Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Act, 2006 (Act No. XIV of 2006) with effect from 1 January,  2005. By virtue of section 6 of the Member of the Public Service Commission (Terms and Condition of Service) (Amendment) Act, 2006(Act No. XIV of 2006), the Chairman and members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission shall be entitled to draw only 75% of their increased salary (along with their present monthly salary) during the period from 1 January, 2005 to 30 June, 2005</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Clause (b) was substituted by section 2 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act No. XLV of 2009) (with effect from 3rd April, 2008).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Clause (c) was substituted by section 2 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act No. XLV of 2009) (with effect from 3rd April, 2008).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Section 3A was inserted by section 2 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service)(Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XXII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The words and figure “or a house allowance at the rate of 40 per cent of his salary per mensem in lieu of such accommodation” were substituted for the words and figure “or a house allowance of Taka 2,500 per mensem in lieu thereof” by section 3 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service)(Amendment) Act, 1991 (Act No. XXX of 1991)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word and figure “50 per cent” were substituted for the word and figure “40 per cent” by section 3 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and Conditions of Service)(Amendment) Act, 2006 (Act No. XIV of 2006)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Sub-section (2) was substituted by section 3 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and 2006)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Sub-section (3) was inserted by section 2 of the Members of the Bangladesh Public Service Commission (Terms and 478	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE MINISTERS, MINISTERS OF STATE AND DEPUTY MINISTERS (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ACT, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE MINISTERS, MINISTERS OF STATE AND DEPUTY MINISTERS (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ACT, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. IV OF 1973).[15th June, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the remuneration and privileges of the Ministers, Ministers of State and Deputy Ministers of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the remuneration and privileges of the Ministers, Ministers of State and Deputy Ministers of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Ministers, Ministers of State and Deputy Ministers (Remuneration and Privileges) Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (1) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “family”, in relation to a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister, means his 1[ spouse] and children residing with and wholly dependent on him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “maintenance”, in relation to an official residence, includes the payment of local rates and taxes and the provision of telephone, electricity, gas and water;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “official residence” means the house reserved from time to time for the use of a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister and includes the staff quarters and other buildings appurtenant thereto, and the gardens of the residence.            2[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “home residence” means the own residence of a Minister other than the official residence.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Other words and expressions used in this Act and not defined shall have the meanings assigned to them in the Fundamental and Supplementary Rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Salary</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. 3[ (1) There shall be paid per mensem to a Minister a salary of Taka 4[ 53,100], a Minister of State Taka 5[ 47,800] and a Deputy Minister Taka 6[ 45,150].]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tax free</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The salary of a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall not be liable to any tax.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Allowance on taking up and laying down office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be entitled to receive travelling expenses to the extent mentioned below for the journey from his ordinary place of residence to the seat of the Government on taking up office and from the seat of the Government to his ordinary place of residence on laying down office-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the actual travelling expenses for himself and his family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the cost of transporting household effects, not exceeding 7[ 4,500 kilogram], by goods train, steamer or other craft, excluding aircraft, and his personal car, if any.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cost of transporting personal servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Minister 8[ or a Minister of State] shall, in addition to the travelling expenses mentioned in sub-section (1), be entitled to the cost of transporting personal servants, not exceeding two, by the lowest class of accommodation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No travelling expense shall be admissible under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) if the journey or transportation is not performed or effected within six months of the date of taking up or laying down the office, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sumptuary allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ 5. There shall be paid per mensem a sumptuary allowance of Taka 10[ 6,000] to a Minister, Taka 11[ 4,000] to a Minister of State and Taka 12[ 3,000] to a Deputy Minister.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transport</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ 6. A Minister, Minister of State or a Deputy Minister shall be entitled to use of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        an official car maintained at Government expense; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        an additional Jeep for essential official business, particularly for travelling on official tour outside Dhaka to be provided by the attached Department/ Corporation/ Directorate of the Ministries/ Divisions concerned. In case the directorates or agencies cannot provide the transport, Finance Ministry will allocate necessary fund for procurement of the transport. The expenditure thereupon shall be subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Official residence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be entitled, without payment of rent, to the use of an official residence and 14[ no charge shall fall on him in respect of its maintenance.]         15[</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Furnished residence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An official residence shall be furnished by the Government at a cost-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        not exceeding Taka 16[ 5,00,000] in the case of a Minister; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        not exceeding Taka 17[ 4,00,000] in the case of a Minister of State or Deputy Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">and the items of furniture and other materials with which such residence may be furnished shall be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Actual expenditure</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18[ (3) If, at the time of entering upon office, an official residence is not available, a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall, until such residence is provided by the Government, be entitled to receive-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) as house rent an amount of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) Taka 45,000 per mensem, in the case of a Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) Taka 40,000 per mensem, in the case of a Minister of State or Deputy Minister; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) every year for maintenance of such house, an amount equivalent to three months house rent admissible to him under this section; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all costs for supply of electricity, gas, water, telephone and the like at such residence.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19[ (4) Where a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister chooses to reside in his own house or in any house other than official residence, at such house all costs for supply of electricity, gas, water, telephone and the like shall be borne by the Government and he shall be entitled to receive-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        as house rent an amount of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Taka 20[ 25,000] per mensem, in the case of a Minister; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        Taka 21[ 20,000] per mensem, in the case of a Minister of State or a Deputy Minister; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        every year for maintenance of such house an amount equivalent to three months' house rent admissible to him under this section.]      22[</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Guard shed</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ (4A) Where a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister chooses to reside in his own house, and such house has no guard shed for accommodating house guard, the Government may construct a temporary guard shed in that house at an expenditure not exceeding Taka 24[ 40,000]; and the guard shed so constructed shall be dismantled and removed when the Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister ceases to hold office.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Residence after laying down office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be entitled to reside in his official residence or in the residence hired by him for a period of one month immediately after laying down his office and no charge in respect thereof shall fall on him during that period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Journeys within Bangladesh</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Subject to the provisions made hereinafter, a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister travelling on official duty shall be treated as a very important person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When travelling by rail-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to requisition at the cost of the Government a reserved railway saloon, if available, or a two-berthed or four-berthed first class compartment including an air-conditioned compartment, if available on the train;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him up to two personal attendants by the lowest class of accommodation when travelling by a two-berthed or four-berthed railway compartment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 25[ 112 kilogram] when travelling by a railway compartment or up to 26[ 224 kilogram] when travelling by a requisitioned railway saloon; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       to take with him, without payment of any fare, the members of his family, not exceeding four, when travelling in a requisitioned railway compartment or a saloon; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27[ (aa) a Minister of State shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to requisition at the cost of the Government a reserved railway saloon, if available, or a two-berthed or four-berthed first class compartment including an air-conditioned compartment, if available on the train;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him one personal attendant by the lowest class of accommodation on the train; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 28[ 112 kilogram]; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)         29[ * * *] a Deputy Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to the highest class of accommodation on the train;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him one personal attendant by the lowest class of accommodation on the train; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 30[ 112 kilogram].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When travelling by steamer-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to the actual fare paid for himself and one incidental fare (without diet) of the highest class of accommodation in addition to the actual fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him four members of his family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to take with him up to two personal attendants by the lowest class of accommodation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 31[ 112 kilogram]; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32[ (aa) a Minister of State shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to draw the actual fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him four members of his family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to take with him one personal attendant by the lowest class of accommodation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 33[ 112 kilogram]; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)         a 34[ * * *] Deputy Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to draw the actual fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to take with him one personal attendant by the lowest class of accommodation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to the carriage of personal luggage up to 35[ 112 kilogram].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister may, if the public interest so demands, travel by air, and when so travelling-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to the actual air fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to the cost of transporting personal luggage up to 36[ 45.00 kilogram] inclusive of the free allowance given by the air company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       to requisition at the cost of the Government, if he considers it necessary in the public interest, an aeroplane, or a helicopter, belonging to the Government, subject to availability, in accordance with the rules 37[ made by the Government or, if such aeroplane or a helicopter is not available, to hire at the cost of the Government an aeroplane or a helicopter belonging to any other body or authority, the manner of use of which shall be determined by the Government].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       to take with him one member of his family when travelling by a commercial aeroplane or such number of members of his family as may be accommodated in the aeroplane when travelling by a requisitioned aeroplane;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        either or take with him at Government cost by air one personal attendant or peon or to the cost of transporting up to two personal attendants by the lowest class of accommodation and of transporting personal luggage up to 38[ 112 kilogram] by rail or steamer; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">39[ (aa) a Minister of State shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to the actual air fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to the cost of transporting personal luggage up to 40[ 34 kilogram] inclusive of the free allowance given by the air company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">41[ (iii) to send indent for, if he considers it necessary in the public interest, an aeroplane or a helicopter, belonging to the Government subject to availability, in accordance with the rules made by the Government or, if such aeroplane or helicopter is not available, to hire at the cost of the Government an aeroplane or a helicopter belonging to any other body or authority or organisation, the manner of use of which shall be determined by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       to take with him at Government cost by air one personal attendant or peon; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a 42[ * * *] Deputy Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to the actual air fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        to the cost of transporting personal luggage up to [34.00 kilogram] inclusive of the free allowance given by the air company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">43[ (iii) to send indent for, if he considers it necessary in the public interest, an aeroplane or a helicopter, belonging to the Government subject to availability, in accordance with the rules made by the Government or, if such aeroplane or helicopter is not available, to hire at the cost of the Government an aeroplane or a helicopter belonging to any other body or authority or organisation, the manner of use of which shall be determined by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In respect of a journey performed by road beyond a radius of 44[ 8.00 kilometer] from his headquarters, a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be entitled to the actual cost of transporting-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        not more than two personal attendants, in the case of a Minister, and one personal attendant, in the case of a Minister of State or Deputy Minister, provided the attendant travelled by a conveyance other than that by which the Minister or the Minister of State or the Deputy Minister travelled; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        up to a maximum of 45[ 112 kilogram] of personal luggage, provided the journey is performed to a place of halt in respect of which daily allowance is admissible.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Insurance cover for air journey</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. For journeys by air a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be provided with insurance cover for Taka 46[ 5,00,000] on annual basis at Government expense.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Daily allowance during halt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) A Minister 47[ or Minister of State], while on tour, shall be entitled to a daily allowance at the rate of 48[ Taka 750] for each day of halt or a part of a day of absence from his headquarters, and such allowance shall be admissible at full rate for the first ten days of each continuous halt, at three-fourths of the full rate for the next twenty days and at half of the full rate thereafter.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">49[ (2) A Deputy Minister, while on tour, shall be entitled to a daily allowance at the rate of 50[ Taka 600] for each day of halt or a part of a day of absence from the headquarters, and such allowance shall be admissible at full rate for the first ten days of each continuous halt, at three-fourths of the full rate for the next twenty days and at half of the full rate thereafter.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Halt on tour</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A halt on tour shall be treated as continuous halt unless terminated by an absence at a distance from the halting place exceeding 51[ 8.00 kilometer] for a period of not less than seven nights.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) While on tour, a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall not pay any rent, rate, electricity charge, water charge or conservancy charge for the Circuit House or any other Government accommodation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Controlling Officer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister shall be his own Controlling Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Travelling allowance for journeys abroad</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister travelling on official business outside Bangladesh shall be entitled to such allowances as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Medical facilities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">52[ 13.(1) A Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister and his family shall be entitled to such medical facilities as may be prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Until rules are made under sub-section (1), Medical Attendance Rules, 1950 shall be applicable to a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister and his family.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Personal Staff</p><p style="text-align: justify;">53[ 14. (1) A Minister or a Minister of State shall be entitled to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        one Private Secretary, preferably of the rank of Deputy Secretary to the Government to be appointed at the choice of the Minister or the Minister of State, as the case may be, from amongst Class I Government Servants:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the status of a Private Secretary shall be determined by the 54[ Ministry of Establishment];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        one Assistant Private Secretary, preferably of the rank of 55[ Assistant Secretary or Seinor Assistant Secretary], to be appointed at the choice of the Minister or the Minister of State as the case may be, from amongst the Section Officers or from outside:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the status of the Assistant Private Secretary shall, when appointed from outside, be determined by the 56[ Ministry of Establishment]:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that a person appointed as Assistant Private Secretary from outside shall hold his post during the pleasure of the Minister or the Minister of State as the case may be and so long as the Minister or the Minister of State holds his office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">57[ (c) two Personal Officers of grade 10 of the National Pay Scale or Personal Assistants of grade 14 of the National Pay Scale to be appointed from outside at the choice of the Minister or the Minister of State and such a person shall hold his post during the pleasure of the Minister or the Minister of State, as the case may be, and so long as the Minister or the Minister of State holds his office;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        one Jamadar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one orderly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">58[ (f)  two 59[ MLSS] to be appointed at the choice of the Minister or the Minister of State, as the case may be, from outside at a consolidated pay to be fixed by the Government from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        one cook to be appointed at the choice of the Minister or the Minister of State, as the case may be, from outside at a consolidated pay to be fixed by the Government from time to time:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a person appointed as peon or cook shall hold his post during the pleasure of the Minister or the Minister of State, as the case may be, and so long as the Minister or the Minister of State holds his office.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) a Deputy Minister shall be entitled to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        one Private Secretary of the rank not above that of a 60[ Ministry of Establishment], to be appointed at the choice of the Deputy Minister from amongst the 61[ Assistant Secretary or Seinor Assistant Secretary] or from outside:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, the rank of the Private Secretary appointed from outside shall be determined by the Establishment Division:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that a person appointed as Private Secretary from outside shall hold his post during the pleasure of the Deputy Minister and so long as the Deputy Minister holds his office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        one personal assistant;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        one Jamadar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        one orderly; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">62[ (e)  one 63[ MLSS] to be appointed at the choice of the Deputy Minister from outside at a consolidated pay to be fixed by the Government from time to time:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a person appointed as peon shall hold his post during the pleasure of the Deputy Minister and so long as the Deputy Minister holds his office.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Telephone at home residence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. A Minister shall be entitled to have one telephone installed at his home residence at Government expense where facilities for such installation are available and no charge shall fall on him in respect thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Telephone at office and official residence, mobile phone, etc facilities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">64[ 15A. A Minister, Minister of State and Deputy Minister shall be entitled to have telephone, internet or Information Communication Technology (ICT) at office &amp; official residence and mobile phone facilities as provided in the Integrated Government Telephone Policies.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discretionary Grant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) There shall be placed at the disposal of a Minister, Minister of State or Deputy Minister as discretionary grant an amount-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        not exceeding 65[ Taka 4,00,000] per annum, in the case of a Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        not exceeding 66[ Taka 3,00,000] per annum, in the case of a Minister of State; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        not exceeding 67[ Taka 3,00,000] per annum, in the case of a Deputy Minister.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The expenditure from the discretionary grant shall be subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to issue order</p><p style="text-align: justify;">68[ 16A. The Government may, from time to time, by the notification in the official Gazette, issue orders for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16B. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeals</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Ministers (Remuneration and Privileges) Rules, 1972, the Ministers of State (Remuneration and Privileges) Rules, 1972, the Ministers (Remuneration and Privileges) Ordinance, 1973 (III of 1973), the Ministers of State (Remuneration and Privileges) Ordinance, 1973 (V of 1973) and the Deputy Ministers' (Remuneration and Privileges) Ordinance, 1973 (IV of 1973), are hereby repealed.</p><p
