479	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">  THE MUSLIM MARRIAGES AND DIVORCES (REGISTRATION) ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE MUSLIM MARRIAGES AND DIVORCES (REGISTRATION) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. LII OF 1974).[24th July, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to Registration of Muslim marriages and divorces.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to registration of Muslim marriages and divorces;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and application </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Muslim Marriages and Divorces (Registration) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It applies to all Muslim citizens of Bangladesh wherever they may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Inspector-General of Registration” and “Registrar” respectively mean the officers so designated and appointed under the Registration Act, 1908 (XVI of 1908);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Registration of marriages</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Notwithstanding anything contained in any law, custom or usage, every marriage solemnized under Muslim law shall be registered in accordance with the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nikah Registrars</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. For the purpose of registration of marriages under this Act, the Government shall grant licences to such number of persons, to be called Nikah Registrars, as it may deem necessary for such areas as it may specify:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that not more than one Nikah Registrar shall be licensed for any one area 1[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the Government may, whenever it deems fit so to do, extend, curtail or otherwise alter the limits of any area for which a Nikah Registrar has been licensed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction under this Act</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 5A. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act No. V of 1898), an offence under this Act shall be triable by a Magistrate of the first class.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Solemnization of a marriage to be reported and registered</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 5. (1) Where a marriage is solemnized by the Nikah Registrar himself, he shall register the marriage at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where a marriage is solemnized by a person other than the Nikah Registrar, the bridegroom of the marriage shall report it to the concerned Nikah Registrar within thirty days from the date of such solemnization.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where solemnization of a marriage is reported to a Nikah Registrar under sub-section (2), he shall register the marriage at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A person who contravenes any provision of this section commits an offence and he shall be liable to be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years or with fine which may extend to three thousand taka, or with both.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Registration of divorces</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) A Nikah Registrar may register a divorce effected under Muslim Law within his jurisdiction on application being made to him for such registration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application for registration of a divorce shall be made orally by the person or persons who has or have effected the divorce:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the woman be a parda-nashin, such application may be made by her duly authorised vakil.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Nikah Registrar shall not register a divorce of the kind known as Talaq-i-tafweez except on the production of a document registered under the Registration Act, 1908 (XVI of 1908), by which the husband delegated the power of divorce to the wife or of an attested copy of an entry in the register of marriages showing that such delegation has been made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where the Nikah Registrar refuses to register a divorce, the person or persons who applied for such registration may, within thirty days of such refusal, prefer an appeal to the Registrar and the order passed by the Registrar on such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Manner of registration</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Nikah Registrar shall register a marriage or divorce in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Registers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Every Nikah Registrar shall maintain separate registers of marriages and divorces in such forms as may be prescribed and all entries in each such register shall be numbered in a consecutive series, a fresh series being commenced at the beginning of each year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Copies of entry to be given to parties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. On completion of the registration of any marriage or divorce, the Nikah Registrar shall deliver to the parties concerned an attested copy of the entry in the register, and for such copy no charge shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Superintendence and control</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) Every Nikah Registrar shall perform the duties of his office under the superintendence and control of the Registrar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Inspector-General of Registration shall exercise a general superintendence over offices of all Nikah Registrars.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Revocation or suspension of a license</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. If the Government is of the opinion that a Nikah Registrar is guilty of any misconduct in the discharge of his duties or has become unfit or physically incapable to discharge his duties, it may, by order in writing, revoke his licence, or suspend his licence for such period, not exceeding two years, as may be specified in the order :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such order shall be made unless the Nikah Registrar has been given a reasonable opportunity of showing cause why that order should not be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Custody of registers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Every Nikah Registrar shall keep safely each register maintained by him under section 8 until the same is filled, and shall then or earlier if he leaves the district or ceases to hold a licence, make over the same to the Registrar for safe custody.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inspection of registers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Any person may, on payment of the prescribed fee, if any, inspect at the office of the Nikah Registrar or of the Registrar any register kept in such office or obtain a copy of any entry therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry into effect the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) qualifications to be required from persons to whom licences under section 4 may be granted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) fees payable to a Nikah Registrar for registration of a marriage or divorce;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any other matter for which rules are required to be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. In the Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in section 3, in sub-section (1), the comma and words “, and the registration of Muslim marriages shall take place only in accordance with those provisions” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        section 5 shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in section 6, in sub-section (1), for the words “under this Ordinance” the words, comma, figures and brackets “under the Muslim Marriages and Divorces (Registration) Act, 1974 (LII of 1974)” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Muslim Divorces Registration Act, 1876 (Ben. Act I of 1876), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provision relating to existing Nikah Registrars</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. All Nikah Registrars licensed under the Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961), before the commencement of this Act, shall be deemed to have been licensed as Nikah Registrars under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The colon (:) was substituted for the full stop (.) and the proviso was inserted by section 2 of the Muslim Marriages and Divorces (Registration) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XLIX of 1982)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 5A was inserted by section 3 of the Muslim Marriages and Divorces (Registration) (Amendment) Act, 2005 (Act No. IX of 2005)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Section 5 was substituted by section 2 of the Muslim Marriages and Divorces (Registration) (Amendment) Act, 2005 (Act No. IX of 2005)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
480	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE NATIONAL BOARD OF REVENUE ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE NATIONAL BOARD OF REVENUE ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 76 OF 1972).[30th June, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of a National Board of Revenue in Bangladesh and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December, 1971.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means National Board of Revenue constituted under the provision of this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Government” means Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Order, the Government shall constitute a Board to be called the National Board of Revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (2) The Board shall consist of a Chairman and such number of members as may be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government shall appoint a Secretary to the Government to be the Chairman of the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Board shall subject to the control of the Government exercise such powers and perform such duties as may be entrusted to it by the Government or by or under any law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Without prejudice to the provision of clause (4), the Board shall exercise all the powers and perform all the duties which, immediately before the commencement of this Order, were being performed by the Central Board of Revenue constituted under the Central Board of Revenue Act, 1924 (Act IV of 1924), by any Government of by or under any law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Government may make rules for the purpose of regulating the transaction of business by the Board, and every order made or act done in accordance with such rules shall be deemed to be the order or act, as the case may be, of the National Board of Revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any rules under clause (1) may be made so as to be retrospective from any date not earlier than the commencement of this Order and such rules may also validate any acts done or orders made by, or any proceedings of the National Board of Revenue or its Chairman or any of its Members or Officers before the making of such rules which, if done, made or taken after the commencement of those rules, would not be inconsistent therewith.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act, order or proceeding validated under clause (2) shall be called in question merely on the ground that such act, order or proceeding was not valid at the time when it was done, made or taken.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Central Board of Revenue Act, 1924 (Act No. IV of 1924) is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Bangladesh (Adaptation of Central Board of Revenue Act) Order, 1972 (Acting President's Order No. 4 of 1972) is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Notwithstanding the repeal of the Central Board of Revenue Act, 1924 (Act No. IV of 1924) hereinafter referred to as the said Act,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any rule, regulation, order or appointment made by any Government under the said Act before the commencement of this Order so far they apply to Bangladesh shall be deemed to have been made by the Government and shall continue in force as if made under the provision of this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any regulation, bye law, order or appointment made, any notification issued, any notice given, anything done or any action taken by the Central Board of Revenue constituted under the said Act, before the commencement of this Order in so far as they apply to Bangladesh shall be deemed to have been made, issued, given, done or taken, as the case may be, by the National Board of Revenue and shall continue in force until altered, amended or rescinded;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all proceedings which, immediately before the commencement of this Order, were pending in the Central Board of Revenue constituted under the said Act in so far as they apply to Bangladesh shall be deemed to be proceedings pending before the National Board of Revenue and shall be continued, heard and determined by, the National Board of Revenue as if they had been proceedings in the National Board of Revenue; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        any order or decision made or given by the Central Board of Revenue before the commencement of this Order in so far as they apply to Bangladesh shall be enforceable and shall have effect as if it were an order or decision made or given by the National Board of Revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clauses (2) and (3) were substituted by Section 2 of National Board of Revenue (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. XII of 2009)(with effect from 21st April, 1979).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source :Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
481	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE NATIONAL SPORTS COUNCIL ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE NATIONAL SPORTS COUNCIL ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. LVII OF 1974).[30th July, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the constitution of a Council for the development and regulation of sports and co-ordination of sports activities in Bangladesh. 1 2</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of a Council for the development and regulation of sports and co-ordination of sports activities in Bangladesh, and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the 3[ National Sports Council] Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (a) ‘Council' means the National Sports Council constituted under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        ‘Chairman', ‘ 5[ Secretary]' and ‘Treasurer' mean respectively the Chairman, 6[ Secretary] and Treasurer of the Council;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Executive Committee” means the Executive Committee of the Council constituted under section 11;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “national sports organisation” means an organisation constituted on a national basis for controlling sports and recognised as such by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under the Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “sports” means a game for recreation involving bodily exercise and includes such other games as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be sports for the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution and incorporation of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Act, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, constitute, in accordance with the provisions of this Act, a Council to be called the 7[ National Sports Council] for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, among others, to acquire, hold, manage and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ 4. (1) The Council shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        one representative from the Ministry of 10[ Cultural Affairs and Sports] to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Presidents of the organisations specified in entries 1 to 22 in Part I of the Schedule, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one representative from each of the District Sports Associations referred to in entry 23 of Part I of the Schedule to be nominated by the respective Association;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         President of the Olympic Association, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        President of the Bangladesh Mahila Krira Unnayan-O- Niyantran Sangstha, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        one representative from each of the organisations specified in Part III of the Schedule to be nominated by the President of that organisation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one representative from each of the organisations specified in Part IV of the Schedule to be nominated by that organisation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) two distinguished sportsmen to be nominated by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), a member of the Council other than an ex-officio member, shall hold office for a period of four years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A person who is a member of the Council by virtue of nomination shall be liable to be recalled by the person or authority nominating him to be such member and, upon such recall, shall cease to be a member of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Minister, and, if there be no Minister, the Member of the President's Council of Advisors, in-charge of the Ministry of 11[ Cultural Affairs and Sports] or any other person to be nominated by the President shall be the Chairman of the Council and of the Executive Committee.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. [Vice-Chairman.- Omitted by section 7 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (XXXV of 1976).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Secretary</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ 13[ 7. (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Council who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Secretary shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as the Council or the Executive Committee may assign to him from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Treasurer</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. There shall be a Treasurer of the Council who shall be nominated by the Government from amongst the members of the Council and shall perform such functions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. [Office Secretary.- Omitted by section 6 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (LIII of 1978).]]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The functions of the Council shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the development and regulation of sports and co-ordination of sports activities in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the grant of recognition to the national sports organisations and the affiliation of other sports organisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the promotion and development of standards of national fitness as well as standards of competition comparable to international standards in sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the institution and execution of training and coaching schemes for international sports events;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the arrangement for participation of sports teams in sports events abroad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         making of grants to sports organisations for sports activities and also providing for such facilities as construction of stadia, swimming pools and gymnasia;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the maintenance and construction of such sports facilities as stadia, gymnasia, swimming pools, play grounds, training and coaching centres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to provide for relief and assistance to needy and distinguished sportsmen after their retirement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the adoption of measures to inculcate and ensure discipline in all sports organisations and among all sportsmen;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         the publication of books, magazine, brochure and other literature on sports and sportsmen; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        doing of such other acts as are necessary for and conducive to carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Executive Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ 11. (1) There shall be an Executive Committee of the Council which shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Chairman, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a Vice-Chairman to be nominated by the Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Treasurer, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        one representative from the Ministry of 16[ Cultural Affairs and Sports] to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         one representative from each of the organisations specified in entries 1 to 10 in Part I of the Schedule to be nominated by the President of that organisation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        one representative from the Army Sports Council or the Inter-Services Sports Council to be nominated by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        one representative from the Inter-University Sports Council to be nominated by its President;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         two distinguished persons in the field of sports to be nominated by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman 17[ and Secretary] of the Council shall respectively be the Chairman 18[ and Secretary] of the Executive Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (4) a member of the Executive Committee, other than an ex-officio member, shall hold office for a period of four years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A person who is a member of the Executive Committee by virtue of nomination shall be liable to be recalled by the person or authority nominating him to be such member and, upon such recall, shall cease to be a member of the Executive Committee.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Executive Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The administration of the Council shall vest in the Executive Committee which shall deal with any matter within the competence of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, the functions of the Executive Committee shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to regulate the expenditure of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to appoint, with prior approval of the Government, officers and other employees of the Council on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to establish coaching centres and encourage proper training of coaches, referees and sportsmen at all levels of sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to allocate funds, grants and subsidies to the national sports organisations and other sports organisations and to call for their audited accounts to probe into;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to approve the appointment of officials to accompany any sports team going abroad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to recognise national sports organisations and to issue such directives as may be deemed necessary in the interest of promotion of sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to consider and approve the affiliation of a national sports organisation to international sports association, federations and the like; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to execute all decisions of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Council and the Executive Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The meetings of the Council and the Executive Committee shall be held at such times and at such places as may be prescribed by rules:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until rules are made in this behalf such meetings shall be convened by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Twenty-one members, in the case of a meeting of the Council, and seven members, in the case of a meeting of the Executive Committee, shall constitute a quorum.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A decision at a meeting of the Council and of the Executive Committee shall be taken by a majority of votes of the members present and voting, but the person presiding shall not vote except when there is an equality of votes, in which case he shall exercise a casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19[ (4) The Chairman shall preside over the meetings of the Council and, in his absence, the members of the Council present shall elect a Chairman from amongst them to preside over that meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4A) The Chairman, or in his absence, the Vice-Chairman shall preside over the meetings of the Executive Committee, and in the absence of both of them, the members of the Executive Committee present shall elect a Chairman from amongst them to preside over that meeting.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No proceeding or decision of the Council or the Executive Committee shall be invalid by reason of the existence of any vacancy or defect in the constitution of the Council or the Executive Committee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Misconduct of a member of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Where, upon the report of the Executive Committee that a member of the Council is guilty of such misconduct as renders him unfit to continue as such member, the Council, after giving the member an opportunity of being heard, passes a resolution declaring that the report is correct, the person to whom the resolution relates shall cease to be a member of the Council on the date such resolution is passed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such report shall be made by the Executive Committee without giving the member concerned an opportunity of showing cause against such report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) There shall be a fund to be called the 20[ National Sports Council Fund] to which shall be credited all receipts of the Council including:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        membership fees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        donations in cash or kind;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        sale proceeds from tickets, or any fee or other payment realised, for entry into any sports event arranged by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 21[ National Sports Council Fund] shall be applied to meet all such expenditure, including payment of salaries of the officers and employees of the Council, as is necessary to carry out the purposes of the Act, and shall be administered in such manner as may be prescribed by rules and, until such rules are made, in such manner as the Executive Committee, with the approval of the Chairman, direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual Statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Council shall submit to the Government, in such form before such day in each financial year as the Government may direct, a statement in triplicate to be called the annual budget statement for the next succeeding financial year</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">showing the estimated expenditure and sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) After examination of the statement submitted to it under sub-section (1), the Government shall return the statement, with or without modification, indicating the amount which the Council may expect from the Government as grants during the financial year to which the statement relates; and the Council shall accordingly modify the budget.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Council shall maintain proper accounts, prepare annual statement of accounts and present the accounts for audit, in such form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Council shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh or any officer authorised by him every year in such manner as the Comptroller and Auditor-General may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Reports and returns</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Council shall furnish to the Government such reports, returns and statements as the Government may, from time to time, require.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of accounts audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General together with an annual report on the condition of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Copies of audited account and annual report received by the Government shall be published in the official Gazette and laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to issue directions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Government may, from time to time issue directions to the Council to take such measures as it may consider necessary for the efficient management of the affairs of the Council and the Council shall comply with such directions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of the Government with regard to certain organisations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22[ 20. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, or in any agreement, contract, memorandum or articles of association or any other legal instrument, an organisation specified in any of the entries 1 to 22 in Part I of the Schedule shall have a President as its head 23[ who shall be elected according to prescribed rules or, as the case may be, nominated by the Government] and any provision to the contrary in the constitution or the memorandum or articles of association of such organisation shall stand modified and have effect accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of the Council to dissolve the executive committees of certain organisations, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20A. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, or in any agreement, contract, memorandum or articles of association or any other legal instrument, the Council shall have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to frame model constitution for all or any of the organisations affiliated to it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to dissolve the executive committee, by whatever name called, of an organisation affiliated to it, if in its opinion, the executive committee does not act properly or acts in a manner prejudicial to the interest of the organisation and to appoint an ad-hoc executive committee in its place;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to dissolve all such executive committees, by whatever name called, of the organisations specified in entries 1 to 22 in Part I of the Schedule as were constituted prior to a date to be specified in this behalf by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to set up a Divisional Sports Association at the Headquarters of each Division.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer of assets, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. Upon the constitution of the Council:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all property, movable and immovable 24[ * * * ] and all rights, liabilities and obligations of the Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">appointed under Government resolution No. SVI/67-Edn. dated the 7th February, 1972 shall be those of the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all employees of that Committee 25[ * * *] shall be deemed to be the employees of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Council may frame rules to carry out the purpose of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Sports (Development and Control) Ordinance, 1962 (XVI of 1962), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Act the word “Council” was substituted for the word “Board” by section 2 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Act, 1991 (Act No. VII of 1991)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Throughout this Act the word “Control” was omitted by section 2 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Act, 1991 (Act No. VII of 1991)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “National Sports Control Board” were substituted for the words “Bangladesh Sports Council” by section 3 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clauses (a) and (b) were substituted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “Secretary” was substituted for the words “General Secretary” by section 2 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “Secretary” was substituted for the words “General Secretary” by section 2 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The words “National Sports Control Board” were substituted for the words “Bangladesh Sports Council” by section 5 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Sections 4 and 5 were substituted by section 6 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The words “Cultural Affairs and Sports” were substituted for the words and brackets “Education (Cultural Affairs and Sports Division)” by section 3 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The words “Cultural Affairs and Sports” were substituted for the word “Education” by section 4 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 Sections 7, 8 and 9 were substituted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Section 7 was substituted by section 5 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 Section 11 was substituted by section 9 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 Clause (c) was omitted by section 7 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The words “Cultural Affairs and Sports” were substituted for the words and brackets “Education (Cultural Affairs and Sports Division)” by section 7 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The words “and Secretary” were substituted for the comma and words “, General Secretary and Treasurer” by section 7 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18 The words “and Secretary” were substituted for the comma and words “, General Secretary and Treasurer” by section 7 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. LIII of 1978)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19 Sub-sections (4) and (4A) were substituted for former sub-section (4) by section 10 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20 The words “National Sports Control Board Fund” were substituted for the words “Sports Council Fund” by section 11 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21 The words “National Sports Control Board Fund” were substituted for the words “Sports Council Fund” by section 11 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22 Sections 20 and 20A were substituted for former section 20 by section 12 of the Bangladesh Sports Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. XXXV of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23 The words and commas “who shall be elected according to prescribed rules or, as the case may be, nominated by the Government” were substituted for the words “who shall be appointed by the Government” by section 2 of the National Sports Council (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25 The words “except those of the Dacca Stadia” were omitted by section 2 of the National Sports Control Board (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LXXI of 1976)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p
