X of 1975), shall be deemed to have been done, taken or made, as the case may be under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “spouse” was substituted for the word “wife” by section 2(a) of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “fuel &amp; lubricant” was substituted for the words “oil and petrol” by section 2(b) of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The figure and comma “61,200” was substituted for the figure and comma “33,400” by section 3 of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The figure and commas `1, 00, 00,000` were substituted for the figure and commas `50, 00,000` by section 2 of The President`s (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2009 (Act. No. VII of 2009) (with effect from 17th September, 2007).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The commas and words “, sales tax, development surcharge or any other duties” were inserted by section 2 of the President's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXIX of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words “sales tax” were substituted for the words “value added tax” by section 4 of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Sub-section (4) was added by section 2 of the President's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. XXIX of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 Section 10 was substituted for section 10 by section 5 of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st  July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The figure “15,00,000” was substituted for the figure “10,00,000” by section 3 of the President's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XIV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The word “Speaker” was substituted for the word “Vice-President” by section 2 of the President's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXXVII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The word “Speaker” was substituted for the word “Vice-President” by section 2 of the President's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XXXVII of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The word “spouse” was substituted for the word “wife” by section 2(a) of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The word “spouse” was substituted for the word “wife” by section 6(b) of The President's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
487	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRESS COUNCIL ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRESS COUNCIL ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXV OF 1974).[14th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to establish a Press Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to establish a Press Council for the purpose of preserving the freedom of the Press and maintaining and improving the standard of newspapers and news agencies in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Press Council Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Council” means the Press Council established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “editor” means the person who controls the selection of the matter that is published in a newspaper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “member” means a member of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “newspaper” means any periodical work containing public news or comments on public news and includes such other class of printed periodical work as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be newspaper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “working journalist” means a person who is a whole-time journalist and is employed as such in, or in relation to, any newspaper establishment and includes an editor, a leader writer, news editor, sub-editor, feature writer, reporter, correspondent, copy tester, cartoonist, news photographer, caligraphist and proof-reader.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) With effect from such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint, there shall be established, in accordance with the provisions of this Act, a Council to be called the Press Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Council shall consist of a Chairman and fourteen other members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman shall be a person who is, 1[ or has been,] or is qualified to be appointed as, a Judge of the Supreme Court of Bangladesh and shall be nominated by the President of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Of the other members,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        three shall be working journalists nominated by such association of working journalists as the Chairman may notify in this behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        three shall be editors of newspapers and news agencies nominated by such association of editors of newspapers and news agencies as the Chairman may notify in this behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        three shall be persons who own or manage newspapers and news agencies nominated by such association of owners or managers of newspapers and news agencies as the Chairman may notify in this behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) three shall be persons having special knowledge or practical experience in respect of education, science, art, literature and law of whom respectively one shall be nominated by the University Grants Commission, one by the Bangla Academy and one by the Bangladesh Bar Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        two shall be members of Parliament nominated by the Speaker:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that before notifying any association under clause (a), clause (b) or clause (c), the Chairman shall consult such associations of persons of the category concerned and such individuals or interests concerned as he thinks fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that no working journalist who is an editor of any newspaper or news agency or who owns or manages any newspaper or news agency shall be eligible for nomination under clause (a):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that no editor who owns or manages any newspaper or news agency shall be eligible for nomination under clause (b):</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that not more than one person having interest in any newspaper or news agency or group of newspapers or news agencies shall be eligible for nomination under clause (a), clause (b) or clause (c).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where any nominating body referred to in clause (a), clause (b), clause (c) or clause (d) fails to send the names of its nominees to the Chairman when invited by him to do so or where a nominating body does not exist for the time being, the Chairman may nominate members to represent the category concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The names of persons nominated under this section shall be forwarded to the Government and shall be notified by the Government in the official Gazette and every such nomination shall take effect from the date on which it is so notified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Term of office of Chairman and members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Save as otherwise provided in this section, the Chairman shall hold office for a period of three years and shall be eligible for re-nomination for one further term.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Save as otherwise provided in this section, a member shall hold office for a period of two years and shall be eligible for re-nomination for one further term.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where a person nominated as a member under clause (a), clause (b) or clause (c) of sub-section (3) of section 4 is censured under the provisions of sub-section (1) of section 12, he shall cease to be member of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where a person is nominated to be a member of the Council by virtue of his holding an office or appointment, he shall cease to be such member as soon he ceases to hold that office or appointment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A member shall be deemed to have vacated his seat if he absents himself without excuse, sufficient in the opinion of the Chairman, from three consecutive meetings of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Chairman may resign his office by giving notice in writing to the Government and any other member may resign his office by giving notice in writing to the Chairman, and upon such resignation being accepted by the Government or the Chairman, as the case may be, he shall be deemed to have vacated his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Any vacancy arising under sub-section (2), sub-section (3), sub-section (4) or sub-section (5) or otherwise shall be filled, as soon as may be, by nomination made by the same authority by which and in the same manner in which the member vacating office was nominated and the member so nominated shall hold office for the remaining period for which the member in whose place he is nominated would have held office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Conditions of service of Chairman and members</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Chairman shall be a whole-time officer and shall be paid such salary as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member shall receive such allowances or fees for attending the meetings of the Council as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Council may constitute from amongst its members such committees as it may deem necessary to assist it in the discharge of its functions:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Council may co-opt as members of such committees persons who are not members of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Council shall meet at such times and places as may be provided by regulations made under this Act:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until such regulations are made, the Chairman may summon a meeting of the Council at such time and place as he may deem expedient by notice addressed to each member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Council, not less than six members, including the Chairman, shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The meetings of the Council shall be presided over by the Chairman, and, in the absence of the Chairman, by a member nominated by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Council shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and, in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Vacancies, etc not to invalidate acts or proceedings of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. No act or proceeding of the Council shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of Secretary, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Council may appoint a Secretary and such other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be determined by regulations made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Object and functions of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The object of the Council shall be to preserve the freedom of the Press and to maintain and improve the standard of newspapers and news agencies in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council may, in furtherance of its object, perform the following functions, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to help newspapers and news agencies to maintain their freedom;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to build up a code of conduct for newspapers and news agencies and journalists in accordance with high professional standard;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to ensure on the part of newspapers and news agencies and journalists the maintenance of a high standard of public taste and to foster a due sense of both the rights and responsibilities of citizenship;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to encourage the growth of a sense of responsibility and public service among all those engaged in the profession of journalism;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to keep under review any development likely to restrict the supply and dissemination of information of public interest and importance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to keep under review cases of assistance received by any newspaper or news agency in Bangladesh from any foreign source including such cases as are referred to it by the Government or are brought to its notice by any individual, association of persons or any other organisation :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this clause shall preclude the Government from dealing with, in any manner it deems fit, any case of assistance received by a newspaper or news agency in Bangladesh from any foreign source;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)         to undertake studies and research of national and foreign newspapers, their circulation and impact;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to provide facilities for proper education and training of persons in the profession of journalism;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to promote technical or other research;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to promote a proper functional relationship among all classes of persons engaged in the production or publication of newspapers or in the running of news agencies:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this clause shall be deemed to confer on the Council any function in regard to disputes to which the Industrial Relations Ordinance, 1969 (XXIII of 1969), applies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to do such other acts as may be incidental or conducive to the discharge of the above functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to warn, admonish and censure</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) Where, on receipt of a complaint made to it or otherwise, the Council has reason to believe that a newspaper or news agency has offended against the standard of journalistic ethics or public taste or that an editor or a working journalist has committed any professional misconduct or a breach of the code of journalistic ethics, the Council may, after giving the newspaper or news agency, the editor or journalist concerned an opportunity of being heard, hold an inquiry in such manner as may be provided by regulations made under this Act, and if it is satisfied that it is necessary so to do, it may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, warn, admonish or censure the newspaper, the news agency, the editor or the journalist, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Council is of the opinion that it is necessary or expedient in the public interest so to do, it may require any newspaper to publish therein, in such manner as the Council thinks fit, any report relating to any inquiry under this section against a newspaper or news agency, an editor or a journalist working therein, including the name of such newspaper, news agency, editor or journalist.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Nothing in sub-section (1) shall be deemed to empower the Council to hold an inquiry into any matter in respect of which any proceeding is pending in a court of law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The decision of the Council under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2), as the case may be, shall be final and shall not be questioned in any court of law.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General powers of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) For the purpose of performing its functions or holding any inquiry under this Act, the Council shall have the same powers throughout Bangladesh as are vested in a civil court while trying a suit under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (V of 1908), in respect of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) summoning and enforcing the attendance of persons and examining them on oath;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        requiring the discovery and production of documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        receiving evidence on affidavit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) requisitioning any public record or copies thereof from any court or office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        issuing commissions for the examination of witnesses or documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         any other matter which may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Nothing in sub-section (1) shall be deemed to compel any newspaper, news agency, editor or journalist to disclose the source of any news or information published by that newspaper or received or reported by that news agency, editor or journalist.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every inquiry held by the Council shall be deemed to be a judicial proceeding within the meaning of sections 193 and 228 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Payments to the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Government may pay to the Council in each financial year such sums as may be considered necessary for the performance of the functions of the Council under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fund of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Council shall have its own fund, and all such sums as may, from time to time, be paid to it by the Government and all grants and advances made to it by any other authority or person shall be credited to the fund and all payments by the Council shall be made therefrom:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no grant or advance from any foreign source shall be accepted by the Council without the prior approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All moneys belonging to the fund shall be deposited in such banks or invested in such manner as may, subject to the approval of the Government, be decided by the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council may spend such sums as it thinks fit for performing its functions under this Act, and such sums shall be treated as expenditure payable out of the fund of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Council shall prepare, in such form and at such time each year as may be prescribed, a budget in respect of the financial year next ensuing showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year, and forward copies thereof to the Government for consideration and sanction of the sums shown in the budget to be required from the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual report</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Council shall prepare once every year, in such form and at such time as may be prescribed, an annual report giving a summary of its activities during the previous year and copies thereof shall be forwarded to the Government and the Government shall cause the same to be laid before Parliament.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Accounts and audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The accounts of the Council shall be maintained in such manner as may be prescribed and shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authentication of orders, etc of the Council</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. All orders and decisions of the Council shall be authenticated by the signature of the Chairman or any other member authorised by the Chairman in this behalf and other instruments issued by the Council shall be authenticated by the signature of the Secretary or any other officer of the Council authorised by the Secretary in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Protection of certain actions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Council or any member thereof or any person acting under the direction of the Council in respect of anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against any newspaper in respect of the publication of any matter therein under the authority of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Chairman, members, officers and other employees of the Council shall be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of section 21 of the Penal Code (XLV of 1860).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Winding up</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. No provisions of law relating to the winding up of bodies corporate shall apply to the Council and the Council shall not be wound up except by orders of the Government and in such manner as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. The Council may make regulations, not inconsistent with this Act and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters not provided for by rules and for which provisions are necessary or expedient for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words and comma “or has been,” were inserted by section 2 of the Press Council (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. XLIX of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
488	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRIMARY EDUCATION LAWS (REPEAL) ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRIMARY EDUCATION LAWS (REPEAL) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. LV OF 1974).[26th July, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to repeal the Primary Education Act, 1919, the Rural Primary Education Act, 1930 and the Rural Primary Education (Supplementary Provisions) Act, 1957.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Primary Education Act, 1919 (Ben. Act IV of 1919), the Rural Primary Education Act, 1930 (Ben. Act VII of 1930), and the Rural Primary Education (Supplementary Provisions) Act, 1957 (E.P. Act XXVIII of 1957);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Act may be called the Primary Education Laws (Repeal) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The Primary Education Act, 1919 (Ben. Act IV of 1919), the Rural Primary Education Act, 1930 (Ben. Act VII of 1930), and the Rural Primary Education (Supplementary Provisions) Act, 1957 (E.P. Act XXVIII of 1957), are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
489	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRIMARY SCHOOLS (TAKING OVER) ACT, 1974 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRIMARY SCHOOLS (TAKING OVER) ACT, 1974 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. VIII OF 1974).[5th February, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An act to make provisions for the taking over by the Government of certain primary schools in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for taking over by the Government of certain primary schools in Bangladesh and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Primary Schools (Taking Over) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 31st day of October, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definition </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “primary school” means a school or department of a school giving instruction in primary education.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Taking over of primary school</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, rule, regulation or bye-law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement, or in any deed or other instrument, the Government may by notification in the official Gazette, take over any primary school on such date as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On the date specified in the notification under sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the primary school and all its assets and property, including lands, buildings and funds and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property, and all records and other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, shall stand transferred to, and vested in the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all teachers of the primary school shall become employees of the Government and shall hold their service under the Government on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)         all committees or authorities managing and administering the affairs of the primary school shall cease to function.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Management of the primary school taken over</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. After a primary school is taken over under section 3(1), the Government shall manage and administer the affairs of that school in such manner as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Removal of difficulty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty arising out of, or in connection with, or in relation to the taking over of any primary school under section 3, make such order as it considers expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. That the Government may, after previous publication, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Primary Schools (Taking Over) Ordinance, 1973 (P.O. No. XXII of 1973), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any order made, notification issued or direction given under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made, issued or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
490	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRIME MINISTER’S (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ACT, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRIME MINISTER’S (REMUNERATION AND PRIVILEGES) ACT, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. IX OF 1975).[12th July, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the remuneration and privileges of the Prime Minister.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the remuneration and privileges of the Prime Minister;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) Act, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 26th day of January, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Family” in relation to the Prime Minister, means his 1[ spouse] and children and includes his parents, unmarried sisters and brothers residing with and wholly dependent on him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “maintenance”, in relation to an official residence, includes the payment of local rates and taxes and the provision of telephone, electricity, gas and water;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “official residence”, in relation to the Prime Minister, means the house reserved from time to time for use by the Prime Minister and includes the staff quarters and other buildings appurtenant thereto, and the gardens thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Salary</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The salary to be paid to the Prime Minister shall be Taka 2[ 58,600] per mensem free of income tax.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sumptuary allowance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 4. (1) The Prime Minister shall receive the full amount spent on entertainment as sumptuary allowance in a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Secretary to the Prime Minister shall be the drawing and disbursing officer of the sumptuary allowance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Allowance on taking up and laying down office</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Prime Minister shall be entitled to receive travelling expenses to the extent mentioned below for the journey from his ordinary place of residence to the seat of the Government on taking up office and from the seat of the Government to his ordinary place of residence on laying down office-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the actual travelling expenses for himself and his family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the cost of transporting household effects, not exceeding 4[ 4,500 kilogram], by goods train, steamer or other craft, excluding aircraft, and his personal car, if any.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Residential accommodation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) There shall be an official residence for the Prime Minister which shall be furnished and maintained at Government cost.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (2) If the Prime Minister decides to reside in his own house or in any house other than the official residence, he shall be entitled to receive 6[ Taka 50,000] as house rent allowance per month; and such house shall be furnished in a manner befitting the residence of the Prime Minister and the cost shall be borne by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2A) At the Prime Minister's official residence as well as at the place where he decides to reside all costs for supply of electricity, gas, water, telephone and the like shall be borne by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2B) If the Prime Minister decides to reside in his own house or in any house other than the official residence, he shall be entitled to receive every year for maintenance of such house an amount of money equivalent to three month's house rent allowance admissible to him under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2C) If the Prime Minister decides to reside in his own house, and such house has no guard shed for accommodating house guard, the Government may construct a temporary guard shed in that house.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Prime Minister shall be entitled to reside in his official residence for a period of one month immediately after laying down his office and no charge shall fall on him during this period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Journeys within Bangladesh</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Subject to the provisions made hereinafter, the Prime Minister travelling on official duty shall be treated as a very important person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When travelling by rail, the Prime Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to requisition at the cost of the Government a reserved railway saloon;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to take with him up to four personal attendants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to the carriage of necessary personal luggage;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to take with him, without payment of any fare, the members of his family.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When travelling by steamer, the Prime Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to the actual fare paid himself and two incidental fares of the highest class of accommodation in addition to the actual fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to take with him members of his family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to take with him up to four personal attendants by the lowest class of accommodation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to the carriage of necessary personal luggage.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) When travelling by air, the Prime Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to the actual air fare paid for himself;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to the cost of transporting personal luggage up to 7[ 68 kilogram] inclusive of the free allowance given by the air company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to requisition at the cost of the Government, if he considers it necessary in the public interest, an aeroplane, or a helicopter, belonging to the Government, subject to availability, in accordance with the rules made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to take with him one member of his family when travelling by a commercial aeroplane or such number of members of his family as may be accommodated in the aeroplane when travelling by a requisitioned aeroplane;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) either to take with him at Government cost by air two personal attendants or persons or to the cost of transporting up to four personal attendants by the lowest class of accommodation and of transporting personal luggage up to 8[ 187 kilogram] by rail or steamer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) When travelling by road, the Prime Minister shall be entitled-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to requisition at the cost of the Government any mode of transport;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to take with him up to four personal attendants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to the carriage of necessary personal luggage.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Travelling outside Bangladesh</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Prime Minister travelling on official business outside Bangladesh shall be entitled to such allowances as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Daily allowance during halt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Prime Minister while on tour shall be entitled to a daily allowance at the rate of 9[ Taka 1,000] for each day of halt or a part of a day of absence from the headquarters.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transport</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ 10. The Prime Minister shall be entitled to requisition any mode of transport convenient to him for his use as well as for the use of his family at Government cost.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Insurance cover for air journey</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. For journeys by air the Prime Minister shall be provided with insurance cover of Taka 11[ 14,00,000] on annual basis at Government cost.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Medical facilities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ 12.The Prime Minister and his family shall be entitled free of charge, to treatment at any hospital in Bangladesh that can, in the opinion of his physician, provide necessary and suitable treatment :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Prime Minister and his family shall ordinarily be entitled to receive medical treatment at the residence :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the Prime Minister and his family may, if so advised by his physician, receive medical treatment abroad or consult a foreigner or a physician other than his own and receive such other treatment at the Government cost as may be prescribed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Personal and household staff</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Prime Minister shall be entitled to such personal and household staff as 13[ the Prime Minister himself] may, from time to time, determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. [Telephone at permanent residence.- Omitted by section 9 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discretionary grant</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) There shall be placed at the disposal of the Prime Minister as discretionary grant an amount of Taka 14[ 1,00,00,000] per annum.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The expenditure from the discretionary grant shall be subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to issue order</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 15A. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, issue orders for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15B. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeals and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) Act, 1973 (III of 1973), and the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) Ordinance, 1975 (Ordinance No. VIII of 1975), are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding the repeal of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) Ordinance, 1975 (Ordinance No. VIII of 1975), anything done or any action taken under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “spouse” was substituted for the word “wife” by section 2 of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The figure and comma “58,600” was substituted for the figure and comma “32,000” by section 3 of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Section 4 was substituted by section 3 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The figure, comma and word “4,500 kilogram” was substituted for the words “one hundred and twenty maunds” by section 4 of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st  July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Sub-sections (2), (2A), (2B) and (2C) were substituted by section 4 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word and figure “Taka 50,000” were substituted for the word and figure “Taka 35,000” by section 2 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XX of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word and figure “68 kilogram” was substituted for the words “one hundred and fifty pounds” by section 5(a) of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The figure and word “187 kilogram” was substituted for the words “five maunds” by section 5(b) of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The word and figure “Taka 1,000” were substituted for the word and figure “Taka 250” by section 3 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XX of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Section 10 was substituted by section 6 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The figure “14,00,000” was substituted for the figure “5,00,000” by section 7 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 Section 12 was substituted for section 12 by section 6 of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st  July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The words “the Prime Minister himself” were substituted for the words “the President” by section 8 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1992 (Act No. XV of 1992)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 The figure and comma “1,00,00,000” was substituted for the figure and comma “50,00,000” by section 7 of The Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act. No XVIII of 2010) (With effect from 1st July, 2010).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 Sections 15A and 15B were inserted by section 4 of the Prime Minister's (Remuneration and Privileges)(Amendment) Act, 2003 (Act No. XX of 2003)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
491	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE PRINTING CORPORATION (VESTING) ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRINTING CORPORATION (VESTING) ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 81 OF 1972).[17th July, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient in the public interest to provide for the taking over by the Government of the undertaking of the Printing Corporation of Pakistan Limited in Bangladesh and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Independence of Bangladesh, read with the Provisional Constitution of Bangladesh Order, 1972, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make the following Order:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Printing Corporation (Vesting) Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Government” means the Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Printing Corporation” means the undertaking in Bangladesh of the Printing Corporation of Pakistan Limited registered as a Public Limited Company under the Companies Act, 1913 (Act VII of 1913);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Undertaking” includes any business, asset, right, power, authority and privilege, and any property movable and immovable, including land, building, press, machinery, cash or bank ¬balance, reserve fund, investments, and any other right or interest in, or arising out of, such property and any book of accounts, register, record and any other document of whatever nature relating thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any memorandum or articles of association, or in any contract or agreement, or in any deed or other instrument, on the commencement of this Order,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the entire undertaking of the Printing Corporation shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts and liabilities incurred, all obligations undertaken, all contracts entered into and all agreements made, by or with the Printing Corporation shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, stand transferred to, and be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into, or made by or with, the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Printing Corporation in Bangladesh before the commencement of this Order shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Government and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all officers and other employees of the Printing Corporation shall stand transferred to the Government on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or other employee so transferred shall have the option not to continue in the service of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty arising out of, or in connection with, or in relation to the transfer of the undertaking of the Printing Corporation under Article 3, make such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Order</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
492	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE PRINTING PRESSES AND PUBLICATIONS (DECLARATION AND REGISTRATION) ACT, 1973 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE PRINTING PRESSES AND PUBLICATIONS (DECLARATION AND REGISTRATION) ACT, 1973 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ACT NO. XXIII OF 1973).[22nd September, 1973]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for declaration for the keeping of printing presses and the printing and publication of newspapers and for registration of books.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for declaration for the keeping of printing presses and the printing and publication of newspapers and for registration of books, and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> PART I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Printing Presses and Publications (Declaration and Registration) Act, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 28th day of August, 1973.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “authenticated declaration” means a declaration made and subscribed under section 7 and authenticated or deemed to have been authenticated under section 12;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “book” includes every volume, part or division of a volume, and pamphlet, in any language, and every sheet of music, map, chart or plan separately printed or lithographed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “document” includes any painting, drawing, photograph or other visible representation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “editor” means the person who controls the selection of the matter that is published in a newspaper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “form” means a form contained in the Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “newspaper” means any periodical work containing public news or comments on public news, and includes such other class of periodical works as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be newspapers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “news-sheet” means any document other than a newspaper containing public news or comments on public news;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (gg) “Press Appellate Board” means the Press Appellate Board constituted under section 2a.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “papers” includes a document, leaflet, newspaper, news-sheet and poster;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) “press” includes a printing press and all machines, implements and plant and parts thereof and all materials used for multiplying documents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “printer” means the person who owns or keeps in his possession any press for the printing of books or papers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) “printing press” includes all engines, machinery, types, lithographic stones, implements, utensils and other plant or materials used for the purpose of printing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “publisher” means the person who, in any manner whatsoever, undertakes, is in control on, or is responsible for the publication of any book or paper, and includes the proprietor of the publishing concern;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        “unauthorised newspaper” means any newspaper in respect of which there are not for the time being valid declarations under section 7;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        “unauthorised news-sheet” means any news-sheet other than a news-sheet published by a person authorised under section 21 to publish it; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        “unauthorised press” means any press other than a press in respect of which there is for the time being a valid declaration under section 4.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 PART IA</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">PRESS APPELLATE BOARD</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Press Appellate Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2A.
