LXXVI OF 1974).[29th November, 1974]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the preparation of records of growers of jute and lands on which jute is grown by them within the border area.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the preparation of records of growers of jute and lands on which jute is grown by them within the border area for the purpose of ensuring more effective check on smuggling and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Short title and commencement </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Record of Jute Growers (Border Areas) Act, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 21st day of August, 1974.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “border area” means the area of land lying within ten miles adjacent to the frontier of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “dealer” means any person who purchases, or negotiates for the purchase of, or stores, or sells, or undertakes the grading or baling or spinning or manufacturing of, jute or jute manufactures and includes all kinds of dealers in jute and jute manufactures commonly known as faria, bepari, paikar, arathdar, broker, commission agent, kutcha baler, pucca baler, manufacturer, export agent, and exporter, but does not include a grower of jute storing or selling his own produce;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Director” means the Director, Directorate of Jute, Government of Bangladesh and includes any person who, for the time being, performs the duties of that office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “grow” with its grammatical variations, when used in relation to jute, includes “sow” with its grammatical variations, irrespective of whether the jute is harvested or not;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “grower's card” means a card issued to a grower of jute under sub-section (2) of section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (f) “grower of jute” means any person who, either himself or by members of his family or by hired labourers or by any arrangement to share the produce, grows jute in any year on any land in his possession and includes, in relation to any land, any person who, as adhiar, bargadar, bhagdar or otherwise, receives any share of jute grown in such land;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “jute” means the plant known botanically as belonging to the genus corchorus, and includes all the species of that genus, whether known commonly as pat, kosta, nalia or by any other name, and also means the plant known botanically as hibiscus cannabinus and known commonly as mesta, and includes any jute fibre which has not been subjected to any process of spinning or weaving;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “land” includes any land on which jute is grown in any year but does not include any land on which, with the permission in writing of the Government or any person authorised by the Government in this behalf, jute is grown in any year for bona fide experimental or demonstrational purposes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation of record, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that there shall be prepared, in respect of such year as may be specified in the notification, a record of all growers of jute in the border area or in such part thereof as may be specified in the notification, in which shall be entered the lands on which such growers of jute have grown, or intend to grow, jute in that year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, for the purpose of such record, the border area may be divided into separate zones and a separate record may be prepared for each such zone.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the issue of a notification under sub-section (1), the Director shall prepare, or cause to be prepared, within such period and in such manner and form as the Government may direct, the record referred to in sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Liability of growers of jute to submit names and other particulars</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) For the purpose of preparation of a record under section 3, every grower of jute referred to in sub-section (1) of section 3 shall, within such period and at such place as may be specified by the Director or any officer authorised by him in this behalf, declare or submit either personally, or in such other manner as the Director or such officer, considering the circumstances of the grower, may permit, to the person authorised to prepare the record his name and other particulars including those of the lands on which he has grown, or intends to grow, jute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Immediately upon the declaration or submission of the name and other particulars of the grower of jute, the person preparing the record shall enter in the record the name and particulars and shall issue to the grower of jute a grower's card in which shall be entered the name and the particulars declared or submitted by the grower of jute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition to sell jute, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) No grower of jute referred to in sub-section (1) of section 3 shall, unless authorised in writing in this behalf by the Director, sell or otherwise dispose of jute grown by him except to such dealer as the Director may specify in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director may require every grower of jute referred to in sub-section (1) of section 3 to sell the entire quantity of jute produced by him after retaining not more than two maunds for his own consumption, to such dealer and in such manner and at such price on garsat basis and within such period as may be specified by the Director and to maintain an account of sale in the grower's card.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The dealer to whom a grower of jute is required to sell jute in pursuance of a direction under sub-section (2) shall purchase jute in accordance with such direction:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the dealer may decline to purchase any lot of jute if the content of sticks or hunka in the lot exceeds three per cent</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director, in determining the price of jute under sub-section (2), shall have regard to the average quality of jute on garsat basis.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No grower of jute shall sell jute to any dealer referred to in sub-section (2) except in its dry condition nor shall such jute contain moisture in excess of the natural moisture inherent in the fibre.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Any grower of jute whose stocks of jute contain high percentage of sticks or hunka shall, with the prior permission of the Director or any other officer authorised by him in this behalf, sell or otherwise dispose of such stocks to such dealer and in such manner and at such price and within such period as may be specified by the Director or such officer and shall also maintain account of such sale or disposal in the grower's card.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Every grower of jute shall, on demand by the Director or any person authorised by him in this behalf, produce the grower's card for inspection.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) The provisions of this section shall have effect subject to any order made under section 6.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- For the purposes of this section, “maund” means a standard maund of forty seers, each seer weighing eighty tolas.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Government to prohibit transport, stock, etc of jute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Government may, by general or special order in writing, direct the growers of jute referred to in sub-section (1) of section 3 not to transport, stock, sell or otherwise dispose of any jute except in such manner or in accordance with such conditions as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Prohibition of movement of jute into the border area</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. No person shall, after the commencement of this Act, carry any jute from any inland area into the border area:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Government may, by general or special order in writing, exempt, to such extent and subject to such conditions as may be specified in the order, any person or class of persons from the operation of this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Inspection, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Director, or any person authorised by him in this behalf, may enter upon, and make survey of, any land where jute is grown or likely to be grown in any year and may require the grower of jute to furnish such particulars or documents relating to his lands or jute sowings as the Director or such person may call for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director, or any person authorised by him in this behalf, may enter upon any premises in which he has reasons to believe that there is any stock of jute and inspect the jute stock, if any.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to seize jute stock, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Any person authorised by the Director in writing in this behalf may, if he has reasons to believe that a contravention of the provisions of this Act or any order or direction made or issued thereunder has been committed or is likely to be committed,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        seize, with the previous sanction in writing of such authority as may be specified in the rules, stocks of jute in respect of which such contravention is believed to have been committed or is likely to be committed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) direct the person from whose possession or custody such stocks of jute have been seized to sell the same to such dealer, in such manner, at such price and within such period as may be specified by the Director;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) on failure of the person mentioned in clause (b) to sell the seized stocks of jute in accordance with his directive under that clause, sell such stocks of jute to such dealer and at such price as may be specified by the Director and to hand over the sale proceeds to such person after deduction of cost incidental to sale; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) require any person reasonably suspected of being concerned in such contravention to cause his stocks of jute to be shifted to such place as he may specify and to sell the same to such dealer and at such price as may be specified by the Director.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">False information</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. If any person-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        when required under this Act or any order or direction made or issued thereunder to make a statement or furnish any information, makes any statement or furnishes any information which is false in any material particular and which he knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, to be false, or does not believe to be true, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) makes any such statement as aforesaid in any account or record which he is required by or under this Act to maintain or furnish, he shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Penalty</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) Any person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act or any order or direction made or issued thereunder shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any court trying an offence under this Act may direct that the whole or a part of the jute in respect of which the court is satisfied that the offence has been committed shall be forfeited to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. No prosecution for an offence punishable under this Act shall be instituted except upon complaint in writing by the Director or any person authorised by him in writing in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Government, Director or any other person authorised by the Director in this behalf, in respect of anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Act or any order made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of orders, etc, inconsistent with other enactments</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Any order made or direction issued under this Act shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any enactment other than this Act or any instrument having effect by virtue of any enactment other than this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 14A. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal and savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Record of Jute Growers (Border Areas) Ordinance, 1974 (Ord. XIV of 1974), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done, any action taken, including any order made, notification issued or direction given under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, made, issued or given, as the case may be, under the corresponding provision of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (f) was substituted by section 2 of the Record of Jute Growers (Border Areas) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XXX of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 14A was inserted by section 2 of the Record of Jute Growers (Border Areas) (Amendment) Act, 1975 (Act No. XXX of 1975)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
496	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE REGISTRATION (EXTENSION OF LIMITATION) ORDINANCE, 1975 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE REGISTRATION (EXTENSION OF LIMITATION) ORDINANCE, 1975 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LX OF 1975).[23rd December, 1975]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to extend the period of limitation in certain cases for registration of documents and for disposal of appeals and applications under the Registration Act, 1908.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to extend the period of limitation in certain cases for registration of documents and for disposal of appeals and applications under the Registration Act, 1908 (XVI of 1908);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamations of the 20th August, 1975, and 8th November, 1975, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Registration (Extension of Limitation) Ordinance, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Extension of limitation for registration of documents and for disposal of appeals and applications under the Registration Act, 1908</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. Where the period within which any document already presented for registration but could not be admitted to registration or any appeal or application already filed but could not be disposed of, by a Sub-Registrar or Registrar under any provision of the Registration Act, 1908 (XVI of 1908) expired at any time after the 1st day of March, 1971 and before the 1st day of March, 1972, such document, appeal or application may be registered or disposed of, notwithstanding anything contained in that Act or in any other law for the time being in force, within eight months from the date of commencement of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
497	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE ORDER, 1972 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE REPRESENTATION OF THE PEOPLE ORDER, 1972 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(PRESIDENT'S ORDER NO. 155 OF 1972).[26th December, 1972]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is necessary to provide for the conduct of elections to Parliament and for matters connected therewith and incidental thereto; 1</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance to the provisions of paragraph 3 of the Fourth Schedule to the Constitution of the People's Republic of Bangladesh and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>CHAPTER I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Order may be called the Representation of the People Order, 1972.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force at once.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Order, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “ballot paper account” means a ballot paper account prepared under clause (10) of Article 36;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (ia) “ballot paper book” means a book containing ballot papers from which ballot papers are issued to electors; ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        “candidate” means a person proposed as a candidate for election as a member;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (iia) “Code of Conduct” means the Code of Conduct formulated under Article 91B;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (iii)   “Commission” means the Election Commission within the meaning of the Constitution;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       “Constituency” means a constituency delimited for the purpose of election of a member;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        “Constitution” means the Constitution of the People's Republic of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       “contesting candidate” means a candidate who has been validly nominated for election as a member and has not withdrawn his candidature; (vii) “election” means election to a seat of a member held under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viii)      “election agent” means an election agent appointed by a candidate under Article 21 and, where no such appointment is made, the candidate acting as his own election agent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ (viiia) “election expenses” means the election expenses as defined in Article 44A;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viiib) “election observer” means a person permitted in writing by the Commission or by any person authorised by it in this behalf to observe any election under this Order, and includes a group of such observers;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ix)       “election petition” means an election petition made under Article 49;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(x)        “elector” in relation to a constituency, means a person who is enrolled on the electoral roll in that constituency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ (xi) "electoral roll" means the final electoral roll prepared under the Electoral Rolls Ordinance, 2007 (Ord. No. XVII of 2007);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ ***]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (xiaa) "law enforcing agency" means any Police Force, Armed Police Battalion, Rapid Action Battalion, Ansar Force, Battalion Ansar, Bangladesh Rifles, Coast Guard Force and the Defence Services of Bangladesh;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xii)      “member” means a member of Parliament;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiii)      “nomination day” means the day appointed under Article 11 for the nomination of candidates;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiv)     “Parliament” means Parliament for Bangladesh as defined in Article 152 of the Constitution;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (xiva) “political party” means a political party as defined in article 152(1) of the Constitution; ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xv)      “polling agent” means a polling agent appointed under Article 22; (xvi)   “polling day” means the day on which poll is taken for an election;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xvii)     “polling officer” means a polling officer appointed under Article 9 for a polling station;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xviii) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Order; (xix)        “Presiding Officer” means a Presiding Officer appointed under Article 9 for a polling station and includes an Assistant Presiding Officer exercising the powers and performing the functions of Presiding Officer; 10[ (xixa) “registered political party” means a political party registered under Article 90A;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xx)      “returned candidate” means a candidate who has been declared elected as a member under this Order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxi)     “Returning Officer” means a Returning Officer appointed under Article 7 and includes an Assistant Returning Officer exercising the powers and performing the functions of Returning Officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (xxia) “rule” means any rule made under this Order;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxii)     “scruting day” means the day appointed under Article 11 for the scrutiny of nomination papers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxiii) “spoilt ballot paper” means a ballot paper which has been spoiled and is returned to the Presiding Officer under Article 34;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ (xxiiia) “statutory public authority” means a statutory public authority as defined in article 152 (1) of the Constitution;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (xxiv) “ward” means a ward of a union.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxv)    “withdrawal day” means the day appointed under Article 11 on or before which candidature may be withdrawn.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ELECTION COMMISSION</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ 3. The Election Commission, constituted in accordance with Article 118 of the Constitution, may be strengthened by appointing such number of Commissioners as may be deemed necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3A. Subject to the provisions of this Order, the Commission shall regulate its own procedure.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Commission may authorise its chairman or any of its members or any of its officers to exercise and perform all or any of its powers and functions under this Order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Commission may require any person or authority to perform such function or render such assistance for the purposes of this Order as it may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All executive authorities of the Government shall assist the Commission in the performance of its functions, and for this purpose the President may, after consultation with the Commission, issue such directions as he may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Government or an Officer authorised by it in this behalf, may upon a request made in this behalf by the Commission, by an order in writing, requisition any such vehicle or vessel as is needed or is likely to be needed for the purpose of transporting to and from any polling station ballot boxes or other election materials or any Officer or other person engaged for the performance of any duties in connection with the election:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no vehicle or vessel which is being used by a candidate or his election agent for any purpose connected with the election of such candidate shall be so requisitioned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person authorised in this behalf by the Government may take possession of any vehicle or vessel requisitioned under clause (1) and may for that purpose use such force including police force, as may be reasonably necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any vehicle or vessel is requisitioned under clause (1), there shall be paid to the owner thereof compensation the amount of which shall be determined by the Government or the officer requisitioning the vehicle or vessel on the basis of the fares and rates prevailing in the locality for its hire:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the owner of the vehicle or vessel being aggrieved by the amount of compensation so determined, makes an application to the Government within period of thirty days from the date the amount has been determined for the matter being referred to an arbitrator the amount of compensation to be paid shall be such as the arbitrator appointed in this behalf by the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER III</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ELECTION</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ 7. 16[ * * *] (1) The Commission shall appoint a Returning Officer for each constituency for the purpose of election of a member for that constituency; and a person may be appointed as Returning Officer for two or more constituencies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Commission may appoint as many Assistant Returning Officers as may be necessary:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no Assistant Returning Officer shall be appointed for more than one constituency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An Assistant Returning Officer shall assist the Returning Officer in the performance of his functions under this Order and may, subject to any condition imposed by the Commission, exercise and perform, under the control of the Returning Officer, the power and functions of the Returning Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) It shall be the duty of a Returning Officer to do all such acts and things as may be necessary for effectively conducting an election in accordance with the provisions of this Order and the rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Subject to the superintendance, direction, and control of the Commission, the Returning Officer shall supervise all work in the district in connection with the conduct of elections and shall also perform such other duties and functions as may be entrusted to him by the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Commission may, at any time, for reasons to be recorded in writing, withdraw any officer performing any duty in connection with an election, or any other public functionary, or any other law enforcing personnel who obstructs or prevents or attempts to obstruct or prevent the conduct of fair and impartial poll or interferes or attempts to interfere with an elector when he records his vote, or influences in any manner the polling staff or an elector or does any other act calculated to influence the result of election, and make such arrangements as it may consider necessary for the performance of the functions of the officer or person so withdrawn.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ (7) Where the Commission withdraws any officer or person under clause (6), it-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        may, if such officer or person is working in any polling station or constituency, direct him to leave the polling station or the constituency at once;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) shall, in case of a direction under sub-clause (a), direct such officer or person to remain out of the constituency for the period specified in the direction, and accordingly he shall comply with the direction, and if he is required to perform any official duty only in that constituency, his appointing authority shall make arrangement for his leave or otherwise;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) shall refer the matter to the appropriate authority for taking disciplinary and other actions in relation to such officer or person.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. 18[ (1) The Commission shall maintain a list of polling stations for the purpose of election of a member for every constituency.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) 19[ The Commission may make such alterations in the list of polling stations as it may consider necessary and shall, at least twenty five days] before the polling day, publish in the official Gazette, the final list of polling stations specifying the area the electors whereof will be entitled to vote at each polling station.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Returning Officer shall provide each constituency with polling stations according to the final list published under clause (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No polling station shall be located in any such premises as belong to, or are under the control of, any candidate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ (5) At any time after the finalization of candidature, if it is found that any polling station published in the Official Gazette under clause (2), belongs to, or is under the control of any candidate, the Commission may alter such polling station.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. 21[ (1) The returning Officer shall, by a notice in writing, require all heads of offices, institutions and establishments, whether Government or non-Government, in the district to provide him with a list of their officers and employees of such grades as he may specify for preparation of a panel of Presiding Officers, Assistant Presiding Officers and Polling Officers from among them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1A) After the preparation of the panel, the Returning Officer shall send a copy thereof to the heads of all the offices, institutions and establishments whose officers and employees have been included in the panel with a request to place the service of these officers and employees at the disposal of the Commission for use for election purpose and also forward a copy of the panel to the Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1B) The Returning Officer shall appoint from the panel for each polling station a Presiding Officer and such number of Assistant Presiding Officers and Polling Officers to assist the Presiding Officers as the Returning Officer may consider necessary:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a person who is, or has at any time been, in the employment of any candidate shall not be appointed as a Presiding Officer, Assistant Presiding Officer or Polling Officer.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Presiding Officer shall conduct the poll in accordance with the provisions of this Order, and the rules, shall be responsible for maintaining order at the polling station and shall report to the Returning Officer any fact or incident which may, in his opinion, affect the fairness of the poll:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that during the course of the poll the Presiding Officer may entrust such of his functions as may be specified by him to any Assistant Presiding Officer and it shall be the duty of the Assistant Presiding Officer to perform the functions so entrusted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Returning Officer shall authorise one of the Assistant Presiding Officers to act in place of the Presiding Officer if the Presiding Officer is, at any time during the poll, by reason of illness or other cause, not present at the polling station, or is unable to perform his functions; and any absence of the Presiding Officer, and the reasons therefor, shall, as soon as possible after the close of the poll, be reported to the Returning Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Returning Officer may, at any time during the poll for reasons to be recorded in writing, suspend any Presiding Officer, Assistant Presiding Officer, Polling Officer and make such arrangements as he may consider necessary for the performance of the functions of the officer so suspended.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Commission shall provide the Returning Officer for each constituency with copies of electoral rolls for that constituency 22[ immediately after the publication of notification under clause (1) of Article 11].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Returning Officer shall provide the Presiding Officer of each polling station with copies of electoral rolls containing the names of the electors entitled to vote at that polling station.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) For the purpose of holding elections for constituting Parliament, the Commission shall, by notification in the official Gazette, call upon the electors to elect a member from each constituency and shall, in relation to each constituency, specify in the notification-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ (a) a day on or before which the nomination of candidates may be filed;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a day 24[ or days] for the scrutiny of nomination papers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        a day on or before which candidature may be withdrawn; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        a day 25[ or days], at least fifteen days after the withdrawal day, for the taking of the poll.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Returning Officer shall, as soon as may be after the publication of a notification under clause (1), give public notice of the dates specified by the Commission in respect of the constituency or constituencies of which he is the Returning Officer; and the public notice shall be published at some prominent place or places within the constituency to which it relates.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A public notice issued under clause (2) shall also invite nominations and specify the time before which and the place at which nomination papers shall be received by the Returning Officer 26[ or the Assistant Returning Officer].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. 27[ (1) Any elector of a constituency may propose or second for election to that constituency, the name of any person qualified to be a member under clause (1) of Article 66 of the Constitution:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a person shall be disqualified for election as or for being, a member, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is not listed in the electoral roll of any constituency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is not nominated by any registered political party or is not an independent candidate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is a person holding any office of profit in the service of the Republic or of a statutory public authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        is a person who is convicted of an offence punishable under Article 73, 74, 78, 79, 80, 81, 82, 83, 84 and 86 and sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than two years, unless a period of five years has elapsed since the date of his release;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        is a person whose election to a seat is declared void on any of the grounds mentioned in sub-clauses (c), (d) and (e) of clause (1) of Article 63, unless a period of five years has elapsed since the date of such declaration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         has resigned or retired from the service of the Republic or of any statutory public authority or of the defence service, unless a period of three years has elapsed since the date of his resignation or retirement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        has been dismissed, removed or compulsorily retired from the service of the Republic or of any statutory public authority on the ground of corruption, unless a period of five years has elapsed since the date of such dismissal, removal or compulsory retirement;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        has been appointed on contract to the service of the Republic or of any statutory public authority or of the defence service immediately after his retirement from such service, unless a period of three years has elapsed since the expiry or termination of such contract;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         is holding or has resigned or retired or has been discharged from the chief executive post of any non-government organization, which receives grant or fund from any foreign state or organization, unless a period of three years has elapsed since such resignation retirement, or discharge;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         not being an independent candidate, has not been a member of a registered political party for three years:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this provision shall not apply to a nominated candidate of any political party during the period of three years from the date of its first registration with the Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        whether by himself or by any person or body of persons in trust for him or for his benefit or on his account or as a member of a Hindu undivided family, has any share or interest in a contract, not been a contract between a co-operative society and Government, for the supply of goods to, or for the execution of any contract or the performance of any services undertaken by Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         being a loanee, other than a loanee who has taken small loan for agricultural purposes, has defaulted in repaying before seven days from the day of submission of nomination paper any loan or an installment thereof taken by him from a bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       is a director of a company or a partner of a firm who has defaulted in repaying before seven days from the day of submission of nomination paper any loan or an installment thereof taken by him from a bank;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        personally has failed to pay the telephone, gas, electricity, water or any other bill of any service providing organization of the Government before seven days from the day of submission of nomination paper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        has been convicted as a war criminal by any national or international Court or Tribunal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation I.- “office of profit” means holding any office, post or position in the full-time service of the Republic or any statutory public authority or company in which government has more than 50% (fifty percent) share.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation II.- The disqualification under sub-clause (k) shall not apply to a person</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         where the share or interest in the contract devolves on him by inheritance or succession or as a legatee, executor or administrator, until the expiration of six months after it has so devolved on him or such longer period as the president may, in any particular case allow; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        where the contract has been entered into by or on behalf of a public company as defined in the Companies Act, 1994 (Act No.XVIII of 1994), of which he is a share-holder but is neither a director holding an office of profit under the company nor a managing agent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       where he is a member of Hindu undivided family and the contract has been entered into by any other member of that family in the course of carrying on a separate business in which he has no share or interest.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation III.- “bank” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any “bank company” as defined in Bank Company Act, 1991 (Act No.XIV of 1991);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Bangladesh Shilpa Rin Sangstha” established under Bangladesh Shilpa Rin Sangstha Order, 1972 (P.O.No. 128 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Bangladesh Shilpa Bank” established under Bangladesh Shilpa Bank Order, 1972 (P.O.No. 129 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation” established under Bangladesh House Building Finance Corporation Order, 1973 (P.O.No.17 of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Bangladesh Krishi Bank” established under Bangladesh Krishi Bank Order, 1973 (P.O.No. 27 of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Investment Corporation of Bangladesh” established under Investment Corporation of Bangladesh Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. No.XI of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Rajshahi Krishi Unnayan Bank” established under Rajshahi Krishi Unnayan Bank Ordinance, 1986 (Ord. No.LVIII of 1986);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Basic Bank Limited” (Bangladesh Small Industries and Commerce Bank Limited) established under Companies Act, 1994 (Act No.XVIII of 1994).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation IV.- “small loan for agricultural purposes” means all crops loan excepting tea, tobacco and includes short-term loan for development of fishery and marketing of agricultural produce and long-term loan for irrigation equipment, animal husbandry, development of fishery, agricultural equipment, nursery and horticulture, betel-leaf plantation, management of Jalmahal and for the purpose of producing silk worm, tuth tree, lakhkha tree, catechu tree, etc. the amount of which shall not exceed taka one lakh aggregating with interest and capital against every loan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation V.- A person or a company or a firm shall be deemed to have defaulted in repaying a loan or an installment thereof referred to in sub-clauses (l) and (m) of Article 12(1) if he or it is a defaulter within the meaning of the expression 'defaulter loanee' as defined in Bank-Company Act, 1991(Act 14 of 1991) and for financial institution, as defined by Bangladesh Bank under Financial Institution Act, 1993 (Act No. 27 of 1993). The list of defaulter may be obtained from CIB of Bangladesh Bank or from the concerned bank or financial institution.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation VI.- "financial institution" means a non-banking financial institution as defined in Financial Institution Act, 1993 (Act No. 27 of 1993).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation VII.- 'chief executive' referred to in sub-clause (i) of Article 12(1) means a person holding full time post of a chief executive of any non-government organization who receives monthly salary and other emoluments in that capacity.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every proposal shall be made by a separate nomination paper in the prescribed form which shall be signed by the proposer and the seconder and shall contain-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a declaration signed by the candidate that he has consented to the nomination and that he is not subject to any disqualification for being, or being elected as, a member; 28[ ***]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a declaration signed by the proposer and the neither of them has subscribed to any other nomination paper either as proposer or seconder 29[ ; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30[ (c) a declaration signed by the candidtate that he is not a candidate for more than three constituencies.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every nomination paper shall be delivered by the candidate, or his proposer or seconder, to the Returning Officer 31[ or the Assistant Returning Officer] who shall acknowledge the receipt of the nomination paper specifying the date and time of receipt.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32[ (3a)            Every nomination paper under clause (2) shall be delivered along with the following documents, namely-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in the case of an independent candidate, a list of signatures of one percent electors of the concerned constituency:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such list need not to be delivered if the independent candidate has previously been elected in any parliamentary election;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a certificate signed by the chairman or secretary or a person holding the same rank on behalf of the registered political party stating that the candidate has been nominated by that party:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any registered political party may primarily nominate more than one candidate and if more than one candidate are nominated, the name of one nominated candidate shall be sent to the Returning Officer in writing before the scrutiny of the nomination papers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3b)      Every nomination paper under clause (2) shall be delivered along with an affidavit signed by the candidate which shall include the following information and particulars, namely-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) an attested copy of the certificate of his highest educational qualification;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) whether at present he is accused of any criminal offence or not;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) whether he has any past criminal record, and, if any, the judgement of the case;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) description of his profession or business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) probable sources of his income;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) a statement of property or debt of his own or his dependents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) what promises he made before an election in which he was elected as a member in the past, and how many of those promises were fulfilled; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the amount of loan received by him alone, or jointly or by his dependents from any bank or financial institution, and the amount of loan received by him from any bank or financial institution as a Chairman, Managing Director or Director thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- “dependent” means the wife or husband of a candidate and includes son, daughter, father, mother, brother or sister of the candidate who are fully dependent upon him.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A person may be nominated in the same constituency by more than one nomination paper 33[ , and a nomination paper may be delivered to both the Returning Officer and the Assistant Returning Officer.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If any person subscribes to more than one nomination paper, all such nomination papers, except the one received first by the Returning Officer 34[ or the Assistant Returning Officer, as the case may be,] shall be void.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Returning Officer shall give a serial number to every nomination paper and endorse thereon the name of the person presenting it, and the date and time of its receipt, and inform such person of the time and place at which he shall hold scrutiny.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35[ (6a) The Assistant Returning Officer shall give a serial number to every nomination paper and endorse thereon the name of the person presenting it, and the date and time of its receipt, and inform such person of the time and place at which the Returning Officer shall hold scrutiny, and immediately after the time for receiving nomination paper is over, forward all the nomination papers received by him to the Returning Officer.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The Returning Officer shall cause to be affixed at some conspicuous place in his office a notice of every nomination paper received by him 36[ or received by the Assistant Returning Officer and forwarded to him under clause (6a)] containing particulars of the candidate and the names of the proposer and seconder as shown in the nomination paper.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) Subject to the provisions of clause (2), no nomination paper delivered under Article 12 shall be accepted unless-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a sum of Taka 37[ 38[ ten] thousand] is deposited in cash by the candidate or by any person on his behalf at the time of its delivery; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">39[ (b) it is accompanied by a receipt or a true copy thereof duly attested by a gazetted government servant showing that a sum as aforesaid has been deposited by the candidate or by any person on his behalf with the Returning Officer or the Assistant Returning Officer or at any Bank or at a Government Treasury or Sub-Treasury.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Not more than one deposit under clause (1) shall be required in the case of a person who has been nominated as a candidate by more than one nomination paper.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13A</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13A. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Order, no person may at the same time be a candidate for more than 40[ three] constituencies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">41[ ***]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If a person is at the same time a candidate for more than 42[ three] constituencies, all his nomination papers in respect of all the constituencies shall be void].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The candidates, their election agents, proposers and seconders, and one other person authorised in this behalf by each candidate may attend the scrutiny of nomination paper and the Returning Officer shall give them reasonable opportunity for examining all nomination papers 43[ delivered or forwarded to him under Article 12].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Returning Officer shall, in the presence of the persons attending the scrutiny under clause (1), examine the nomination papers and decide any objection raised by any such person to any nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Returning Officer may, either of his own motion or upon any objection, conduct such summary enquiry as he may think fit and reject a nomination paper if he is satisfied that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the candidate is not qualified to be elected as a member;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the proposer or the seconder is not qualified to subscribe to the nomination paper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        any provision of Article 12 or Article 13 has not been complied with; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the signature of the proposer or the seconder is not genuine:       Provided that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the rejection of a nomination paper shall not invalidate the nomination of a candidate by any other valid nomination paper;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the Returning Officer shall not reject a nomination paper on the ground of any defect which is not of a substantial nature and may allow any such defect to be remedied forthwith; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       the Returning Officer shall not enquire into the correctness or validity of any entry in the electoral roll.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Returning Officer shall endorse on each nomination paper his decision accepting or rejecting it 44[ ***] and shall 45[ ***] record a brief statement of the reason therefor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">46[ (5) If a candidate or any bank is aggrieved by the decision of the Returning Officer, he may prefer an appeal to the Commission within the prescribed period and any order passed on such appeal shall be final.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Returning Officer shall, after the scrutiny of nomination papers, prepare and publish in the prescribed manner a list of candidates who have been validly nominated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In case an appeal against rejection of a nomination paper has been accepted by the Commission, the list of validly nominated candidates shall be revised accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Any validly nominated candidate may, by notice in writing signed by him and delivered, on or before the withdrawal day, to the Returning Officer, either by such candidate in person or by an agent authorised in this behalf in writing by such candidate, withdraw his candidature.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A notice of withdrawal under clause (1) shall, in no circumstances, be open to recall or cancellation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On receiving a notice of withdrawal under clause (1), the Returning Officer shall, if he is satisfied that the signature on the notice is that of the candidate, cause a copy of the notice to be affixed at some conspicuous place in his office.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Returning Officer shall, on the day next following the withdrawal day prepare and publish in the prescribed manner a list of contesting candidates.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) If a validly nominated candidate who has not withdrawn his candidature dies, 47[ or if his candidature is cancelled under clause (2) of Article 91E,] the Returning Officer shall, by public notice, terminate the proceedings relating to that election.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where proceedings relating to an election have been terminated under clause (1), fresh proceedings shall be commenced in accordance with the provisions of this Order as if for a new election 48[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that it shall not be necessary for the other contesting candidates to file fresh nomination papers or make a further deposit under Article 13.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. Where the proceedings relating to nomination, scrutiny or withdrawal cannot, for reasons beyond the control of the Returning Officer, take place on the day appointed therefor, he may postpone or adjourn such proceedings and shall, with the approval of the Commission, by public notice fix another day for the proceedings so postponed or adjourned and, if necessary, also the day or days subsequent proceedings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) Where, after scrutiny under Article 14, only one person remains as a validly nominated candidate for election as a member from a constituency or where after withdrawal under Article 16 only one person is left as a contesting candidate, the Returning Officer shall, by public notice, declare such candidate to be elected to the seat:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if after scrutiny any candidate indicates that he intends to make an appeal under clause (5) of Article 14 against the rejection of his nomination paper, no person shall be declared elected uncontested until the period prescribed for filling such appeal has expired and no such appeal has been filed or, where an appeal is filed, until the disposal of such appeal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Returning Officer shall submit to the Commission a return of the election in respect of which he has made a declaration under clause (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Commission shall publish in the official Gazette the name of the returned candidate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) If there are more contesting candidates than one in respect of any constituency, the Returning Officer shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) allocate, in the case of a contesting candidate set up by a registered political party, the symbol reserved for that party by the Commission under this Order or the rules 49[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Commission may, on an application made to it in this behalf within three days after the publication of the notification under clause (1) of Article 11, allot one of the prescribed symbols to the candidate of a combination of two or more registered political parties who have agreed to set up joint candidates for election;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(aa) allocate, 50[ in the case of independent] contesting candidates, subject to any direction of the Commission, one of the prescribed symbols to each such contesting candidate; and in so doing shall, so far as possible, have regard for any preference indicated by the candidate; 51[ and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        publish in such manner as the Commission may direct the names of contesting candidates arranged in the alphabetical order specifying against each the symbol allocated to him 52[ .]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">53[ ***]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Returning Officer shall arrange to exhibit prominently at each polling station the name and symbol of each contesting candidate.          54[</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) A candidate may appoint a person qualified to be elected as a member to be his election agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The appointment of an election agent may, at any time, be revoked in writing by the candidate and, when it is so revoked or the election agent dies, another person may be appointed by the candidate to be his election agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When an election agent is appointed, the candidate shall send to the Returning Officer a notice in writing of the appointment containing the name, father's name and address of the election agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where no appointment of an election agent is made under this section, a candidate shall be deemed to be his own election agent and shall so far as the circumstances permit, be subject to the provisions of this Order both as a candidate and as an election agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. 55[ (1) The contesting candidate or his election agent, may, before the commencement of the poll, appoint for each polling booth of a polling station not more than one polling agent and shall give notice thereof in writing to the Presiding Officer.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The appointment of a polling agent under clause (1) may at any time be revoked by the candidate or his election agent and, when it is so revoked or the polling agent dies, another person may be appointed by the candidate or the election agent to be a polling agent; and a notice of such appointment shall be given to the Presiding Officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">56[ (3) The Presiding Officer shall not accept a polling agent unless he wears an identity card granted by the person appointing him containing his name and the name of the candidate for whom he is appointed as a polling agent.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. Where any act or thing is authorised by this Order to be done in the presence of the candidate, an election agent or a polling agent, the failure of such person to attend at the time and place appointed for the purpose shall not invalidate any act or thing otherwise validly done 57[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as the case may be, shall, as far as practicable, endeavour to ensure the attendance of the said person at the time of doing the said act or thing:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that, if a candidate or his election agent or polling agent is found absent at the time of doing the said act or thing, the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as the case may be, shall immediately try to find out the reason of such absence and record the fact and communicate it to the Commission together with his comments thereon, and shall endeavour to ensure such attendance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. The Returning Officer shall, subject to any direction of the Commission, fix the hours during which the poll shall be taken and give public notice or the hours so fixed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The Presiding Officer of a polling station shall stop the poll and inform the Returning Officer that he has done so if-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the poll at the polling station is, at any time, so interrupted or obstructed for reason beyond the control
